There is adequate parking right in front of the shop.

The only downside is there is no toilet for customers.
Cute and clean, staff is friendly and accommodating. Good coffee.

Really nice fast food joint, spicy noodles are actually spicy and flavorful. However the shrimp tasted not that fresh.

The milk tea is nice, toppings are good, boba is chewy. A bit on the sweeter side.

Nice atmosphere and location, pretty good value, overall a nice place for a quick meal or snack.
Great food and drinks. Will come again. Noodles are very tasty. Salt coffee was perfect and so was the bubble tea. Thank you.

Amazing tropical teas and milk teas.  My favorite was the lemon tea with orange slices. Perfect mix of sweetness and lemon flavor.

Tonight I had lychee and it is just as delicious and flavorful as the lemon tea.

They always put a nice amount of fruit into each cup, so you have something to munch on as you enjoy the drink.

Highly recommend as a chill spot for a break from Vietnam hectic life and to hangout with friends after a busy day.
Quick service, delicious food and beverage, casual setting
Nice place to chill out with friends.  Delicious food, great drinks. And Instagrammable deco.

I went back and explained that there is no milk in the milk tea that I ordered and they said that it is powdered milk (which I still struggle to believe as it looked and tasted like water with sugar) and there is a different one on the menu that has real milk in it priced slightly higher. I said that what they gave me is not what I ordered. The staff made no attempt to correct the issue only saying that next time I should get a different one. I won‚Äôt be going back again. That is not how you do customer service.

Bought two cones. Ice cream itself was very grainy. Not good.
One of the cones was broken so ice cream leaked out. They tried to cover it up by putting extra napkins over it. Only noticed it a few minutes later when we had already left with the food.

Sign outside said cone for 8, while price on menu was 10. Make up your minds.

Don't waste your time here. Just go to McDonald's or KFC close by if you want a cheap cone.

While trying to order, I tried to ask the staff to clarify something about the drinks to me. Out of 6 people working there, 0 were speaking english. I know that I am just a visitor in Vietnam, however, I assumed that they know at least colors.

The drink itself was not good at all. Even though I had 0% of sugar, it was still really sweet.

0x31752ee44664537f:0x537a0aaf58bfed42.comment: The milk tea is okay for the price. The owners are very nice. The line is very long every day haha. This is a really local local milk tea place
The flavor is very close to Taiwan Milk tea. And it is not very expensive and affordable. Cheers!

This Taiwanese milk tea shop always has a long line.
You have to wait 5-15 minutes before you can buy a drink.
The taste is on par with trendy milk tea chains, but the price is less than half that, which is why it's so popular.
If you find waiting boring, you should go to a chain shop.
Take out tapioca milk tea with very good price, a lot of options to choose. Good taste but quite weak tea flavour.
Worth to wait 10 minutes for a cup of Taiwan Milktea. Kind of the best, in the low price segment.
Super Nice, let's wait in line !!! If you get luck it takes you 15 mins stand in line.

Store is only one seller ~ it may be characterised of this store. So this store is not apply for one person (because boss will remind if you let your motorbike near store so crowd - police can come to remind ^^) or you need a quickly to buy and move :)
However, if you like to discovery with people you can book order by App or stand in line and wait to buy :) after wait near 20 minutes, finally come me :), i may understand reason why store crowd because the boss of store is happy, and price is not high ~ this is one of the store of Milk tea the first of Saigon :)
The weather is hot but you havd to stand in lind out store (only take a way) so it really hot on this days so i just let it 3 with atmosphere :) although people is crowd ^^
Hope i have time and patient to back and stand in line to wait and buy again ^^ this is a good memories to me ^^
Super long line and drink was average. Takeout only.
Cheap and tasty drinks. I was told it‚Äôs run by 2 taiwanese which is quite legit when it comes to boba. Quick and lovely service. Will definitely come back
Very nice drink and cheap.

Long live milk tea shop.
Tradition taste.
Reasonable price.
Affordable, tasty milk tea. The only drawback is that service is very slow, customers always have to line up and wait.
Very good prices and decent quality. It is cheap but I've never had any stomach problems.

Always have to arrange in line
In my opinion : too sweet and too condensed
Highly recommend for who really love sweet
Friendly services
Good price and quality of drink. First come first serve ( very rare for crowded take- away drink)
Cheap, Yummy, HQ and it is hard to find a Milktea as cheap as this but also so good at quality

Best milk tea with light flavor
Not too much sugar
Need to queue
They offer the milk tea. And the price is so amazing.
Acceptable prices, good milk tea
Amazing milk tea with cheap price. Must try!

This milk tea shop offers a nostalgic taste of childhood. The tea has a gentle yet fragrant flavour, perfect for those who prefer a subtler taste. Take-out only, the shop is staffed by a friendly and professional team who are deaf. When you pull up on your motorcycle, they will greet you with a menu, notepad, and pen. Simply choose your drink, write it down, and send it back. They will let you know the price while preparing your order, and accept both cash and bank transfers.

While the ordering process might seem unfamiliar at first, especially for new customers, the staff's meticulous preparation ensures every drink is a delicious experience. Do not hesitate to give it a try.

This bubble tea caf√© is a true gem for anyone craving a taste of nostalgia. The flavors take you back to the classic bubble tea experience, with rich, authentic options that remind you of how bubble tea used to be. Their original selections are a refreshing break from trendy spins, staying true to the timeless taste that bubble tea lovers grew up with. If you‚Äôre looking for that nostalgic sip, this is the place to be!

A little second-generation milk tea shop.

The second-generation owner is hard of hearing and has two deaf employees, so when you go there, please write out your order (unless you know sign language üôÇüôÉ).

There is one price whether you order the medium or the large size. They make the tea themselves; the toppings they buy ready-made.

They have a selection of drinks which are no sugar (‚Äòkh√¥ng ƒë∆∞·ªùng‚Äô) and another selection which are low sugar (‚Äò√≠t ƒë∆∞·ªùng‚Äô). Ask them which drinks these are, as the menu does not indicate that clearly.

Very limited seating and motorbike parking, so customers are almost exclusively takeout; you can sit on your bike and they will bring out an umbrella for you (for both rain and sun protection) and take your order.

Everyone is very friendly and prompt with the orders.
It may not be the best and comfy one, but the quality is unmatched so far imo
It's good but I wish they have soy milk or oat milk options
Should try once if you wanna try the childhood milk tea taste ü´°
Happy üóøüê≤

We were recommended by a local to try this place out because we haven‚Äôt had broken rice for a long time and really missed it a lot. This place truly did not disappoint ü§©

The food was very simple but really hearty and they taught us how to make the sauce for the meal to be more enjoyable ü•π if they didn‚Äôt teach us about the sauce, we‚Äôd have just eaten the dish on its own - the simple sauce truly elevated the dish.

Really glad to have tried this place and we would be back.

If you want to try authentic broken rice with good quality of food, try this one. I'm a big fan of "C∆°m T·∫•m" and i love the flavor of every dishes of this restaurant. Home-made, owner is so friendly and kind üòä

If you‚Äôre craving authentic Vietnamese flavors, C∆°m T·∫•m @ 2 S√ÄI G√íN is a spot you shouldn‚Äôt miss.

Special Bacon Grill was so juicy and tasty can‚Äôt miss‚ú®üôèüèª

Amazing people, with an amazing 11 year old boy who serves/speaks English like a native. Definitely no problem getting food here. Besides that, food was amazing and very beautifully presented. Props to the Dad on the grill. He knows what he is doing!!!

It was so good. The food was delicious, the staff was friendly. I had so much fun with my beloved wife and simply saying, must try place for sure. I wish they gave bigger portions but for the price we are paying it is understanding and we still loved it cause we went to other places to try as well.
very accommodating when I mentioned I couldn‚Äôt eat pork and came by a few times to give us extra sauce and toppings!

Not sure why this place has a 4.9 rating. I had pork skin and egg loaf. They were surprised that I didn't have pork chop. The pork skin didn't have much ground rice in it and the egg loaf was not firm. Iced tea and wet towel were free. Staff was very friendly.
Delicious food and drinks! The meat was just right and marinated perfect! The owner was also very friendly, loved the service and the overall atmosphere
Been to this place on my Vietnam Trip, the space was quite small however the food was good, very clean and the service was great, the owner was really nice, highly recommended
Really good and filling food, attentive service
I am a foreigner and I really recommend it. It is warm comforting food. Very authentic
Good food, accommodating owners
Amazing service, treated like a family meal
Great food! Will come back :)
Good service. Good food
Good food and Service. Thank you üòÑ
Great experience and great food
ok
Delicious!^^

0x31752f3971e314ef:0x78138e2fe4e745dd.comment: This has to be THE BEST place in Ho Chi Minh City for com tam. The food is insanely delicious. The pork is savoury yet sweet, marinated perfectly. All the ingredients are locally sourced from the Mekong Delta and you can really taste the quality of the ingredients. We tried a number of different dishes, all amazing. Definitely a place worth visiting in Saigon. Check out our channel for a full review of our experience: Hungry Two Travel.

Our first time trying c∆°m t·∫•m (‚Äúbroken rice‚Äù) and it was excellent! I had the signature style with a soft drink for less than $100,000 VND! The restaurant was tucked down a side street and was an authentic experience with many locals enjoying the food which is cooked freshly outside. The service was exceptional and food brought out quickly. Highly recommended for authentic Vietnamese c∆°m t·∫•m!

A delightful plate of broken rice bursting with local flavors. Got to enjoy it shoulder to shoulder with the locals on tiny stools, truly part of the charm. Affordable, authentic, and full of heart.

Highly recommended if you‚Äôre looking for your first taste of real Vietnamese broken rice. I can‚Äôt imagine a more perfect or heartfelt introduction to it.

I recently visited a cozy com tam suon cha shop, and it was a delightful experience! The broken rice was perfectly cooked, with a satisfying texture that paired wonderfully with the tender, flavorful grilled pork chop. The cha (egg meatloaf) was rich and savory, adding a nice balance to the dish. The accompanying fish sauce was tangy and well-seasoned, elevating every bite. The shop had a welcoming vibe, with quick service and affordable prices. Highly recommend it for a quick, authentic Vietnamese meal!

The local street foods to be recommended.

Location next to university.

Various food selection for pork lover.
With the great sweetened fishsouce

If you‚Äôre craving **authentic Vietnamese comfort food**, this C∆°m T·∫•m is a **must-try**. It‚Äôs hearty, flavorful, and utterly satisfying. Pair it with an **iced jasmine tea (tr√† ƒë√°)** for the full experience.

This is probably the best Com Tam I've had in Saigon. The chop is large, very meaty and nicely seasoned and grilled. The trung hep served with it is thick and full of mushrooms. I ordered the dac biet and the portion size was very good.  This isn't the cheapest com tam around but the food is excellent.

Great and amazing place to have breakfast. It‚Äôs not expensive and the service is really good. We had rice with egg and pork chop/sausage. It lacked a bit of salt, but you can easily do that by yourself.

Definitely cheap and good lunch option, very crowded with office people during lunch hour and I supposed this is so popular; i finished the whole bowl of com tam being a tourist!l (and i added a fried egg)

Stuffed bitter gourd soup was great too!

Com tam was just ok. It's immediately noticeable that the pork chop isn't freshly grilled (at least at the hour I went) and the seasoning was too light for my taste.

The outdoor patio is nicer than a street food stall but you'll sacrifice some of the flavor for it.

I absolutely loved the broken rice at Tiem Com 67 Tam! Everything was so flavorful and cooked just right. I still miss the taste and would definitely come back to Ho Chi Minh just to eat here again. The restaurant is small and cozy, with a local vibe, and the staff were really friendly. If you love authentic Vietnamese broken rice dishes, this place is a must-try!

This gem hiding in an alley is Every Com Tam lover‚Äôs dream!  It‚Äôs a family business, dad grills the pork in front of the shop fresh, mum makes the eggs and pork bits, son is serving and managing the business. (He speaks good English!) They have all the essential items Like pork skin and egg that you can add on! Most importantly they are clean and has nice atmosphere. The herbal tea is nice too! Highly recommend!

Located in an alley of an otherwise busy street, the broken rice with shredded pork was great. Got a small bowl of soup with it which also tasted great. The portion might have been a bit small to my liking, but overall a clean place with attentive service and reasonable prices considering the location, will come back when I am around.

Food was so dang GOOD. Asian parents were really happy since it felt like a simple, comforting and delicious meal. I had the pork with Vietnamese sausage, along with some additions (pork skin and meat loaf of sorts) from my hubby‚Äôs plate. Service was great. Defo recommend!
We got the signature dish, and we enjoyed the simplicity and flavors of this local dish. The atmosphere is very cute. They offered us a small bowl of soup for free which was delicious.

Great com tam! Pork was tender, flavorful, and had a nice grilled flavor. Everything else was super yummy and for the price, it's a steal! It's definitely not a tourist trap and would definitely recommend this place if you want something filling and delicious.

Super cozy place, everything translated into English, portions are not biggest but enough for decent meal. Super cheap and staff is really nice and willing to help.
We found our new quick meal place in Central Saigon.
For sure will be back

Absolutely flavorful pork. Must get the pork over rice and try adding on the pork belly if you enjoy fatty pork belly. Honestly one of my favorite dishes the entire trip. ü§§ü§§ü§§

Cash only!

Probably the best grilled pork chop rice I had in Sai Gon! Portion was just about right. Would have been even better if the chops were hot and fresh off the grill‚Ä¶ soup was also very tasty!!
Service could have been a bit better but will let that slide because of how tasty the chops were!!

Food is good. The grilled pork is tasty and well marinated with nice smoky smell. First time trying broken rice. Ordered the bittergourd soup and was good. The texture is soft. The waiters are friendly and welcoming. There are the outdoor and air-conditioned parts.

0x31752f74b75f363d:0xe703a1c7463f268e.comment:
This is a really good broken rice restaurant in District 1 - Ho Chi Minh City .

Their rib grilling recipe is almost perfect, the ribs are marinated with delicious flavors and just the right amount of time, allowing all the flavors to permeate the entire rib, creating a dish that is imbued with Vietnamese culture, pure and original.

I am very satisfied with all the toppings here, egg rolls, fried duck eggs, dried fish, fried pate, even pickled cabbage, everything is very neat.

The fish sauce here is really great, the seaweed soup that comes with it is also delicious.

All this makes for a wonderful dish, I highly recommend it and you should definitely try it.

This unassuming com tam place is awesome. So authentic, the pork chop was huge - the chilli, so spicy but tasty. Get the extra egg topping üôè 10/10 loved it would return. Only a quick grab ride from district 1, totally worth it. Love the music - vibes are top tier.

The c∆°m s∆∞·ªùn was absolutely delicious, perfectly grilled and full of flavor! But what really blew me away was the fish sauce. Hands down one of the best I‚Äôve had with c∆°m s∆∞·ªùn‚Äîbalanced, bold, and addictive. I guarantee you‚Äôre going to come back to eat at this place again because it‚Äôs that good!

The rip was perfectly cooked with crispy exterior and tender inside, the egg york is chewy, meat pie was good too, the fish sauce is thick and sweet. All of it mixed together enhances flavors. Staffs are so nice and kind, make us feel warm and inviting. We were so sorry that the waitress spilled hot seaweed soup on her hand, thanksfully it was not bad. We didn‚Äôt have to wait, the service was super fast and the food was still hot when served.

Super fantastic broken rice with a wide variety of toppings! We got a chicken one and a ribs one. The meats were tender and caramelized to perfection, and the sides and fried eggs were divine. Service was really attentive and the food came out hot and very quickly. Great fish sauce that wasn‚Äôt too salty, and well balanced. The space is small but homey, and it‚Äôs not too hard to find in the alley, as it is bright yellow. Motorbike Parking is a bit cramped, but available.
Best c∆°m t·∫•m in all of Saigon. Smoky, juicy, well seasoned pork
What a great find. Great food, good service and reasonable prices. Some of the best pork ribs I've had in a long time. Just go there. You won't be disappointed

We came because of the great reviews but left disappointed. The meat was salty and the fish sauce tasted very average. The dishes didn‚Äôt look appetising, and the most expensive one (the ribs) was mostly bone and fat‚Äîyou had to scrape off bits of meat from an approximately 20 cm long rib üòµ‚Äçüí´

The establishment offers a delectable rendition of ‚Äòc∆°m t·∫•m,‚Äô or broken rice, characterized by its exceptional taste and superior quality. Notably, the menu features several distinctive dishes, including the intriguing ‚Äòpate √°p ch·∫£o.‚Äô Situated within the first alley on the right-hand side of Tr·∫ßn ƒê√¨nh Xu Street‚Äîwhen approached from the direction of Tr·∫ßn H∆∞ng ƒê·∫°o‚Äîthe restaurant exudes a cozy ambiance. However, it is worth noting that the spatial dimensions of the venue are somewhat compact.

Their signature ribs are very good and it came out super git freshly grilled. Even the side dishes and toopings are much better than many other com tam places. I didn‚Äôt even have to use the dipping sauce because the ribs were marinated perfectly already. It‚Äôs a great budget replacement if you are craving for bbq ribs.
A cute little place to have a great BBQ rice. The meat was tasty and juicy. And the fried egg was so nice with a bit crispy edge! Highly recommend!

I was passing by and stopped to see what they had in the very front glassed-case where some of their food was on display. One server was behind the glassed food case, while another was on the side waiting for prey to rip-off.

Very professional and courteous he was, as he answered questions I had pertaining to their glass-case food selections. He even said: "You try some?" Where he scooped-up some of the shredded pork skins I inquired about.

I never had anything like those before. I'll have to say, quite good with a smokey nuance to them as well. I asked: "How much?" He gave me a very good price of 38k vnd. So I took some to go - along with (he claimed they were at least) 'fried rice too.' They weren't fried - just the everyday boiled, bland and tacky rice!

Total price was a little over $3 usd, but of course, this was vnd at the current rates, as they accepted only cash. So I'm searching for a vnd bill to pay. He's watching of course. And I had trouble locating the proper vnd bill. The vnd currency is in very large amounts with many, many zeroes behind the main character! It's insane how the inflation is so far over the helm there in Vietnam!

So I had to use a large 200k vnd bill. He knew I was a new foreigner there (2 days) and he pulled a fast haul on me  with skill and said: "Give me other 1k in wallet, I give back 2k vnd." In all, I got taken for a little over $5-6usd in current exchange values, when I checked after I got to my hotel.

This is another rip-off restaurant to avoid, as they'll overwhelm you with service and charm. All while they're anticipating your unfamiliarity regarding vnd, snatch and quickly hide the bill you gave them.

So was I to blame? Yes I suppose. However, I was at other great restaurants closer to my hotel and not only did they excell in superior customer service, but they were honest and had good morals intact. Not that server-clown here: pure evil.

FYI: There were only 2 people inside the minute place too: walk away! I recommend you go elsewhere as there are plenty in the district 1 area of Ho Chi Minh City.

I think there's a reason why 5 stars were given by everyone else. This is my new favourite com tam place. The pork rib was super tender and soft, it was just perfection on a bone. The chicken and ribs were super tasty too, I have zero complaints.

Foreigners don't have to come here. They prioritize Vietnamese. Even if you ordered earlier. They will serve those who came later than you first. I used to forgive such behavior. But it happens all the time. I'm tired of putting up with it. The food is delicious. If you don't want to wait. Better order online.
Good food... I like the pork rib and the honey glazed pork. The way you can order the base and pick add-ons is great. One of the better places I have been too.

The BBQ pork ribs & chicken are amazingly flavoured, the shredded pork skin mixed with pork slices are fresh. Those are the best recommended selections to have overthere. On top of that, I have always felt pleasant with the service they provide, all the waitors are super friendly and they do observe well to make sure they would give extra comfort & hospitality to their customers.

Delicious local Vietnamese cuisine - broken rice. Probably need a local to bring you to this place. Food is delicious and you have a choice of pork or ribs that you can choose from. Definitely need to order the rice with the fermented or pickled vegetables.

Classical, inexpensive (35k to max 50k) C∆°m T·∫•m at Di √öt, is a simple, still encompassing and tasty rice dish with a selection of different meats, tofus, eggs,  meat cake.
Food and Atmosphere for s fast lunch are perfect.
(September 2023)

I try the signature pork ribs broken rice, it‚Äôs tender and taste perfectly to my taste buds. Wanted to order the whole set with eggs and everything but it was not available today. Still a very hearty meal!
Food is amazing. Great place for broken rice. Pork chops were amazingly marinated.

0x31752ff77dc3767b:0x6c2088cda55173ba.comment:
I had grilled pork broken rice (C∆°m t·∫•m s∆∞·ªùn, 25k) and added steamed egg loaf (ch·∫£, +5k). Self-serve cold tea is free. The food was okay, but I wouldn‚Äôt recommend the steamed egg loaf. About as cheap as it gets.

- 2025/10/22

Very nice place to have Com Tam.

You can see the marinated meat being barbecued in from of you, and it tasted flavorful and tender.

The dish was only 30K for a quite fulfilling portion.

The service is super fast.

This was super delicious and no frills - there's no english menu here, so your best bet is to show them a photo and ask for "same same". Two pork chops and an egg cost 30k, and you get free iced tea to sip on.

Highly recommended if you can bear the heat of eating on the street (and if not, probably best to come super early in the morning or after peak heat hours)

Delicious c∆°m t·∫•m s∆∞·ªùn served up quickly and at very reasonable prices. The owner was friendly, and her son, I believe, was kind enough to get me a coffee from around the corner. Highly recommended!

Super good C∆°m t·∫•m ( broken rice ).
It was super cheap (50.000 / p)
Very nice food for the price.
Great com tam, broken seasoned rice with grilled porkfilet and veggies. Eat on the street, nice people, local prices - also for us tourists. And good free cold ice tea. Five stars.
friendly owner, reasonable price, must try
Very good and very affordable

0x31752fc4b07ba49d:0xa571105058415d9.comment: Best com tam we‚Äôve had so far. Grilled pork was nice and tender, reasonable price. Seller can speak English. Had twice in a day.

At first I think the pork will be dry, hard and to sweet. But after eat there, i think the pork is very good. The meat is tender, not too dry and the taste has sweet but still has savory flavour. The price is not expensive compared to the portion and taste. The place is only inside small road with open air with dining table, but it was pretty clean. I would recommend to eat here if you go to saigon.

10/10 food. Great little local spot. Cheap prices and always busy. You could probably order anything on the menu and it would be good. We got the best seller pork ribs and came back again twice for the same thing. Food arrives less than 10 mins after ordering.
Yum! Delicious pork ribs with rice and egg. Street food, with some tables. Seemed clean. Definitely worth a try!

This was our first meal in Ho Chi Minh, mostly because we got in kind of late night and this place is open 24 hours. Nonetheless, what I learned was some of the best hidden gems are served out of some sketchy looking alleys üòÖ

So many people were ordering takeaway or trying to get a seat here, so many of them locals. That's how I knew, this place was legit.

They specialize in broken rice with grilled pork, and they're absolute masterclasses at it. Chef's kiss, definitely try it, it's not only a very Vietnamese experience to eat in an alley, but it's also a steal of a price.
Cost spot, tucked inside an alleyway. The iced Kamquat tea was super refreshing. Meat and egg loaf were delicious and just an all round satisfying meal that‚Äôs wallet friendly.

Most succulent, flavorful pork, a hidden! Really great dishes, and pretty big menu, too. Fairly priced. Its hidden in a little alleyway, and its nice to sit down there. They also do takeout. Definitely a must visit if you're in HCM!
A nice meal to try in the morning. A full proportion meal that gives you a good boost of energy. I like the pork and the shredded pork skin.

My first meal here. Authentic sitting on the plastic stools and sharing a table.

The staff was very helpful even when I'm shy and can't speak the language.

The lively Bui Vien location might contribute to the crowds of this eatery, but in terms of taste, I do not rate it much. As someone who enjoys the flavour of Southern cuisine, I inherently like dishes with a touch of sweetness, but I found the pork chops and belly here to be excessively sweet. The marinade caramelises the meat to the point of charring. The meat is not traditionally grilled over charcoal, but fried in a pan filled with oil. For visitors seeking an authentic Vietnamese broken rice dish, I would recommend considering choosing other eateries in the surrounding area for a better culinary experience.

Eating com tam (broken rice) inside an alley! Ordered the full set (can't remember the name), was about VND 60,000. Pork meat is nice, flavorful and there's so many things on your plate!

Although the seller can't speak English really well, but the ordering went smoothly~

For the price, it was WORTH IT!
The rice was fragrant, and the pork belly was superb as well as tender. Overall, the pricing was reasonable for the portion.

I was very sceptical when it took nearly 20 min for com tam, but

Food: I'd give it 6/5 if I could. One of the best com tam I've had. Noted that I was also drunk so that might have enhanced the flavour, still though, huge wow. So good I forgot to take photo lmao

Service: slow as hell. I wonder if they were spending all that time catching the pig.

Atmosphere: A shady looking stall in front of a shady looking alley, as local as you can get
A small stall selling pork with broken rice, one of the Northern Vietnam food you have to try. The meat was good and I can taste the seasoning well. It was good. Only accept payment in cash.
The best broken rice, pork chop, egg we‚Äôve had with good prices too
Tucked away but the rice, sauce and pork were great. Only let down for me was the cold egg and the meatloaf which wasn‚Äôt my favorite. Would come back in a heartbeat for the rice and meat.

Authentic street food. Don‚Äôt let the appearance of the shop put you off from trying an amazing plate of food. One of the tastiest spots we stumbled upon our trip. Great experience and amazing Com Tam. A must try!

***Pork jerky***
I am not sure understanding why this place has such a high rating. I personally don‚Äôt mind eating in the alley. The pork chop provided to me was so dry it could be misconstrued for a pork jerky. I took two bites and left the rest alone. The rice and condiments were ok. Since there are so many good reviews I may be just an unlucky one.
Food was delicious. Came back for again for another Com Tam on our trip. The B√† Roi was also very good as a side dish.

Menu: They only have porks and fried eggs.
Taste: It tastes amazing nonetheless, a bit oily and fat.
Price: Big portions, near the city central. It's fair for the portions and for the location.

0x31752faf236547ef:0x7dbb32100ec46825.comment: Goodness they allowed us to bring in the food from opposite. Their Com Tam is delicious, ordered the combo that comes with meat patty and pork skin. Personally and my queen we would opt out from the pork skin, the grilled pork is already a 100. We ordered Sombersby and a black glutinous rice yoghurt too. Overall a satisfying meal

Horrible Experience.
Rice with one piece of small pork meat is 60,000VND + TAX 8%. Normal local price is 30,000(VND) with No TAX,
Too noisy and no manner to customer. Serving time tooks long more then 25minute, finally I asked to take out as like a 7-11 meal kits.
Be careful, Now it's price up and be charging TAX. What the hack! TRY TO REAL LOCAL Restaurants, This place is FAKE.

I go with my family. The restaurant is located near the walking street in the centre of District 1. The dish is appetising and delicious. The price makes me quite satisfied. We went to the restaurant in the evening and there were a lot of foreign tourists

The broken rice is quite delicious, the fish sauce is fragrant, the ribs are well seasoned, the pork belly and eggs are delicious but the price is too expensive, more suitable for Western customers than for our customers.

Went here last month and had my first broken rice. I got the set meal with grilled pork chop, shredded pork skin, and a meat patty. The food was okay‚Äîpork chop was pretty good, and the sauce complemented it well. The meat patty was just alright, but I didn‚Äôt like the shredded pork skin. The place is clean, the staff is friendly, and the food came out fast. Prices are super reasonable.
C∆°m t·∫•m done right! The grilled pork is cooked fresh right in front of you, and the n∆∞·ªõc ch·∫•m is perfecto‚Äîperfectly balanced and full of flavor.

Came here for lunch on a friend's recommendation, and we were super happy we did. The food was really tasty, the staff was friendly, and it was very reasonably priced. We both got the broken rice with an egg, a pork chop, plus I added a meat patty to mine. Both were very delicious.  The pork chop was grilled by an aunty right outside. The eggs and rice were cooked perfectly! Don't miss the sweet fish sauce situation on the table.

Seriously, what the hell is this, now charging 8% Tax only for Foreigner??? What a scam! On principle, that the last time I eat there. It's definitely not about the money, it's about Principle. And I'm here very often and ate there and ordered a lot before. If you're a Foreigner, don't encourage this dishonest place. There is plenty of fantastic and honest Vietnamese locals with great businesses all around that are not treating us Foreigner with such disrespect and racism. Again, on Principle, never again. Just with me, they lost several months of scamming Foreigner with their dishonest taxes.

Gotta say I was happy with the food (some broken rice and grilled chicken), until I asked for napkins, and one of the waiters told me that I had to use the ones provided for an extra 3000 dong each. On top of this, when I was paying at the till, I got charged an extra 8% VAT despite this was not written on the menu. Moreover, the woman at the till tried to charge me an extra 1000 dong to round up the bill in excess.
I know this is not crazy money for most travellers and tourists, but being charged hidden fees is something unacceptable and unethical.
There are definitely better places around.

Great broken rice and clean restaurant. I guess it is pricey compared to local price but reasonable for tourist. The menu has updated so slightly more pricey now. For 2 broken rice + 1 beer we paid around 220k

Delicious food. However, take into account to add to the prices in the menu the VAT since they will add it to your bill at the end, which was a surprise since it is not the practice in Vietnam. They also charge for the wet tissue, it's not much but it is not nice to have the surprise at the end

Very welcoming atmosphere for tourists! The Eggs, Chinese sausage, and shredded pork skin plate was amazing!  The staff was great at helping me decide on the perfect dish!  BEST meal I‚Äôve had in Ho Chi Minh City!
taste alright. succulent pork. small portion for the price which I can understand. It's in the middle of the "actions" in SGN. Many seatings and clean shop.

Would definitely recommend this place. Everything we ordered tasted amazing and the portions were great for the price. If you‚Äôre in the area and in the mood for some bomb rice plates, you should definitely check this place out!

Seems a bit overrated and overpriced. Wasn't bad broken rice just not anything special. Also they'll put the dessert on your table even if you don't order it and charge you if you touch it without realising. Just fyi.

Food was great ,lady cooking it was very nice .
But the waitress had some attitudeproblem , not very freindly at all , she treated other customers with a smile, she didn't make us feel welcome at all

0x31752f8f5eae1f51:0x2d972c10b08f6456.comment:
Visited as a tourist and I‚Äôd rate it around 7.5/10. The food was decent (though the broken rice here wasn‚Äôt as good as other spots I‚Äôve tried). Service is friendly, and the place feels more suitable for solo diners or couples since it‚Äôs quite busy and rushed.

Prices are very reasonable at 55‚Äì60k VND in District 1, so no complaints there. I‚Äôd call it a local food vendor with decent quality and good value , just don‚Äôt expect too much.

My dad love the bittergourd soup he had in the morning. I searched around and found this place. Even though the taste losses out to the morning place, but it was still decent! Ordered com tam suon trung (broken rice with grilled pork chop and fried egg) as well~

Super good especially if you wanna eat like a local. Ate twice here and the food never disappointed. I always picked #4 with an extra order of egg. Highly recommend for those who wanna experience Com tam!

If you want authentic Vietnamese dinner, this is it. Don‚Äôt expect English language service, just point and get.
I sat down and really enjoyed a pork chop delight cooked over charcoal.
Really inexpensive as it is local food.

Had their soup noodles here for dinner. Very crowded place popular with locals. The soup noodles were tasty but it‚Äôs a weird taste in the sense they mix pork slices with pork liver and a shrimp. It‚Äôs like a meat broth but with a tinge of seafood flavour. The place is full and are mostly locals having their meals. Very busy place to eat. In all I enjoyed my meal.
I had the Com tam with a fried egg and it was very nice and reasonably priced. The pork chop was grilled over a charcoal barbecue.
Absolutely delicious pork and shredded rice. The service is very efficient. You need to arrive early as it is quite popular.

The best com tam in Vietnam has to been eaten out of tourist areas! This place ticks all the boxes - delicious, reasonable price and most importantly, service is fast too.

The only barrier is that the waiter here speaks very limited English which is hard for those who wants to request for additional add ons.

Pretty good com tam and even better bitter melon soup. This place is a slightly larger than many other com tam places and this place also seems to sell other dishes like braised fish and more. You can park your scooter right outside here and this street has so many other local restaurants as well.

The com tam suon trung (fried egg and pork chop broken rice) was a surprisingly good find for only VND 40.000. I especially loved the crispy shredded pork skin. However, the accompanying soup was incredibly bland, and the pork chop was not quite as sweet as I would have preferred.
Vietnam broken rice, must try. Grilled pork is moisture and soft. Well packaged.
Very local environment. Paid 55k for com tam. Meat is not juicy enough. Have tried better ones elsewhere.

Service was quick.food was freshly made. Waitress spoke English.  Had the Com Tam pork with egg very tasty even more so with the sweet fish sauce
Came here second time for the BBQ chicken which was cooked to perfection. The skin was seasoned well and crispy whe the meat was juicy and tender.
Unfortunately the chicken is only available at dinner.
Seriously good and cheap com tam, with delicious grilled pork. Super easy as only thing on the menu and had a giant kumquat tea to wash it down with.

Tasty! Just passing by but i saw so many locals eat here. So, i just join them and never regret. Its only 52K vnd for the grilled meat and something like pork satay. I will have my lunch here tomorrow!!
Very authentic Saigon broken rice. Bonus point: the meat was not over-sweetened and had a very nice charcoal flavour.

Amazing Com Tam!
The grilled smokey charred porkchop were üòåüëå divine, crispy fatty juiciness

About 50k/pax filling and satisfying
nothing special. quite normal.  average street food.
Normal Broken rice you can get pretty much everywhere in Saigon. This is the place normal working man go to after a long day of work. It cheap, fast and filling, what else do you want?
One of the best Com Suon ever tried. The service is good and the price is reasonable for the large portions (we paid ~170k vnd for the whole meal which we could barely finish).

0x31752f6a99502683:0xf4b1d1cabb7008cb.comment: Best food I've had in Vietnam! The guys can speak English better than me and are really helpful . The relationship price/quality is excellent.
Classic com tam with huge portions. One of the best in the city. The family that owns it is quite friendly as well and speak decent English.

One of the best Com Tam I've ever had. If you only eat com tam once in HCMC, don't miss this.  The pork chop was thick, juicy and had a really smokey flavour.  Lots of rice and the sunnyside egg on top was perfect.  Highly recommend.

üá¶üá∫ AUS Tourist Review üá¶üá∫

Was recommended this place by a local and it did not disappoint! Great selection of food from a cart to choose from which you eat next door in a seating area. There are chilli's and other condiments to enhance your eating experience. Easily top 2 on my list of eating places for Ho Chi Minh.
Amazingly tasting food and the service was quick and efficient. Highly recommend üëçüèΩ

Best com tam in town

Owners are super nice and the food checks all the boxes. A must try !

Small restaurant in a busy small street (almost alley like).Don't make the mistake I made ... by going into the first building if you come from the left side of the store (small scolding from the auntie). There's three and the dining area is in the third.
Ordering can be challenging and there was only one person that spoke some English.
Translate and pictures from other people online can and will certainly help you as a tourist or non VN speaking person.
I had a simple bbq porkchop over rice with some pickled vegetables for 38k vnd. A great price for a tourist but can't comment it from a local perspective.
The porkchop was amazing. Very well seasoned and loved the smoky flavor. Despite it not being cooked on order, the porkchop was very tender and not dry at all. Kinda wished I had asked for a double porkchop.
They forgot my iced green tea and getting the staff's attention is rather difficult. A lot of moving around but not actually looking around (general dining experience in these types of places).
Did I mind it? Not at all, the meal had left me quite satisfied.
Definitely a place I would recommend if you're in the area.

Absolutely bloody excellent. The com tam is fantastic, as was the canh o qua (stuffed bitter melon)!

Uncle serving us was super lovely!!!! Cam on chu!

Easily the best plate of broken rice I‚Äôve eaten, no question, but it also comes with a hefty price tag. Conveniently, the pricing is not printed anywhere, and the staff was very unsure when questioned about the price. I feel scammed.
Awesome food, good price and friendly locals. Highly recommend
272k for 3 plates of rice with various toppings, 3 bowls of soup and 3 ice tea. Not the cheapest but good quality.
Best meal ever ‚Ä¶ I can‚Äôt believe food can taste this good! and the owners are lovely people

We were recommended here by our hostel. The food was great and the staff were very friendly. We ordered the pork chop broken rice with a fried egg which was suggested by the chef. Would definitely recommend eating here.
No trash baskets on the inside, so people mainly throw garbage on the floor. I ordered chicken üçó, egg and rice. Quite dry food.
I had rice with pork chop, pork skin and egg cake, and a bowl of bitter gourd soup for a total of 100K VND. They were decent for the price.

I came here based on the reviews. I got double charged compared with the normal price. They ran out of rib so the girl suggested me to order pork belly. That wasn‚Äôt much pork belly with a lot of rice. Instead of charging me 80000vnd, they charged me 160000vnd. I didn‚Äôt know about that till the time my friend let me know. That was very disappointed for my first experience. Be aware guys!

Beware. The old man made me pay the viet kieu price of 145,000 dong for a com tam ƒë·∫∑c bi·ªát. I know how much things cost. Very disappointed by this treatment and behavior. This isn‚Äôt much money for me and I didn‚Äôt want to argue if this meant so much for his business. I thought this business practice was buried in the old times, especially in Saigon. Way to make small money and lose repeat and future customers and respect.

Portions are large but the level of execution is quite mundane. It‚Äôs a very busy restaurant but it doesn‚Äôt seem to have a soul.

I would say that close by, there are other restaurants of the same genre that deliver better.

Does not merit a second visit.

I do love c∆°m t·∫•m here, quite huge portion. But they are so busy that they might forget what you ordered or they might bring other people dish first despite that those people arrive after you.

The waiting time is really long. Parking space is very tiny.

I'm a local in D.4 and to me this is lowjey the best Com Tam vendor in D.4. The price is higher than the average standard in D.4 but I'm satisfied with the quality they bring. Lot of local D.4 people eat here too

0x31752fec547c9a87:0x3e799d325f623fe9.comment: in the alley, right across the Pink Church. Very humble Vietnam style homey food, very tasty big portion. Roasted pork belly was to die for, thick crispy savory. Sauteed vegies, fresh cucumber and pickled caisim on the side plus a sweet-sour soup of bean sprout, radish and tomato.

This joint is very popular at lunch time. The food is delicious and cheap. The pickled mustard leaves, though not a lot, add a different twist from the usual cucumber. Soup and tea are free. They alley has a lot of annoying motorcycle traffic.

0x31752f478a7ceb17:0xdcb87db311325ae8.comment: Food is bland. Staffs would ignore you. Prices does not include tax or service charge. We ordered bun cha but did not give us water for the rice paper until we asked for it. Will charge you for wet tissue. The only thing interesting in this restaurant is the interiors. Do yourself a favor and eat somewhere else. üò≠

Food not great.  Vi Da Vietnamese eatery at Ben Thahn market was so much better.  Feels like typical chain restaurant using frozen meats cooked without any soul.

My pork chop and braised pork belly tasted like microwaved leftovers. Dry and hard at some parts. Don't get fooled by photos on menu.  The real dishes all turned out alot smaller.  Crab meat ball is one good example.

Pricey not great.  Walk out for better food .  I'll never be back here again.  Bill was 480k for two pax

I had such an amazing experience dining here! From the moment I walked in, the staff were warm, welcoming, and attentive without being overbearing. The atmosphere was cozy yet modern, making it perfect for both a casual meal or a special occasion.
The food was absolutely outstanding ‚Äî every dish was fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. You can really taste the quality of the ingredients and the care put into the cooking. My personal favorites were C∆°m T·∫•m, but honestly, everything we tried was delicious.
Service was quick and efficient, and the team made sure we always had what we needed. Prices are very reasonable for the portion sizes and the quality you get.

I‚Äôve been in Vietnam for a couple of days and I couldn‚Äôt find anywhere that had that fresh vietnamese food i was looking for, until I found Com Tam Moc!!

I had a Vermicelli Noodle Salad with Pork and it was so amazing, exactly what I needed.

The staff didn‚Äôt speak much english but they always made sure you were okay and used Google Translate when needed.

100% Recommend

This isn‚Äôt a large place. It‚Äôs well decorated, very hip. The walls are made of brick so voices bounced quite a bit. Fortunately the patrons keeps the voice down, but unfortunately some the waiter would yell across the room breaking the silence.

The food average. Nothing stands out. Though the portion is generous amount of meat in comparison to others.

It appears to have 4 person in the front (waiters), I don‚Äôt know how many in the back. They are so so slow. My rice plate took forever and it wasn‚Äôt just off the grill, so don‚Äôt know why it took this long. Amazingly my Pepsi took longer than my rice plate. And the finally, my goi cuon came out last.

ok this one kinda nice c∆°m t·∫•m (broken rice) spot i‚Äôve hit in saigon recently, maybe the best for tourist. it‚Äôs a bit pricey for c∆°m t·∫•m and def feels a little catered to tourists, but honestly‚Ä¶ i‚Äôd still go back.

the s∆∞·ªùn n∆∞·ªõng (grilled pork chop) hits hard‚Äîperfectly caramelized edges, juicy inside, the marinade‚Äôs that sweet-savory goodness done right. the c∆°m (rice) itself‚Äôs fluffy and lightly fragrant, not dry like at other places. big win: they give plenty of m·ª° h√†nh (scallion oil) and m·∫Øm ch·∫•m (fish sauce dip), balanced just right‚Äînot too sugary, not too pungent. love that.

skip the soup unless you‚Äôre really craving side quests.
Nice atmosphere, food you can get anywhere nothing special but the service level is for local Vietnamese. Plenty empty free table and yet asked us to squeeze with other 2 seater tables
Ordered the grilled chicken and steamed vegetables platter with braised fish sauce. Enjoyed the meal, place was cosy with fast service, price was reasonable considering it‚Äôs a restaurant with AC.

Delicious food, just the right amount, lovely drinks. The main waitress was very lovely and delivered great service, slightly let down by others who didn‚Äôt seem to be doing much considering the restaurant was full. It took a but long for us to get our food and drinks. We didn‚Äôt receive the same service from others. However, overall great experience and great value for money. Would recommend.

10/10
Exposed brick wall, beautiful high ceiling, warm wood. I might have to keep ordering so I can stay here longer üòç
The food. Delicious!
(Ut khon) my server was helpful - service overall was friendly and well run.

We were on the hunt for a good C∆°m T·∫•m and came across this restaurant. We arrived around 7 PM, and despite the place being packed, our food was served surprisingly fast. The C∆°m T·∫•m was delicious, along with some other dishes (which you can check out in the pictures‚ÄîI can't quite remember their names!).

The only downside was that the air conditioning wasn't working, so it was a bit hot inside. But for the price? Super affordable! Overall, it was an amazing experience, and we‚Äôd definitely come back again.

Nice, rustic feel to the little shophouse restaurant with vintage decor. The place can get very crowded during peak periods. The pork chop broken rice is tasty, coupled well with preserved vegetables makes it an almost perfect broken rice dish. Spring rolls are ordinary and the beverages are too sweet for my taste. Good place to enjoy local broken rice in a well located area of HCMC. Service and staff are friendly but they shout way too loud to one another. Other than that, all good.

I thought this place was good, not spectacular or bad, but good.
The flavors of the grilled pork chop were as expected. My only complaint was of the spring rolls. The rice paper they used was kind of tough. I am accustomed to soft spring rolls, so I was a bit surprised.
The dining room was basic and clean. The tables and chairs were all made of wood. I went for lunch and it was not very busy, so the service was really quick. The staff was friendly.
The prices are very reasonable here considering this is in a tourist zone.
I would definitely come back here and have a meal again.

Must try if you want to try broken rice ‚ÄúCom Tam‚Äù, they also have yummy ‚ÄúCanh Chua‚Äù. Very nice and location in centre, to ez find out.
Concept and decor show heritage of Vietnam

A eatery deserving of a higher rating as the food I ordered was good. Menu is in English too. Alot of diners local and visitors ordered the Com Tam. I guess one won't go wrong with that. While this eatery may be out of the way for one staying nearer to Japan town side , but it is a relatively short walk from Binh Than market to get here. Check it out if one is in the area.

Not recommend at all! The staffs were not friendly, the atmosphere was off. It was right in-front of my hotel and we were hungry, should‚Äôve checked the review beforehand. The food was decent but for the price, you can find way better place with good service.
We had a delicious meal here. Food was tasty, staff was friendly, and the restaurant vibes were cool. Highly recommended

We arrive in the morning at 9am~ish for breakfast and order 2 dishes. However they gave us a kinda old meat (sorry to them I used to be a mystery shopper and restaurant owner so I can tell) and I was a bit upset. But they gave us a new fresh one in exchange therefore we're okay with that.

Just remember to ask them give you a FRESH MEAT at any orders to make sure then!
I don't know why but the peach iced tea was hella delicious. Also the chicken was super moist and tasty. Spring rolls were also good.

Breaking news: Chickens still chirping in Vietnam.

We went here for dinner and ordered different items including the chicken satay attached. All 4 of the portions of satay were undercooked. To say these chickens could still be laying eggs is an understatement. After paying we asked the manager if this was normal, she quickly passed our complaint onto one of her employees. He claimed that the chicken was supposed to be this colour due to the quote ‚Äúfood colouring and satay marinade‚Äù even though this is clearly the inside of the chicken. To add salt to the wounds we were charged 5000 dong per napkin without being informed that these incurred a cost. There was no other alternative to cleaning hands after eating ribs.

So if you‚Äôre looking for pink chicken this place is for you, otherwise stay well clear.

0x3175291e20380c79:0x84c658423e4fc75.comment:
Sometimes the good ones are by the street. Ordered the rice special and coke. Comes with a soup. Don‚Äôt be alarm that the soup is luke warm. That‚Äôs how these soups are. The rice was hot which is the important thing here. Fish sauce is the right amount of flavour too. All of that for 60k. Service was good with no hassle.
Not the cleanest place compared to the popular chains. But it‚Äôs good food and sometimes that matters more.
Delicious and reasonably priced. The lady and her daughter very patient with my lack of Vietnamese language and happy to use google translate to help

The price of a standard broken rice dish is reasonable. I like the pickle with water spinach (rau muong chua), not many shops have it. Everything is clean although the shop is on the street. They have a water station with single-used cup.
Very very good com tam, better meat and certainly better prices than any michelin restaurant
Good place

0x31752f8438b1e4d9:0x5ccf45ed9954be68.comment:
We ordered C∆°m T·∫•m for a company get-together, and wow, everyone was absolutely raving about it! My foreign colleague, who's tried C∆°m T·∫•m before, was especially impressed. She couldn't stop talking about how incredibly tasty and generous the portions were ‚Äì definitely the best she's had!
Everything from the professional, tidy, and super hygienic packaging to the food itself was top-notch. The C∆°m T·∫•m quality hit the spot. The pork chop and pork rib were perfectly seasoned, tender, and still incredibly juicy even after delivery. And that fish sauce? It was the ideal complement, bringing all the flavors together beautifully.
Even the smaller details shone through: the sunny-side up egg was cooked to perfection, and both the seaweed soup and Vietnamese sour soup were delicious additions. We were all incredibly happy with the service and the entire experience.
If you don't mind spending extra for quality, this place really knows how to deliver a winning meal!

I came here impressed by the rating and I was not disappointed. The food was very good, though not exceptional. Well-executed C∆°m T·∫•m. And definitely go for the ribs! That's the difference-maker!

Other then that, the place is clean and the staff was nice.

Personally I felt the meal would not be better without its tasty condiments, soup and egg meat loaf ! They are really awesome.

Close your eyes and order the combo which is so worth it !

Had this takeaway as I was rushing and on the go. So well packed, so meticulous, and absolutely delicious. Well deserving of their ratings. This was 89,000 vnd and I enjoyed every bit, including the seaweed soup. A small qualm is that the pork chop is hard to cut with the plastic cutlery, I had to get my scissors to cut it. Maybe they can consider helping to do that for takeaway.

Staff was friendly and helpful and quick and even told me to go upstairs where there is ac.
The pork cutlet unfortunately was dry and no char with minimal grill flavour. Only the fatty rim was juicy.
They made an effort to make the place looks nice with wooden tables and stools, brick facade on the wall and a mix of real and plastic plants.
Personally I prefer the street side shop that grill it on coals, not sure if they do that here, couldn't see the grilling, though it didn't taste like it was.

Sooooo good! We‚Äôve tried both the Hanoi location and this one and hands down‚Äî taste and quality is amazing. We actually like it better than a certain Michelin Guide one also in town. The meat is tender and soft here, rice seasoned just right. Also their side of soup has minced pork and seaweed. Super tasty!
It is very different from other `comtam' restaurants in Ho Chi Minh City. It is clean and so cool because there's an air conditioner.

This is a good sized, two-story spot offers a dining experience that combines convenience, comfort, and culture. You place your order on the main floor and then head upstairs to enjoy the air-conditioned seating area‚Äîa welcome retreat on a hot day. The service is efficient, with food arriving in about 5 minutes.

The decor is inviting, featuring the story of the restaurant beautifully displayed on the walls. The placemats double as guides, providing instructions on how to eat com tam (broken rice), which adds an educational touch for first-timers. The menu is also written in English, making it accessible to tourists. The upbeat music and thoughtful design create a comfortable, welcoming environment.

As for the food, it scores a solid 4/5. The pork rib was the highlight‚Äîjuicy, flavorful, and cooked to perfection. However, the pork cutlet was slightly dry, which took away from the overall experience. The accompanying soups were both delicious, adding depth to the meal. That said, we wished the plates came with more vegetables to balance out the richness of the meats.

Overall, this restaurant is a great place for a quick, flavorful meal in a relaxed setting. A few tweaks, like juicier pork cutlets and a more generous vegetable portion, would make it exceptional.

24 September, 2025 at at about 1400 my wife and I visited this restaurant. We had visited a few times before. We had enjoyed the previous visits because of the good service and even better food.
Today's visit though was VERY subpar.
To start off the girl bringing out our drinks that we had already paid for to the wrong table a table that did not order beverages. Then she brings out our drinks in chipped glasses as if we were outside at a street vendors stand.

Then the food came out, both plates were placed in front of us... Turns out to not be our order and pull from us. They belonged to the table that got our drinks. Same girl.
Then our actual order came out, we waited 30mins for a completely cold plate, the meat, the rice, the egg; all cold and dry. Both plates.
My meat was cold, tough, and dry as if it had been sitting there for the last 4-5 hours.
The only thing that was warm... warm, not hot was the seaweed soup.

Needless to say if my wife suggests coming back I would most likely be against it.

They offer two combos for approx 99k. In my opinion a decent place to have com tam but it could do better if the food was hot. Guess you can‚Äôt expect much from a chain but overall tasty! We‚Äôve had it twice now, once in person and take away. I would probably take away and re heat it next time

The  service was nice and quick. We enjoyed the meal. And the place was not loud.
Come eat here!
80% broken rice restaurants are the same but there is something that stands out from SaBiChuong. The vibe, the humor. BTW SaBiChuong is a scramble of Suon Bi Cha a basic component of this food. Bravo

Following the waiter's suggestion, I am offering this feedback.  The pork com tam was, unfortunately, rather underwhelming; the meat was cold and dry, suggesting it may have been pre-cooked and reheated, as it arrived very quickly after I was seated.  Furthermore, card payment was unavailable due to a malfunctioning EFTPOS machine, requiring a cash payment.  This led me to seek out more upscale establishments for card payments during my final day in Vietnam. Finally, I discovered a hair in my food.  Overall, I had a less-than-satisfactory experience and am curious as to why the price was higher than at other local com tam restaurants, especially considering the lack of pool service.

I recently visited C∆°m T·∫•m S√† B√¨ Ch∆∞·ªüng - Tr·∫ßn B√¨nh Tr·ªçng in Saigon, and their C∆°m T·∫•m is fantastic! The grilled pork chop was perfectly cooked‚Äîjuicy, tender, and full of flavor. Paired with fragrant broken rice, a fried egg, fresh cucumbers, and pickled vegetables, it made for a delicious and balanced meal.

What really stood out was the fish sauce they provide. You can add chili to it, and when poured over the rice, it enhances the flavors even more. The combination was simply amazing! The soup on the side was light and complemented the dish well. The atmosphere is cozy, and the service is fast and friendly. If you‚Äôre looking for authentic C∆°m T·∫•m in Saigon, this place is a must-visit!
Food is delicious and authentic broken rice. Maybe suggest the restaurant to have knife to cut the meat :)
The food and ambient is great. Can't believe this one of Vietnamese food.

Broken rice restaurant is a nice and tasty dishes. It‚Äôs an upgrade to the more local broken Rice eateries. They provide mouthwash, small like this impresses me dishes are flavorful as well. I‚Äôm definitely trying them again they even have their service on the Grab app to deliver to your home.

08/2025, When I visited, a large tour group occupied more than half the tables upstairs. The rib set came with a nice variety, but the meat was a bit tough. Prices were much higher than local c∆°m t·∫•m joints. Makes me wonder if this place is designed mainly for tourists.
Eating the broken rice with pork cutlet felt like a rollercoaster of flavours in my mouth. Even after finishing my plate, I wanted to order another.

Excellent food, service and atmosphere. On our last night in HCM we wanted a good local dish but needed a pampering atmosphere. I had enough of eating in alleys üòÖ. Great c∆°m t·∫•m spot in a lively, very local neighborhood in District 3. The pork chop is well-marinated and nicely grilled, with a good balance of flavors and less sweet than others. A generous portion with pork chop and egg costs 57K, which is a good deal for the quality.

It‚Äôs just about walking distance from Pham Ngu Lao, making it a great option if you want to escape the tourist-heavy areas and try something more local. Well worth the effort!

I have to say this is the best Com Tam I have ever had after spending 3+yrs in Vietnam eating out every single day. I have probably tried 50+ com tam stores across Vietnam, but this tops the rest. The meat is tender and marinaded perfectly and it is super tasty. I got a full topping for 55k, but without any topping is 35k. Even the toppings were excellent, so you wanna make it worth if you are making a trip here. They even served free tea with ice and that also separates from the rest of com tam stores.

Took the effort to find this gem of a place, pretty difficult to find and had to ask a local for directions.

Traditional com tam place in a local area. The pork ribs were tender and juicy. Rice was fragrant and texture is interesting as it is soft but not sticky.

While the broken rice with pork jowl is this eatery's signature dish, after experiencing it, I left thought that this eatery was completely overrated. Their shredded pork skin lacked the satisfying crispness and the distinct toasted rice aroma. The portion size was meager, the rice undercooked with a rough texture, and there was no complimentary soup included. An additional VND 20.000 per cup buys you soup, but the selection rotates daily between just two options. On Tuesday, Thursday, and Saturday, the soup is made from pickled mustard greens and beef tendons. On Wednesday, Friday, and Sunday, there will be seaweed soup with pork cartilage.

eating here since a long time already. really worth a try. positive attitude of service and good food. price is affordable. a bit hard to find only. hope this review encourage you to try out. take the n·∫°c gi√≤n b√¨ la, it is my fav

I went there at about 5pm, just as they were setting up and about to open the store for dinner time.

This area is relatively far away from the touristy part of HCMC, therefore they were no other tourists around when I went in the evening, there were lots of locals there eating, which made me feel that the food should be good, and indeed the food was amazing!!!

Although none of the store staff speak English, they made me feel so welcomed and comfortable, they communicated with me viz Google translate.

There is this really sweet old lady working there, I think she might be the owner of the store. Although she doesn't speak English, she was super friendly and welcoming, she was so nice and checking up on me if I enjoyed the food and if I wanted to order anything else.

Definitely would recommend this place although it's quite far away from the city center!

0x31752f562a304d5b:0x444d84ce8af1b2b6.comment:
This hidden broken rice spot is tucked away down a little alley, and is mostly frequented by locals. They sell out super fast, so if you arrive around 10:30 AM, you might find them already packing up for the day.

There is a few seats lining the alley and some inside a house, but the pork chops are grilled right at the entrance to the alley. Hence, no smoke smell even the space is limited.

The pork chops look fantastic, but I found them a bit sour and chewy. I suspect the meat might have been marinated for too long or perhaps the charcoal was a bit too hot.

Overall, the broken rice is decent value for money, and the ladies who run it are really friendly and welcoming.
A hidden gem with delicious food, friendly people, inexpensive, and nostalgic childhood alley breakfast spot. 10/10

0x31752f2314baa5f7:0x2d1b112fee9517a6.comment: My wife and I came here for our first meal of our 4-day vacation and everything was great. The food is fresh and flavorful and the service and staff were great. I would come back again. They even set us up with complimentary tea and soup on our visit. I highly recommend this place!

noodles were simple and on its own did not really have any taste, but i wouldn‚Äôt have it any other way because it was a perfect complement to the perfectly grilled meat and the meat spring roll looking thing. Everything went well together and I only regret not being able to stuff more of this lovely dish into my belly. the ice lemon tea is also not the usual taste you get but really good!!

this stall is a good symbol of street food, because you are literally on the street with a small table and toddler chairs (I‚Äôm 6‚Äù2 but I was still happy), i read another review about red ants in the area but i didn‚Äôt encounter that.

MUST TRY! Highly recommend if you are in district 1!

Best dishes we had in Saigon! Run by family, nothing fancy but simple food made very well with kind service and warm smile. We had one dish with grilled pork chops and other dish with pork chops, pork skins and meat pie. Nouc Sam sauce and cooked chives are really good with the dish! They even included iced tea before the meal and fresh banana after!

We came at around 10am and they were consistently busy with local people doing takeaways. We walked 20mins and it was worth visiting!

More popular in district 3. The foods are rather okay as long as with the price. ‚ÄúS∆∞·ªùn B√¨ Ch·∫£‚Äù is the favorite orders. ‚ÄúCh·∫£‚Äù is more special than others, highly recommend to have it. Price is more acceptable compare with the quality of food. The soup is pretty okay. The shop is too small, with maximum serving about Ten customers at once time. No air conditioner, so it is so hot when having at lunch time.

Amazing local food and really effortable price. We ordered two broken rice, one with pork rib, skin and meat pie, and another with caramelised pork and eggs at only 125 thousand VND. Comes with soups and drinks. You can smell the grilled pork while you enjoy your meals. The staff are friendly and one of them can speak English. The only disadvantage is the settings are quite limited. Many ordered and take away. I feel that the food tastes better than restaurants.

Delicious Vietnamese "broken rice" cuisine, a local favourite that all visitors to Vietnam must try. The dishes at this shop are especially good as they are still prepared and cooked in-house at the shop and not supplied by a central kitchen in a factory complex.
Broken rice cuisine is a combination of grilled pork chop, cold cuts, pork skin, and egg cake (otherwise known in Vietnamese as "suon, bi,cha"). Do remember to eat the meal with a bowl of bitter melon soup.

I'm pretty sure this is tourist trap. Whatever the media says, do not come here.

The rice is lousy, not fragrant Vietnamese rice.

The price is 95K for the few stuff I ordered. You can get it for 40k elsewhere.

The food were so so.... Normal. I would never even eat such food under normal circumstances.
Good stuff around Saigon! The pork and meat pie were delicious. I‚Äôll definitely go back!!!!
Is this a hype place? Really good portion. Looks really good. I think this dish is average.

Decent meal of simple broken rice with pork. I really liked the soup even with the bitter aftertaste. 75k for a set with drink. They forgot to give us the chilli which I'm sure will make the meal even more pleasant.
Pork cooked to perfection, very tasty and well marinated. Very friendly serving staff and theur price is very reasonable. Highly Recommend.
Com Tam (broken rice) along the way to/from war museum. Pretty tasty pork and ice tea. Paid around 90k for 2 pax. Worth a visit if no idea what to eat
Simple. Homely. Delicious com tam (broken rice and perfectly cooked pork) Extremely helpful proprietor and his son.
The lady that served us was so lovely and welcoming to us and the kids. Spoke English well and recommended what to eat. The food was delicious and the pie and pork was yummy. Thank you!

Nice balance of flavours - pickles, egg/york, grilled pork & broken rice, topped with dipping sauce makes a hearty quick & simple meal! The pork pie (basically steamed minced pork) was light and delicious too!

Tiny little local Vietnamese broken rice restaurant with delicious food. Definitely not fancy - sit outside on busy street, but at least the tables are decent height so that tall legs can actually fit.

I would certainly go back for the excellent tasty food. VND 75k for pictured plate plus ice tea.  Pork cooked to perfection.

Classic c∆°m t·∫•m (pork chop and broken rice). A very small space and not too fancy, but good food. One minor point that can improve is that it can get very hot there if you sit at the outside table. No aircon.
Delicious food! Recommended if you are in the area for some broken rice‚ò∫Ô∏è
ordered their grilled pork over rice. phenom dish. lovely family too

This is one of the best places we ate local food in HCMC.
Excellent food with very warm people who are eager to make their guest feel welcome .
This is a small place located just beside the road, but very popular even with the locals.
Please be on time to have your favourite dish, before it gets over !

0x3175296d72aa296b:0xa6bead5acbe711b9.comment: Food was delicious and very close to my hotel, will definitely be coming here again before I leave back for America.
Great restaurant to try C∆°m T·∫•m, directly next to our hotel. Very friendly owners, we felt welcome. Recommended for everyone in the area.
Excelent food. Excelent service. It taste like home, it taste like family.
