As a Local Guide and a big fan of Vietnamese cuisine, I can confidently say that C∆°m T·∫•m B·ª•i S√†i G√≤n is a must-try spot in District 1! I visited this place after reading some good reviews, and it absolutely lived up to the hype.
The broken rice (c∆°m t·∫•m) here is flavorful and well-balanced. I tried the grilled pork chop with egg and pickled vegetables ‚Äî the meat was juicy and marinated perfectly, and the rice had a nice texture. The fish sauce (n∆∞·ªõc m·∫Øm) was delicious and not overly salty. Portion size was generous for the price.
The restaurant is clean, organized, and gives off a very local and authentic Saigon vibe. Staff were friendly, helpful, and served food quickly even during busy hours. Also, I loved how the menu was easy to understand even for non-Vietnamese speakers.
It‚Äôs conveniently located on 100 Th·∫°ch Th·ªã Thanh, just 8 minutes from the city center, and stays open until 10 PM ‚Äî perfect for late lunch or early dinner.
Highly recommend this place to tourists and locals alike looking for a high-quality, affordable Vietnamese meal.

Saw this place the other day while walking and made a mental note to come back. So glad we came back for lunch today as it was delicious!

We were greeted by a friendly employee in English. We told him what we wanted. He offered to have an egg added to each of our plates which we definitely wanted. It's not listed on the menu but it looks like from other reviews they give it as an option upon ordering.

We took a seat and our food was served in under 5 mins. We did not order tea but it was brought to us. I'm not sure if we were charged for it but my husband said each of our meals cost about $80k.

We both ordered the honey pork chop which was so juicy and flavorful! Cannot wait to come back again.

There was nothing special about the atmosphere. Could have been cleaner but not unhygienic. You get what you pay for.

I wouldn‚Äôt recommend C∆°m T·∫•m B·ª•i S√†i G√≤n. Their menu is very misleading. It lists ‚Äúb√¨, ch·∫£, ·ªëp la‚Äù as 12k/1 ph·∫ßn, which implies that all three items together cost 12k. But when the bill comes, each item is charged separately. This feels dishonest and misleading. The food quality and taste are just average‚Äînot worth the confusion or the surprise at checkout.

üçö üçñ ü•ï solid com tam, good portion size and great for lunch. The fish sauce is not as sweet here. I prefer a bit sweeter but this may be good depending on your taste. Good location and comes with iced tea of course.

This place has a claim to sell the best C∆°m T·∫•m in S√†i G√≤n. The portion size, taste, quality and price is excellent. Plus the soups are fantastic! I particularly love the dill and clam soup. Cannot recommend this place highly enough üòã

This was and still is one of my favorite places.  The price here is reasonable.. and tbh, there is broken rice everywhere, but here it feels like the ingredients are good quality, there are many that use low quality to cut costs.  There are only a few places I can say this about with my experience living and working in Vietnam for 10 years now.  ‚ù§Ô∏èüòª
Food is simple and delicious. Rice, pork, soup are hot, very rare to find in Vietnam. Price is 86k slightly more expensive but pricing is transparent. Service is good. Free iced tea too!

I've never been a fan of c∆°m t·∫•m but th√≠s place h√°s changed my mind! The highlight of the meal is the ch·∫£! It's tender, juicy, and flavourful! I recommend getting at least 2. The free jasmine cold tea is great as well, very fragrant and flavourful! I guess if you're a local it's considered on the pricer side for c∆°m t·∫•m but its super cheap for someone from Canada. Highly recommended!

A great place to try my first C∆°m T·∫•m (Broken Rice). Delicious complimentary tea and moist towelette on arrival. The portion was great for one, fresh fermented chilli and fish sauce on the table. Sadly the pork was pre-grilled and microwaved, but still delicious and succulent. Would recommend if you haven‚Äôt had this dish before - some other reviews say you can find better in the centre of the city and for cheaper, but for an Aussie this was a great and cheap dish.
Very good pork and rice for a low price. This place always have so many grab bike drivers waiting to pick up their food, which is always a good sign of very good local foods.

I ordered C∆°m ƒë√πi G√† n∆∞·ªõng t·ªèi at this restaurant. While the chicken was good and well presented, I was surprised by the portion size considering the price. I have had better experiences elsewhere. The ambiance was not great, and I did not feel particularly welcomed depending on who I was communicating with. I do not plan to return to this restaurant, at least not for the chicken.

Clean and modern broken rice with grilled pork ribs and chicken restaurant. Price is quite high. Service is quite good.
Crowded during lunch. Lot of take away services for lunch.

The service at this restaurant is terrible. If you have extra time and don‚Äôt mind waiting for your order, then go ahead. My group came to order, and after taking the order on the phone, the staff made us wait 30 minutes with no food served.

A customer who came in after us got their food in under 5 minutes. When I asked the staff, they told me they had to rush the kitchen. Then someone came up and told us that the pork ribs we ordered (3 portions) were sold out. But we noticed that 3 tables who came in after us all got pork ribs. When I asked again, they just said they didn‚Äôt know.

Is this how the restaurant trains their staff to respond to customers? What‚Äôs the point of having a food ordering system if the staff just brings food to later customers first? People who came in before end up waiting and only get told that the dish is out of stock?

It seems like the restaurant is too busy and doesn‚Äôt really care about customers. You should really think twice before dining here. I‚Äôve had similar experiences before ‚Äî dishes running out ‚Äî but I was eating alone, so I didn‚Äôt mind switching dishes. This time, our group of 6‚Äì7 people waited for 30 minutes and got nothing but a glass of iced tea. Only when we asked did they say they were urging the kitchen.

There are so many better restaurants in Saigon. Please avoid this one ‚Äî no need to bring frustration upon yourself.

Decent, but not outstanding, broken rice. The pork and egg cake are good, but the chicken was not great - very chewy skin and it was cold, even during dinner hours in a busy restaurant. Rather small portion of rice.

It's OK. Lots of people say that this place is good but to me it's average. The broken rice portion is way too little that you always have to order extra. The pork chop was so tough, it ruined my appetite. I'd rather have just the shredded pork skin and fried eggs.
The chicken was very tasty and the pickles were amazing, the perfect amount of spice! Loved it
The food wasn't bad, but I don't see how I should pay almost double the price for the same food elsewhere.
Nice clean place for a little bit over priced broken rice (com tam). A bit distance from the town center. But the meal is delicious and you'll forget how hard you got there for a simple meal ;)
My very first Com Suon in Saigon and I loved it! Everything is so good! Meat is tender and not overburned. I will come back again for sure!
Good place for a quick bite. Clean, quick and no need to look up menu. Good thing about here is their meat is bigger than average, and rice is moist.

0x317529e54e87e99f:0xf937df891b1841ef.comment: Since the eatery is nestled in a small alley, parking might be limited. The eatery offers more than just their grilled pork chops, the delicious array of dishes displayed at the counter is sure to tempt you. Every order comes with a side of sliced cucumbers and a bowl of pork rinds, with free refills on the rinds. Complimentary iced tea is served at every table with attentive water refills. However, accompanying soup is not included, you have to purchase it separately.

Great c∆°m t·∫•m place. Open from 18:00-23:00. The food might be a bit sweet but this is common in southern Vietnam. Even though it's  sweet, it taste very good. It's very cheap in my opinion. But this ks the best C∆°m t·∫•m I've had so far in Ho Chi Minh City

Daily open from 5pm to 11pm (have a day-off on Saturday). Location in the small alley with only suitable for motorists. More popular night Broken rices in Hang Xanh Junction, Binh Thanh district. Foods are delicious and tasty with reasonable price.

One of my favorite C∆°m T·∫•m spots in HCMC. It‚Äôs tucked in a quiet little alley off the main street in Binh Thanh and they have consistent good quality.

Personally, I‚Äôm a big fan of the chili side on the table and the tr√† ƒë√° is good as well! They also understand my Vietnamese very well so as a basic-level speaker and foreigner I‚Äôm very comfortable to go here and order. Check it out for good food and a nice low key experience!
This com tam store is located in a small alley. The meat is tender and the flavor is very good. You can park against the wall in front of the store, but there is not many peking spots.
40k for this ( rice with fish üêü). Menu not available thr.

I didn't understand why this com tam place has such high reviews... until I visited it with my boyfriend.

The pork and chicken were thoroughly marinated and were grilled to perfection - leaving with a nice smokey taste. Yet, it was not dry at all. It was tender and at times, the chicken fell right off the bone.

We visited this place frequently and would highly recommend others to try it.
We had 2 broken rice with grilled pork, 2 soups of the day and extra chicken. Total price is 150k VND. Both are good but the chicken is exceptional. Must try. Definitely come back for more.

Greated c∆°m T·∫•m eva ~ We have c∆°m t·∫•m ·ªëp la and c∆°m t·∫•m s∆∞·ªùn ch·∫£. both of them tasted so good, even not spicy for those cannot eat spicy food. We were Hanoi visitors and asked about resstaurant‚Äôs best seller. Caterer was so friendly when recognizing Hanoian hehe
Must try besides com Tam Cali
Brilliant dishes with various choices for a quick dinner. Would definitely recommend!
This place is great!  It's only opened for like 4-5 hours and they can run out.

Price is higher than some places but the quality and hygiene is also much better!
Pork chops and chicken are always so moist and perfectly grilled
One of the best com Tam dishes I've had
Good and cheap. I eat it all
Such an amazing "Com Tam". Highly recommend this place to others.
So gooood
Super delicious foods, which have special tastes you cannot find anywhere else.
Delicious late night food with cheap prices (105k for 3 portions)
Excellent food. Good and friendly service üòä
Delicious and clean, broken rice with bbq. Close on Saturday.

0x31752fd792d14fc9:0x791bf2072f91081.comment: This sidewalk broken rice stall offers delicious food, with tasty toppings, and incredibly fragrant honey-marinated meat. Plus free soup on the side. While the food is fantastic, the price and service might prevent me from coming back.

This unassuming, alleyway com tam stand was the most delicious meal I had in HCMC -- the clean plate says it all! The pork was tender with the right balance of sweet/savory. It's a hidden gem I wouldn't want anyone to miss
Authentic Vietnamese broken rice ‚Äî affordable, big portions, well worth it.
Lu√¥n lu√¥n ngon! This is my favorite com tam place. People of Saigon are lucky to get to eat food like this for a reasonable price.

0x31752ee1415a23d7:0xbf3929ae27fff045.comment: "com tam" not really delicious but good for eat compare with the price. big portion. great service.

Reasonable prices (broken rice with grilled pork chop and another topping for VND 35.000). However, the crowdedness of the eatery is overwhelming. Even with a large staff of 7-9 people, service seems stretched thin. The hot and stuffy environment felt more suited for take-out. The watercress soup was particularly disappointing. The watercress itself seemed undercooked, and the broth lacked flavour. It appeared they prepared the soup by adding raw vegetables directly to bowls with premade clear broth, resulting in an unpleasant, pungent taste.
Personal opinion - Cold, thin strips of rock hard grilled pork chops. Don't know what to say further.
Delicious broken rice, make sure to get it with pork.

Not good at all!!!
I should not eat there when I arrived as it was a roadside hawker with no proper shelter.
However, it seemed will rain soon so I decided to have a quick bite.
Ordered the special spare ribs instead of the normal pork chop. The feeling was the same as one of the reviews.
The spare rib was a bit salty and without a good smell of honey, it was cool as usual as they normally grilled and then put them aside and wait for the order.
It costed me VND110.000 /115.000 and a total of VND130.000 including one fried egg and one cup of iced tea. And they didn‚Äôt even offer you a complimentary soup as of the other shops.
I can‚Äôt image such a dish of food and environment costs me more than double or even triple the price if you eat in the local wet market.
No service , ordinary good , expensive price ‚Ä¶..

The food was cold and mushy. I saw the high reviews and decided to give this place a try. There are several piles of pork meat sitting at the window to attract customers, thus when you come to the shop they pick one of the piece that's been sitting on the window to feed you. It's a cold and very tough piece of meat. The cha was mushy, like it was over cooked, no texture at all. I would never eat here again and would advise anyone I know to not try it.
Wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to call it the best Com Tam in Saigon.

Just visited recently, was looking for an authentic meal and found just the spot, a hidden gem :) Food portions are a decent size and the flavours amazing! Very reasonable prices. Eating areas are kept clean and tidy. We also found the service was great. Would definitely visit again and will be sure to recommend to anyone visiting the area.

The rice is very dry, the grilled ribs are tough, too much MSG, and the price is high compared to the average(approximately 120k per dish). A bad experience, I‚Äôm allergic to MSG, and it seems the vendor uses too much of it.

Side of the road specialising in Com tam. Rice was nice but the star of the show is the juice fatty pork rib. Yes it's a bit more expensive than other places but it is definitely a must try. Seaweed soup was great too.
Pretty decent.
Too expensive! Normal com tam only 30-50. Even with AC zone. Excuse me! Only food on street without paying any taxes for gov but its 122k. Too much!

0x31752f122b0e6987:0x2c7d02bfc28a885f.comment:
Follow @bredgyeats on instagram for more food posts!

Ca Hu Kho To - A braise that‚Äôs on the saltier side, with a tender and flaky catfish with a moist texture. The fish sauce aroma is prominent, and there are some decorative green peppercorns and perhaps a hint of spice?

Suon, Cha - Porkchop has a mild char and decent caramelization, and has a tasty sweet and savory marinade. Although, it‚Äôs a bit dry but not too tough, and has a lean texture. The egg meatloaf is a bit firmer and meatier than usually, which I appreciate for its leaner feel and clean pork umami, with an eggy aroma that you can actually taste, although it is missing woodear.

Someone was smoking inside though, which was rather unpleasant.

Visit: October 2025

Had the com tam suon bi Cha and it was alright. The highlight of it was definitely the steamed egg cake, which is the best I've had, as it has real crab in it. The pork chop was dry, but had a good charcoal taste. It was definitely on the more expensive side at 120k (when normal prices I've seen around are closer to 45k). We also had iced coffee, which tasted pretty watered down and was overpriced at 25k (vs much better street food iced coffees)
Came here on our last day in Ho Chi Minh. Packed busy with locals. We easily ordered 6 dishes between 2. Although more expensive than we thought, worth it for the taste. Not disappointed!
Small portion and very pricey comparing to local eateries, but the food quality is great. I think it is the best com tam I've ever had.

Was ok, better the first visit than second

Not great, but not dirty either.

This place is pretty busy, I like places where the food isn't sitting around too long.

I would stop here if convenient, but not go out of my way.
Bo kho is really good, com tam is ok. I would stay away from the noodles. Nice service.
Excellent choice of com tam. A bit expensive though compared to other com tam around the area
Charging foreigners double. Food is not bad....

0x317528a5add50bef:0x95f5b8e111b129e2.comment: Regarding the issue of lengthy waiting times for food, the restaurant has received numerous complaints without apparent improvement. On Friday evening, I experienced this first-hand, enduring a wait of nearly an hour for just one of my three dishes. The remaining orders were similarly delayed and required repeated prompting. While the staff were apologetic and the food ultimately enjoyable, the restaurant would benefit from a review of its service procedures to enhance customer satisfaction. I recently visited this location and had the opportunity to dine on the 2nd floor. While I understand that the staff may have been tired due to a busy day, I was disappointed by the lack of professionalism I encountered. The service felt unkind, which was surprising given the otherwise welcoming atmosphere of the restaurant.
I recognize that this is not a 5-star establishment, but I believe that customer service should always reflect a high standard of professionalism. A more courteous and attentive approach would go a long way in enhancing the overall experience. I hope the management considers this feedback to improve the service quality for future guests.

0x31752fd135fc4411:0x419f12dab92ac4f0.comment: Large and comfortable to stay and enjoy KR food

We came in group of 4, ordering and serving was a bit slow due to crowded people.

+ However all kinds of food we ordered were delicious, especially the well-seasoned broth of the spicy noodles (tho we asked for non-spicy). Fried dimsums and deep-fried shrimps/squids were tender and kinda sweet.

+ Staff was nice and friendly.

+ Space: G floor is for normal table-chair dining, 1st floor is for low tables and seats on floor (customers take off shoes before enter)

+ Parking right outside with the help of security guards.

+ Payment: cash and cards accepted

There are a lot of choices in the menu. All are hot trending dishes. The price is good. Portion is medium so you can try several dishes at one visit. The taste is quite sweet, I think. It is very popular amongst younsters so be prepared for the crowd and noise.

I really don't know where these high ratings come from.
I'd give the special pho -- 2.5 stars. Flavours don't meld and it's just a bit bland.
The bo kho was decent -- 3.5 stars but there's still major room for improvement.

Many people do come here in the morning. But I do not recommend letting the Google rating be the reason to come.

Authentic and busy place near our apartment. We tried b√≥ beefsteak with egg for breakfast and it looked good and tasted great as well. Reasonable prices, quick service. We don‚Äôt have much to compare yet, but we were satisfied. ‚ò∫Ô∏è

Great bo kho, but I don‚Äôt think you wanna get their pho. I tried both and the broth of their pho has a unique herbal flavor, which I didn‚Äôt enjoy much even though the meat in the bowl was pretty good. Their bo kho was much better and the meat in the bowl was so tender and great as well. Another good note is their vegetables are super fresh.

Pho Be Thanh Da is one of the pho restaurants in District 1 that is loved by many people. This pho restaurant is very well known thanks to its convenient location right on Hoang Sa Street. This is enough to make customers love it so much.
Unlike regular pho restaurants that choose beef as the main ingredient, at Pho Be Thanh Da, it is cooked entirely from veal. The veal bones are stewed to make broth, the remaining meat is divided into small pieces and served in the veal pho dish.

The flavor of the restaurant's dishes is very rich, combined with the pho broth made from veal bones that have been stewed for many hours. Each bowl of pho is very carefully prepared from the pho broth to the arrangement of the ingredients in the bowl of pho, which is very eye-catching.

The typical flavor of Pho Be Thanh Da is a light sweetness at first, but later on it will make you addicted and miss it, it is a different flavor compared to many other pho flavors.

Been in Saigon for 6 years and only recently discovered this spot.  The broth is on point and offers a good selection of meats compared to more normal pho spots.  This place is now part of my rotation
Best food we've had so far. Pho and Bo Ko very good

Delicious Pho & Bun ca in town
Good food. A definite repeat. Car parking can be challenging for peace of mind as street parking isn't allowed per parking sign, but restaurant people insists it's ok.
Service was good and I‚Äôm sure i‚Äôts good most of the time butmy Husband and I both got food poisoning from eating there.

Ok good

Ordered pho to thap cam and beefsteak bo thap cam.Food taste was alright.Friendly helpful staff.

0x31752f00083fa2fd:0x23041b10d6654d2b.comment: The most satisfying pho i have ever had. The owner here is super friendly and helpful. She put those sauces into our noodles in local way for us. Food was tasty! Excellent Pho combo with meat and chicken. Beef was very tender and the needles were soft. Small cozy place with four tables. Even though it rained heavily, management got us inside to eat by the street front and watch the rain pour as we ate.

Pho Viet Nam is my first authentic pho in Ho Chi Minh. The serving is generous, good for 2-3, and the lady in the store helped prepare my bowl with the toppings and condiments.

I like that this place has local vibes, in front of the street. The broth is not super thick, so it‚Äôs good for me. Not many leafy veggies so also good. Just right amount of basil.

I chose the place because of the many google reviews, but I would also venture out other spots nearby, to have comparison. :)

The owner is very nice and so proactive. Food is so delicious, we tried the special pho here! We finished these 2 bowls in minutes. Serving is very generous. 1 bowl is good for 2-3 persons. It was the first pho we‚Äôve tried after landing in Vietnam and it did not disappoint!

We ordered the beef and chicken ph·ªü, and moved into the inner dining area when the rain started pouring. The place has the charm of an authentic roadside stall, run by an elderly woman and a young man. Service was friendly and laid-back. The food was nice, though not particularly memorable, but overall it was an interesting experience.

Our experience had been pleasant food-wise and service-wise. The food was sent to our table quick and the quality was amazing; eating next to the road is a nice touch as well. I recommend trying out their Pho choices, especially the Chicken Shiitake Meatballs one.
This is great street food. Right on the street up it self. Stunning pho here in the top ten great price all under 100k . Great place if you want go get in with locals way of doing stuff.

Best pho we‚Äôve eaten in our 3 weeks being in Vietnam. Arrived early in Saigon, looking for pho and stopped here. We had the beef pho, which was delightful. The lovely lady served it with all the condiments. We enjoyed it looking out onto the morning streets. 10/10 pho, Cam on <3

One of my favorite pho experiences in Vietnam. The owner‚Äôs personal touch really stood out ‚Äî she customized my pho with herbs and sauces, making sure it was just right. The food was delicious, and her warm hospitality made the whole experience feel special. Highly recommend!

The Pho was good. The broth had a lot of flavor, and everything in the bowl tasted fresh. The portion was just right, not too much, not too little. The price was reasonable, which I appreciate because a lot of places overcharge for average food. This one felt fair.

The staff were really friendly. Their English is limited, but they still tried to make sure I was okay and had what I needed. I like places like this. Simple and straightforward. Not trying too hard. Just doing what they do well. It is not a fancy spot. But if you care more about the food, it is a place worth coming back to.

It was lucky to find this restaurant and taste not only the foood but real home atmosphere of the Vietnam. I hope u enjoy this pho with a glance of nostalgia. I ended up drinking 3 cans of beer with one bowl haha. But this place can be little bit unsanitary.

Pho Bom is an excellent choice to get a quick, high value for money meal. We went over for supper during midnight and we left the place feeling extremely satisfied.

The broth is packed with flavour and the pho bowl is filled with generous amount of ingredients. All of us finished the entire bowl with nothing left behind. Highly recommend to try.

The boss is also very nice and polite!
Delicious food and great service. The special pho is really special. The auntie in charge of the shop puts all the sauces and herbs for you; there‚Äôs a great view of the city as well whilst you eat.

Eating pho on the streets of Vietnam is truly unforgettable. Sitting by a small roadside stall with the sound of scooters passing by, I enjoyed a steaming hot bowl of pho. The broth was clear yet so rich in flavor, the beef was tender and juicy, and the fresh herbs gave it a refreshing touch. The atmosphere made it even more special‚Äîsimple wood chairs, busy street life, and the warm aroma of the soup filling the air. Pho in Vietnam is not just food, it‚Äôs an authentic street experience you won‚Äôt find anywhere else.

This place is an assault on your senses in the best way possible. 4 tables ceremonially faced towards the street with scooters roaring by. Babies clinging to their moms, lovers attached at the hip, merchants selling their wares, the daily life of this city is in full display while you eat.

I had the chicken pho; tangy, hot, aromatic and comforting. The only thing reminding me of the traffic frenzy in front of me was my need to come up from air from this excellent pho.

It‚Äôs an experience you must have.
One of the best phos I had in Ho Chi Minh. Burst of flavours and a very fair price. Service was great and helpful. Definitely recommend this place.
The restaurant got all the vibes. Good food with great people. The staff taught me how to seasoned the pho properly! Thank you so much. ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

Good Pho. But I do not understand why people call it the best Pho in Hochiming City. It just is a very ordinary Pho shop, like other millions of the street shops in Vietnam. Will not regret to be here just not to expecting too much.

We stopped by this place to get some pho and I am so glad we did. The owner is wonderful and you get to enjoy street view while eating your delicious food. The pho was absolutely amazing, the owner will add the fixin's into your dish and it makes it even better. I wish I had more room to try more, but if you're nearby in search if pho I recommend stopping here!!!!
Legit authentic pho. Beef broth is super delicious. Service was superb. Auntie served us our orders and even added all needed seasonings. Highly recommended when you are in HCMC

I went here many times and never had any issue. Some of the reviews are very odd and I believe it's roasting from other companys. Some people give 1 star review in total but  say food 5* and Ambiente 5*  and service 1* so how can the total be 1 star then ?

You can also order some drinks if you want I paid 95k for everything you see on the picture . The herbs are complementary.

Their soup tastes MSG only üòÖüòÖ, Vietnamese people normally don‚Äôt use MSG but this restaurant use too much. I felt thirsty after eating this.

Their sweet is so sweet with MSG üò™üò™I will never order again

The young team is amazingly nice, fast and efficient. One of them reserved me their super cool staff teeshirt for the day after.

The food is incredible, probably one of my best pho ever.

**TLDR: 2/10 rating. Worst ph·ªü in 6 months while living in Saigon. Maybe everyone else of the many reviews got way better, but what I received was brutal‚Ä¶ especially for ‚Ç´100k**

‚Äî

For me, good ph·ªü has good broth and good meat, and this had neither. A first for me eating ph·ªü in Mexico, the US and 6 months here in Vietnam.

- broth lacked character, richness and nuance‚Ä¶ unlike SO many other bowls of ph·ªü here in Saigon, and they‚Äôre all 1/2 the price of this ‚Ç´100k tragedy in a bowl

100% I do **not** recommend.

You know the ph·ªë here is good if majority of the customers are local. They came here for the freshly made  wide Pho noodles and yes the noodle was pretty good. Don't order the stone pot Pho, look around and see what the locals order and you'll see hardly anyone orders the stone pot Pho. Just order the regular Pho. The taste really yummy, the meat so tender, the noodles also fresh and they give so many vegetables, the soup is super tasty, love it. The restaurant really crowd, but more guest come with family. The best ph·ªü I've had in Saigon. The broth is boiling hot (watch out to not burn your tongue :)), very flavourful, the meat all cooked to perfection. The Food is amazing for its price!! Good potions to meat and noodle. The service is top tier despite the chaos, it only takes us 3 minutes to get our food. Im looking forward to this restaurant next time I go to Vietnam.

But the food itself is good but not exceptional. Some pieces of meat were unexpectedly tough. The b√°nh qu·∫©y were weirdly hard. The sauces were good but broth was average. I think this Ph·ªü has an identity problem. It's neither northern nor really southern.

My friend ordered the stone bowl pho and really liked it.

I had a Phu at this place during my visit to Ho Chi Minh City. I had a bowl of Phu for my lunch. Portion size was really good and heavy. It tasted really good. Delicious beef pho!!

You wanna get a special bowl that maybe a bit pricey if you think of it as pho, but if you see it as a bowl of various cuts of beef with noodle, the value is excellent.

Phu Vuong Pho served up a delicious bowl of pho‚Äîflavourful broth, tender meat, and fresh herbs. It was a satisfying and comforting meal, and the service was friendly too. A great spot if you‚Äôre craving a good, classic pho!
First time eating Pho, incredible experience. Portion was very large considering the price. The combination of the pho and the calamansi juice was damn near euphoric. I miss vietnam

Recommended
Very good pho. The soup is tasty. One of the best pho

- Staffs are nice and accommodating ~ happy to refill fresh sides

you can always trust a Singaporean when it comes to good food and this pho is beyond excellent! flavourful broth with generous meat portion, especially if you are into beef tendons. was contemplating to go for my second bowl but the soup was too delicious I kept going. will definitely visit again during my trip. also its open 24/7 which is amazing

We had an amazing experience at Ph·ªü √îng C√°t Gia Truy·ªÅn. The food was absolutely authentic and full of flavor ‚Äî some of the best ph·ªü we've had! The location is very convenient, easy to find, and perfect for a quick stop or a relaxed meal.

Prices are fair and totally worth it for the quality you get. The staff were super friendly, welcoming us like regulars and making sure everything was perfect.

Highly recommend this spot ‚Äî we‚Äôll definitely be coming back!

This must be the best Pho place ever! I have had pho in HCMC, in Danang, in Hanoi, in Sapa. For me, personally, this is the best one yet! However, what really disappointed me was that I think it was the owner‚Äôs daughter who came to collect the payment. The total was 505,000 VND, and I gave her 1,000,000 VND, but I was shortchanged by 90,000 VND. I never thought a restaurant like this would cheat even on the change. I went back to ask for the receipt again to double-check the prices because something didn‚Äôt feel right. The girl must have realized her mistake because she quickly came over, tapped me, and gave me the missing 90,000 VND.

We visit Ho Chi Minh City every year and feel that the country has developed a lot, with much less cheating nowadays. But I didn‚Äôt expect this kind of thing to still happen in a restaurant. I felt really disappointed.

Not gonna lie, it is the best Pho for my entire life! If you wanna eat "high protein" Pho . I reccomend you here. This is our second time eating here already
The food has always been amazing
Everything is well seasoned
Very generous with the side vegetables
Beef is tender but still thick enough to have a bite to it
Would return in the future

Visiting spontaneously in the middle of the night, I didn‚Äôt have high expectations, yet it turned out much better than I could anticipate!

I‚Äôve been to this spot most days during my stay in HCM, friendly staff who run the place and the Pho is incredible! So much flavour in the broth you can‚Äôt stop going back.

The atmosphere was warm and welcoming, and the staff was incredibly friendly and attentive. You can truly taste the authenticity and passion in every spoonful. If you're in Vietnam and looking for an unforgettable pho experience, this place is an absolute must-visit.

I will definitely be coming back for more! Highly recommend! üçú‚ú®

Ate 3x here when I visited Ho Chi Minh City. They are open 24hours so it is very convenient for me. I enjoyed all those 3 meals. I ordered pho fillet and brisket, pho with shredded chicken and rice steak Vietnam.

Vietnamese restaurant however need to get rid of the rubbish bin under the table. It just looks so horrible and dirty.
delicious, heart warming bowl of pho. air conditioned, simple and clear interiors. service was friendly and also fast. highly recommended !

Is this best hangover food, eva? üòç I love local fusion food - beef pho-tine and delicious fried chicken. Awesome little restaurant near Pham Viet Chanh. Highly recommend to go all-in on the big serve ü§™üòã

Good pho with rich, aromatic broth and fresh herbs. Portions are generous and service is fast. Prices are a bit higher than average, but the quality makes up for it. A solid choice if you're craving a comforting bowl of pho in a clean, relaxed setting.

This is one of the best meals I‚Äôve ever eaten in Vietnam, and is definitely my favourite spot for Pho Xao. Here they have the option to have it with crispy noodles, and for me they were absolutely perfect. It is definitely deserving of being on the Michelin guide, unlike many other spots.

This is somewhere I would happily return to, and honestly say if you‚Äôre in Ho Chi Minh - then it is a MUST VISIT.

As it‚Äôs family owned, the vibe is also super friendly. They‚Äôre also very proud of what they‚Äôve built which is nice to see. The owner lady even gave us some free cake, which was the lightest fluffiest cake I‚Äôve ever had - so she‚Äôs a great cook and baker!!

Definitely go here, and try the Pho Xao , it‚Äôs a must. Can‚Äôt wait to try everything else on the menu

Decided to go to this side of the city to find Pho Chao from my friend‚Äôs recommendation.

. **Five-Star Dining Experience at a Charming Vietnamese Pho Restaurant**

This restaurant stands out as one of my absolute favorite spots for authentic Vietnamese pho and creative fusion cuisine during my time in Vietnam. Having dined here five times already, I can confidently say that every visit has been exceptional. The pho is not only delicious but also has a clean, well-balanced flavor that keeps me coming back for more.

Beyond the pho, I had the pleasure of trying an incredible fusion dish (whose name escapes me) as well as some off-menu specialties‚Äîeach one was outstanding and a testament to the chef‚Äôs skill and creativity.

The ambiance is warm and inviting, perfectly complemented by the genuine hospitality of the owners. On one visit, one of the owners joined me for a beer while playing vintage records on an old machine, adding a personal and nostalgic touch to the evening. The other owner, Ma, was incredibly kind, guiding me through the menu with enthusiasm and warmth.

What truly made the experience special was how naturally welcoming they were‚Äîtreating me like family even though I was there with a friend of theirs. With four more days left in my trip, I know I‚Äôll be returning to savor more of their amazing food and wonderful company.

Highly recommended for anyone seeking an unforgettable dining experience with heartfelt hospitality and exceptional Vietnamese flavors!

Amazing good, service and everything!! Place is clean and organised. Pho done right, and photine (poutine made with pho soup!) is definitely a must try.

Chau was our server, he spoke fluent english, amazing service and even the owner Mdm Tung came out to give us yummy sponge cake!

Love this place wayyy more than the typical tourist spots which we tried

I discovered this place in the Michelin Guide and visited twice during my stay in Saigon. I tried Pho Ga and Hanoi Style Pho and both were very delicious, but the Hanoi Pho stood out more to me! The atmosphere is nice and quiet, especially compared to other Michelin Guide Pho places I visited. The Restaurant is family owned and all the staff is very friendly! They have service tea and you don‚Äôt feel rushed while eating there. Because of this I would chose this place over other Pho restaurants.

I eat pho back home at least once a week. This place is a must go if you are in Ho Chi Minh. The owner and staff are so nice! Broth is so delicious. Trust me go if you can! I can‚Äôt believe this place has negative reviews. They treat you like family.
Amazing!!! I like pho, but I don't really like poutine. However, this dish is just out of this world. I've never had anything like it and will go back any time I get the chance.
A must visit dining experience. My preference is the beef stew with bread and/or the deep fried chicken. Always good service and cheap prices. Never disappointed over the 10 times eating here.

We both also ordered tra tac and it was soooooooo good. I love tra tac and this is definitely one of the better ones I‚Äôve had - not too sweet. 50k for my small pho, 70k for the large, and 15k each for the tea.

On a previous visit my partner tried the pho-tine and really liked it. Good take on poutine fries. I haven‚Äôt tried it but I will be back to try again another time.

Excellent food - nice and tasty!! Great service from Chau who explained all the sauces and condiments and made recommendations on the menu. On a cool dark side street full of activity. So good we came back again the next day - the beef stew was amazing thank you Chau!
Had the Pho Bap Hoa (beef shin Pho) and it was delicious.

One of the better Michelin-listed restos in Vietnam.¬† And unlike most of the others, it is not overpriced.

Mama Dung started out in the northern city of Nam Dinh in 1986 armed with her grandmother's recipe for a light, clean and pure broth. Fast forward nearly 40 years and she has established herself amongst the elite as a pure genius in ph·ªü-novation with her small but powerful menu of signature dishes.

I can confirm that the ph·ªütine is a must try! Not poutine and not pho but a combination of the two, golden french fries are topped with melted cheese curds, carrots, cilantro, onions and a ph·ªü gravy that is moorish. The side serving of beef broth for dipping brings this dish to another level and together is nothing short of outstanding!

The mi·∫øn l∆∞∆°n ni·ªáu is rich and full of incredible flavour and the c∆°m rang d∆∞a b√≤ surpassed basic fried rice with beef expectations.

But what surprised me was Mama Dung's own g√† t·∫Øm m·∫Øm s·ªët that was unforgettable.. The fried chicken had a perfect crunchy and crisp skin with a juicy and tender centre and flavoured in a sweet and sour caramelised fish sauce that sets it apart in the world of VFC!

With a bib gourmand under her belt two years in a row for good quality and good value cooking, one needs to include incredible hospitality too! Mama Dung is a queen of ph·ªü but she remains humble and genuine in her love for feeding the people - Vietnamese or Westerner, you are welcomed with a smile, fed like you're family and parted with a hug and for that she is ph·ªü-nomenal!

A small local restaurant which is doing a good job competing against some much bigger and more established food chains around the city.  The location of Pho Chao is really quaint, located in a quiet and low key part of Saigon, away from the hectic bustle of the city center, but close enough to reach in a 10 min cab ride from D1.  The pho is really good, fresh, clean broth with some good cuts of meat and some subtle spiced flavours.  The condiments were also all represented: hot chilli sauce, satay chilli, pickled garlic, fresh lime, fresh chilli, herbs.  It is always a sign of quality when the condiments of a pho restaurant are on point.  The menu also has a few surprise items such as, fried chicken, fried rice and ‚Äúpho-tine‚Äù.  I tried the Pho-Tine, basically: crispy fries with cheese, beef cuts, shredded carrots and sticky beef stock.  The dish was very creative, always good to try fusion food, the fries were tasty.  Overall, a solid local restaurant punching way above its weight, but is finding its feet in Saigon and is becoming a bit of a celebrity among the ex-pat community.  Worth a visit.

these guys have hit michelin guide for 2023 and 2024! and well worth the accomplishment too!

Very attractive looking restaurant from outside, with signs indicating it was tourist friendly, and would offer visitors to Saigon, the authentic Pho experience. Inside were roomy tables with great decor and artwork presenting a very welcoming and comfortable, air conditioned eating place.
Unfortunately, the food would possibly be adequate for the first time Pho sampler, but to an experienced traveller or the unlikely chance a Vietnamese local ate there, the reality would soon show. The soup was disappointing in flavour and contents. The meat was very fatty and unexciting. The most obvious indication something was missing , was the complete lack of side plate of fresh vegetables usually served with Pho. Having Pho with NO bean sprouts or various leafy green vegetables especially basil, that are usually self selected and trimmed, to add colour flavour and texture to what should be a wonderful Vietnamese noodle soup experience. Tiny bowl of onions, and maybe a couple cilantro leaves, was all that accomplied the dish. The bizarre little instruction sheet on the table, for spicing up your Pho, assumes you will make it only they way the restaurant wants you to eat it. This restaurant , located near Bui Vien walking street, is an unashamed decorative tourist trap, with food to match. There are plenty of other cheaper pho restaurants very close by, that will take you closer to the authentic Vietnamese Pho experience you had hoped for.

I ordered the C2 hot-stone beef pho, which comes with raw beef slices and cooked beef brisket. On the side you get beef broth, scallions, bean sprouts, lemongrass, Thai basil, and fresh chili.
The taste is very close to the classic pho I‚Äôve had before. The stone bowl arrives piping hot, so you can cook the raw beef yourself, almost like a mini hot pot. Don‚Äôt rush it the way I did‚Äîif you add all the beef at once, it clumps together. Take your time and swish the slices in the broth for the best texture.
The fresh chili is seriously spicy, so add with care. The chili sauce on the table packs heat too. The broth here is noticeably fresher and a touch sweeter than what I‚Äôve had in Europe, and it tastes far less like MSG. European pho really does cut corners on slow-simmered stock.
Overall, this bowl beats any pho I‚Äôve tried in Europe or Japan. I can‚Äôt compare it to local Vietnamese spots since this is the only one I‚Äôve tried so far, but I‚Äôll definitely explore more next time. The shop itself is small, clean, and welcoming, with plenty of foreign visitors. Both card and cash are accepted.

So delicious, it‚Äôs so flavorful and the meat is so tender. I like the meatball so much, it doesn‚Äôt taste like anywhere else.

This gives you the authentic feel of Pho, easy to eat and unique in Vietnam. This place is a great start to try the dish.

Service is so topnotch. They‚Äôre very helpful and can also speak my language, they‚Äôre so friendly!!!

You should try the crispy bread dip in the soup.. so good.

Taste ‚Äì Like I mentioned, my first encounter with pho was disappointing, but this place completely changed my perspective. This is what authentic pho really is. As a fellow Southeast Asian, I absolutely loved it‚Äîthe meat, the noodles, and especially the broth. Even now, I‚Äôm already missing it as I write this!

Absolutely incredible pho! Hands down the best I‚Äôve ever had in Vietnam. The broth was rich, flavorful, and perfectly balanced, with fresh ingredients that made every bite a delight. I visited this street food spot tonight and had an amazing experience. The staff were super friendly and welcoming, the food was delicious, and prices were incredibly cheap. The flavors were authentic and satisfying. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for great street food with a friendly vibe. Definitely worth a visit!

This was our dinner on our first night in HCM. Not only did it not disappoint, it exceeded my expectations. It was the best Pho I ever had, and I tried quite a lot. My friend and I kept talking about it.

The broth was rich in flavour, the meat tender, and the noodles perfect! We were the only foreigners eating at the time.

Our table was full because we wanted to try several dishesüòÖ We were so happy about our meal.

My friend and I visited Saigon to eat and drink coffee, and we were surely satisfied!

Nice clear broth, portion not very big, ok prices. Managed to try both the normal version and hot stone one. No wow factor but it was certainly delicious.

Well AC & comfy.

Pho was very flavourful, with the bone marrow, it added a lil more depth to the soup. As for the steak, I found it too raw... so I put into my soup and it was hard.. maybe I should stick to a simple bowl of pho.

P.s. my trust card was not accepted by the payment machine. So had to use cash.

We ordered the pho signature jumbo and we very surprise with the portion. It's bigger than my face. The service very good. As a tourist, they really try communicate with us eventhough there's language barrier

Restaurant was way too hot, hotter than outside so we moved outside.

Bone marrow came late after reminding. No veggies on the side. Food is just ok, feels like a lot of MSG.

Service staff worked hard so i don‚Äôt really blame them. But for the elevated price, very poor experience.

Initially I was worried since a local recommended this place to me but it looked a little touristy and overpriced. But I came solo and tried both the flaming stir fried Wagyu pho and the wine stew beef pho. Both of them blew me away. Some of the best pho I‚Äôve ever had in my life.

Both the stocks were reasonable and not overly sweet like a lot of pho places. And the flavors esp on the wine stew beef were insane.

I‚Äôd give this 6 stars if I could.

All the food I ordered was absolutely delicious, every dish was bursting with flavor. I‚Äôd love to try even more from the menu, but since I‚Äôm traveling solo, I just couldn‚Äôt eat it all! I‚Äôll definitely come back again next time.

ok listen‚Äîthis might just be the best northern-style pho i‚Äôve had in saigon?? yeah it‚Äôs kinda touristy n def not cheap but tbh‚Ä¶ i‚Äôd still come back.

beef‚Äôs mad tender, brisket‚Äôs got that juicy lean-fat vibe, broth‚Äôs a lil salty for my taste but still v comforting. and the dough sticks (qu·∫©y)? crispy crispy crispy. so good i‚Äôd probs come just for those lol.

also tried the fried pho‚Äîfun if u never had it before. crunchy, kinda cool. but if u‚Äôve had the real deal in hanoi‚Ä¶ u gonna be like ‚Äúok cute but not quite it.‚Äù

skip the sides n dessert, not worth. just stick to the pho + qu·∫©y combo n u good.

This is my 1st experience at Vietnam and try this pho sol.. and i love it so soo much. And the service was excellent. I forgot bring my wallet, and asked the manager to call my hotel. He helped me untill my backpack delivered to the resto so i can pay.. it was embarassing moment in my life but thankfully all the staffs so nice to me. The original pho has tender meat and the egg also good.

They served northern style pho and others dishes. Mainly on beef and pork also. This place always crowed even with 2 floors. The foods here are delicious especially the beef pho and pho wrap. I came to this place 2 times and it never disappoints me. The price is reasonable and service is fast.

Was very good.  Recommendation from a friend as his favourite Pho.  Went all in and tried the cheaper wagyu bone marrow set.  Some bread sticks and my gf tried the fried pho puffs with stir fry.

Was all very good, staff were friendly and good service.

The wagyu tasted great and I didn't miss a more expensive cut as it's rich anyway.
The bone marrow a nice idea and went well with a pho soaked bread stick.
I thought it was really good. Less traditional but there's a place for a nicer ingredient one too.

Also got a litre bottle of draught beer.  Weird plastic bottle but beer was fresh and easy drinking.

Wanted a Late night pho and saw pho Sol. The bone marrow pho immediately attracted us and we ordered 3 different kinds. Stir fry, bone marrow and normal one I think. All the beef were tender. And the stir fry had a roasted beef taste!
Some comes with small portion! The atmosphere was nice and everything was delicious!!!! So happy this place opens late!

It's Pho noodle shop. There are some Pho shop on this street, then I selected this shop. I think this shop was the most expensive Pho restaurant on this street. Brcause they have Wagyu Pho noodle, which I didn't take it Lol. I had te Pho located on the top of the menu. It was a bit different from the nomal Pho. It tasted good, but not too good for the price. Anyway the value for the price was kinda low here. Even the shop itself is very clean, which I don't care though Lol.

All the food we ordered in these photos were so so good that we had to come here twice while we‚Äôre still in the city.

You must try their stone bowl Bone Marrow pho with Steak! Very unique, full of flavour and satisfying taste.

Great customer service as the staffs were helpful. Would love to come here again in the future. üòÅ

I really enjoyed their soup‚Äîit was flavorful and comforting. However, the fried noodle dish was a disappointment. It lacked depth and balance, with nothing standing out except the taste of garlic and beef.
Went here twice during my visit to ho chi minh. Very generous portion of meat! The broth was also great and soothing. Noodle was light suitable to my liking.

Restaurant has nice atmosphere, the design is nice. Food was served promptly and the service is good. We felt that the smoked beef dish did not have a very strong smoke smell, the meat was a bit tough. Otherwise, the food has been cooked well.

Yea one of the better experiences and flavors of the touristy area. Tried 5 places and this is number 2. That steak with bone marrow made a huge wow factor and so flavorful . This is where I‚Äôll send friends late night

0x31752f966be65d47:0x344d9333f4396449.comment: Overly rated and we were the only customers dine in on Sunday 12pm. Pho was too soft and beef tail could have been more tender I felt it was way too chewy. Overall below average than couple of the pho we had.

What a lovely restaurant! The family that runs it was genuinely friendly, and the food was really tasty! Not to mention, the prices were also better than those of other similar restaurants.

Oh, and the WiFi is also very fast, so it is the perfect spot to grab a quick bite while catching up on work.
Good rare beef pho, very nice broth. The special made vegetarian pho was good as well. Friendly couple.

The pho was a bit small for its price
Not enough meat
Taste is ok

Near New World Saigon hotel.  Amazing flavors !! Seating inside and outside.  Great I‚Äôve ordered several types of Pho, all delicious. Lots of other dishes - will be back to try them all. Cold beer too. Super friendly staff .  Sorry no photos - ate all the food !

Waiter was dead inside, wrong order and did not care.
Pho was ok.
Restaurant smelled like feet.

Pho was nice. It had flavor and didn‚Äôt need to use hoisin sauce. The broth was semi-clear not translucent like what I‚Äôm used to though. Meat was fresh and she used gloves when preparing our food. Huge bonus! Expensive for HCMC compared to other street venders but I enjoyed it. There‚Äôs also other options if you‚Äôre tired of eating pho.

This was one of my top favorite meals while in Ho Chi Min. We had Pho in a few different places and this was by far the best. The family running the shop are incredibly friendly and attentive. If you can, definitely go here!
Small local restaurant. Pho was exquisite. Broth was full of flavor. Very comforting meal. We ordered Pho Fried garlic and beef, and vegan one (with beef broth). Would return again.
It had big serving size and very affordable. The food was very delicious

This is hands down the best pho I‚Äôve had during my trip to Vietnam! The broth is rich and flavorful, the noodles are perfectly cooked, and the overall taste is absolutely delicious. You have to try it.

Be aware that it gets packed with locals during lunchtime, which speaks volumes about how good it is. The air conditioning is great, making it a comfortable spot to enjoy your meal, and the staff are incredibly friendly. Highly recommend this place!
Good pho bo, a lot of grass, price also okay. Recommend it.

Amazing restaurant ! I came here for my first day in Vietnam to eat my first Ph√¥ ‚ù§Ô∏è It was really tasty, I was so happy ü•∞ I chose the basic one, the portion was really good and the price so cheap. The best people ever, the food is good the people is lovely, we loved it, recommend to everybody ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

The food was just okay, but the service left much to be desired. I went in for a simple beef noodle, but the young female employee kept pushing additional items. Eventually, I ended up with the special pho instead of the original. The food was not impressive, and I would recommend going elsewhere.

Came here on new year's eve evening and tried the pho for dinner. The place was very quiet, almost empty, service was fast. we tried the house special pho and the garlic beef. The garlic one was my favourite, really tasty. Big portions.

The establishment presented unsanitary conditions, including the presence of rodents and cats. Despite requesting vegetarian options and receiving assurance from the waiter, the served dish contained meat.
The pho we ordered was really good and the taste is very clean and refreshing. The bowl was large for one serving!!! So glad we stumbled upon this place.
Good prices, pretty good pho. No fresh herbs for our table but saw other locals get it for their meals.

The restaurant is stinky, pho also the worst toast I‚Äôve ever had, could barely swallow the scarce meat and leave the noodles. Veggies also not fresh, can‚Äôt even touch it. Price for such quality is really not the best choice in town.

0x31752fe6fb74cd03:0xc56da3a3f892c90d.comment: Best Pho I had in Vietnam. Fresh and amazing. Just the best experience one can hope for. Love it

This may look like a typical family run shop but the pho is exceptional. At 35k for a big bowl, it‚Äôs one of the more affordable pho shops in the district and worth it for a quick meal. Motorbike parking is available but limited. Service was super fast. Had breakfast here at a good price, fresh  vegs plenty of condiments , broth is southern style definitely hint off sweetness too it ,more off a northern style broth kinda off guy ,

45k for a large bowl
Fantastic low-cost local restaurant with delicious food. Now that I‚Äôve found it I will be a regular here. Lovely friendly owners.
Very nice pho and they have english menu as well.

We have travelled with my husband for almost 2 weeks in Vietnam and this Pho was the best! This is a cute family business with a really great beef Pho. The broth was full of flavor and all the add ups were making the taste even better. Really great spot!

It's a family restaurant, very cozy because the waiter was very kind, attentive and considerate. The pho, specifically the special (45.000ƒë) was very tasty and we ended up with a full belly and big smile. We ordered drinks twice, and they were out of some, so the owner went quickly to buy some more for us. After we were finished and had paid, it started pouring (raining) A LOT and we were offered to stay there for a while. However, we wanted to go back to the hotel, and because we were carrying all our luggage (3 backpacks and one suitcase) the owner took the motorbike, ran to the closest store while raining and brought us 4 raincoats. He was the kindest!! I tried to pay him back but he would only refuse.

So, in a nutshell, the food is a 10/10 and the family who manage the restaurant are the nicest ever!!

Love it! Delicious Pho with friendly service.
35k standard, 45k special Pho, I went for the Brisket & Meatballs Beef Pho (Special).
Top tier pho in nice quiet street. The broth was exceptional and staff are super nice. Came here a few times on my trip and will be back again.

Came here as it was close to my accommodation. Very friendly family restaurant, and had no problem ordering. Food was also very good and was also came pretty quick.

Definitely will come back here if im around the area again!
Omg‚Ä¶ brisket special was amazing and I love that they have fresh basil and mint, and veggies that you can just put into your pho üç≤
This place is the best for trying authentic Pho. 5 star taste and service üëã and it's so cheap
Great local atmosphere, owners english was ok go be able to order and pay. Pho was delicious and able to get small or large bowl, both pretty cheap. Definitely recommended!

On recommendation during my travels in Vietnam.

This place is authentic, best Pho beef special with so much flavour I've had during my north to south travel. Highly recommended and it's really cheap too. Staff are exceptional here and happy to see a tourist try their food.
Family run. Very kind and thoughtful. Broth is full of flavour. Good portions for great value. I had rare beef and was good quality

This close to my accommodation. I saw some good reviews. It was really good nice fresh ingredients. The meat was soft and very lean compared to what I‚Äôve had other places. It was nice that you could add exactly what you wanted in respect of herbs as well as chilli lime garlic and free iced tea is awesome.

With a solid bowl of pho for 35,000 it‚Äôs great value.
Picked this place by reading reviews, actually the place is very nasty and dirty, beef pho isn‚Äôt even tasty, they also keep basil and other greens on the dirty floor, don‚Äôt recommend this place
Loved how this place was off the busy road. It was mainly locals. But we enjoyed the beef pho. I would recommend it to everyone.
Really nice pho bo tucked in the little alley. The prices are excellent too. The special one is with various meats.
Very tasty pho! I‚Äôd recommend it to everyone who wants a tasty dinner and does not afraid of local Vietnamese places.

0x31752f35f19a3ecd:0x58cb02188cf99385.comment: We passed by this busy place in the morning and decided to give it a try. I like the easy menu, beef or chicken pho. It was tasty with all the herbs and lime. The beef though was a little tough and overcooked.

This place serves excellent pho with generous portions of meat, a rich and flavorful broth, and fresh, aromatic herbs. The owner was incredibly friendly and attentive, making our experience even better. We enjoyed it so much that we ordered a second bowl after finishing the first! Can't wait to come back.

We have tried beef pho from this local gem. There are several types of cuts of beef used in the soup which offers great texture! The taste of the soup is also superb! It is obviously loved by local people, you could see people start to line up during peak hours. Definitely recommended!

Local pho joint. Nice staff, and I‚Äôd say a 3.5 for the pho itself. Meat and herbs were good, and I liked that they give a lot of herbs - as much as you want really - but the broth itself was too mild and lacking depth of flavor.

Best place to eat authentic beef pho! Don't miss this if you are in Saigon. The staffs don't speak english but just point out to their menu what you like and you will get the exact same food you like. The staffs are honest too when it comes to paying, and most importantly, it's cheap but great food!

nice & authentic pho shop. open in 1947 as the media communicating. over 70 years doing the Pho business. the taste is there, but rather not very trendy taste. it is more authentic and clean taste come from the soup. the meat is tender. the shop is clean and tidy. payment method: cash, bank transfer or debit note.:)))

Made a quick visit on the way back to the airport. I had my last meal in Vietnam at this restaurant. The food tasted homely and I had a moment where I felt that I'm now used to Vietnamese meals,... at least that's what the pho got me thinking. Haha üòÜ

I didn't find any wow factor, but the food was comforting üòä

10/10, the tastiest Pho we‚Äôve had in Vietnam so far! I like how they had the vegetables on the side as you could put in as many or as little as you wanted! The meat was so nice and the broth was fully of flavour. Would definitely recommend to everyone!

It's Pho noodle shop. It seems like this shop was opened right after the Vietnamese war. One of the oldest Pho restaurants in HCMC, I think. Anyway as Pho noodle, it's very standard and basic. Staffs are running around all the time for ordering and cleaning tables. It's busy all the time though. The broth is clean, not very oily. Beef is tender and easy to chew. Vegies are fresh and clean too.

I think this is a good pho restaurant at this price point.

Sellers were friendly, even waited for us to draw more money to pay them or wait the next day. Pho was a good entry point to start off the trip right. You adjust accordingly with the condiments and mint leafs given on the side. The most addictive part was the garlic chili sauce they have.
Nice clean shop. Friendly locals. Good yummy broth. Chicken is available if you can‚Äôt take beef.
A nice spot for a nice bowl of pho. Soup is hot, beef is fresh. You can add herbs and sauces as you wish. Seems to always have a crowd but fast-moving. Do note that the big bowl is really big.

Changing to next generation, the foods are still a little bit different than previous. However, the quality are still good and tasty. The price is wow reasonable as long as with the quality of foods. Quick service and nicely staffs.
The pho is good, the soup has good flavor, the noodles and the beef are fresh. The beef brisket was bit tough but the raw beef was fine. Go for the rare beef and the beef balls.

Ph·ªü Cao V√¢n, located in District 1 of Ho Chi Minh City, offers a limited menu of beef or chicken pho. The non-air-conditioned establishment provides a no-frills dining experience. While the food may not be particularly outstanding in terms of taste, it serves as a decent option for those seeking a quick and inexpensive meal.
Old, clean, small classic ph·ªü w in and outdoor sitting. Good  tasting beefy broth & noodle.  Choice of toppings, g√¢n cooked to right consistency. Herbs not fresh ...

The pho was not too bad. More northern style with the thicker noodles and the broth was more clean and clear than it was sweet. I would come back. But so many other pho shops to try and explore. Good spot if you're in the area and looking for legit pho.

the clear soup is light but quite tasty.
the amount of chicken is not too generous but ok.

Good quality Pho at the heart of District 1. I tried Chicken Pho with beautiful broth and plenty of chicken. Personally, this place is best for breakfast for people working around this area or tourists. Highly recommended.

0x31752f0068d8a849:0xff72644072c5beb5.comment: Good bowl of pho at your local spot, had their mixed beef pho, chicken breast pho and sugarcane. Mixed beef pho has good mixed of meat with noodles. What an amazing pho they have! We went there twice during our stay in Saigon but would surely go again if we stayed longer. One of the best pho we had in Vietnam. Service is super friendly and welcoming. A must visit when in Ho Chi Minh City!

This was honestly the best pho we've had. The owner was so kind and even showed us how to enjoy it like a local, which made the experience really memorable. The staff were lovely too. We mentioned we‚Äôd be back the next day for another bowl, and when we arrived, they welcomed us so warmly. It felt so genuine. The lime juice and orange juice were also fresh and delicious.

Now that we're back in Australia, we keep thinking about it. Can‚Äôt wait to come back one day!

Arguably the best Pho shop in Ho Chi Minh City. I went to this restaurant 3 times in my stay in District 1. On each occasion, I had to eat 2 bowls of pho because it‚Äôs dammm good üòã. I tied both beef and chicken pho and they both were incredibly delicious. Customer service was excellent, the owner is very nice. She even showed me how to make sauce for beef pho and chicken pho. The first time when I went there, they were opened but closed for customers to prepare for lunch and dinner rush but they still welcomed me and served me with foods and drinks. If you want to try authentic pho while you are in district 1, you need to go to this restaurant. You won‚Äôt be disappointed. Prices are very reasonable.

Great experience here. Had the chicken thigh pho and the staff taught us how to eat it. Try the lime with salt and pepper - for dipping the chicken! Pho was great too. Perfect for a rainy day. Super friendly lady at the store front as well!

We felt like Pho for lunch so found this restaurant around the corner from our hotel.  The Pho was delicious.  The restaurant is clean and the owners are so friendly and hospitable.  We ordered the chicken thigh and beef Pho.

The best pho served by really kind owners!!! Chicken and beef pho both super duper good.

The chili oil and pickled garlic are amazing too, wish I could bring them home lol üòÇü§ç

This is the REAL DEAL Pho ª restaurant in district 1, Saigon. It is pretty much all they serve, and their Pho ª is FANTASTIC.  The owner even helped us mix the appropriate dipping sauces for the meats we had chosen.
The best Pho in HCM. Highly recommend Ph√≤ B√≤ and Ph√≤ G√† 50k VND each + the owner was so kind & showed us how to enjoy the food. ü•∞
This Pho restaurant is the right decision to start your day. We ordered Pho with Chicken Wings and Pho with raw beef. Superrrrrr Delicious, and staff was very kindly. Highly recommend this Restaurant
Best broth in Saigon. Owner was also very helpful by helping us make the dipping sauce. Highly recommend getting the beef rib soup pho
SOOO tasty! Broth was amazing. Fresh noodles too! They had garlic, chili oil and herbs to add as well. Great service.

Stumbled upon this gem as it was right by our hotel.

Nothing but amazing soup served here and you can tell they clearly care about the food here.

Broth is a 10/10, same with the noodles.

I had the rib option and the meatball option, both fantastic.

English speaking and will help you with the menu/correct way to eat the soup if you don‚Äôt know how.

Eat here!!!
So good! Really lovely & fresh. The ribs cooked perfectly, so soft and deep flavour in the broth. Great price & lovely staff too.

On the quest for a less touristy place to eat, I stumbled across this little Pho place. Short story: The place is fantastic! Update: Came back the next day for another great Pho. Highly recommended!

My first pho while in Vietnam. I'm not an expert and have no idea how pho should taste. But here the experience, the broth was so beefy, and tasty. I'm thankful to everyone who suggested this place and yes i approved all reviews. Delicious, clean and nice vibes üíñüáªüá≥
Cheap and delicious chicken Vietnamese pho. The staff was kind and it was easy for foreigners to get in. I'll go again!
The most delicious Pho in Ho Chi Minh with reasonable pricesüòç.

Came here last night for dinner and wow so so delicious! I got the beef rib pho and it was literally falling off the bone, so so tender. Very flavorful broth and like the other reviews say you can tell they make their food with love. Lime juice drink was refreshing and a good pair with the soup. I brought the family here in hopes for a good bowl of pho but this place exceeded it! Not only is their food PHOnomenal, but their homemade drinks are good as well. Clean food and drinks so it‚Äôs a plus! It‚Äôs a family owned restaurant and everyone is so warm and welcoming. We will definitely come back every chance we get! Cafe sua da, nuoc sam and the beef / chicken pho were GREAT!! We ordered for 5 people with lots of drinks so it ended up being almost 500,000 VND - well worth it ‚ù§Ô∏è

0x31752f38e1a83783:0x82c55a5f55ef168f.comment: The chicken pho is delicious and cheap. Only 65k, generous portion of fresh pho and tasty light chicken broth. The shop opens 24 hrs so it‚Äôs convenient to come here for pho anytime of day.

Nice place for pho, with super friendly hospitality. Although the staff couldn‚Äôt communicate in English very well, Google Translate helped, and they made sure my food was exactly as I requested. It feels like a very local pho spot. I didn‚Äôt see any tourists while I was here, so I think it‚Äôs more popular with locals. The pho was delicious, affordable, and worth trying for anyone visiting Ho Chi Minh City. Highly recommended!

I read review on this and decided to give up lounge food for this. However, there are a few restaurants next to each other, all have the same ‚Äú pho ha ‚Äú signage. I cannot tell which is the one that is the most famous one. So I give a lower star.

The food is very cheap. It is great to experience what local eat.

After hangout all night this restaurant is recommended by my local friends. It‚Äôs very delicious especially all chicken menu (porridge/vietnamese noodles/chicken+sticky rice) and don‚Äôt miss deep fried feet chicken it‚Äôs crispy and wonderful flavor‚Ä¶love it‚ù§Ô∏è

Kind of ended up here unplanned, but no regrets. Very tasty pho!  The menu isn't the clearest (as a non-pho-expert tourist), but we managed. The waitress was quick to pull out her phone to help us understand each other. Prices were cheaper than the more famous places. Broth was savory. Decent amount of meat, and it was tender and tasty.
