Late night Pho! Timeless establishment. Must try.
Delicious pho! Spring rolls were tasty as well. Ordered the deep fried sticky rice which weren‚Äôt amazing but we came for the chicken pho and it did not disappoint!

My first night in Saigon. Just arived I had to try the local Pho.   Well.  It wasn‚Äôt that good.  I had Pho Bo. Very pew small pieces of beef.   Soup was ok.

I actually paid and went to the next pho restaurant. Was cheap 65 Dong, Apple Pay.
A bit expensive for pho but it's in a very good location and the flavours made up for it. Loved the smoked beef shank and the broth of the pho. Great place to get some food during a late night.

Tourist place if you‚Äôre only in Saigon for a week, I guess you should try this place. I had the beef pho.  It‚Äôs about 20,000 more than other places outside the Tourist Center..  it was good. I‚Äôm happy that I was able to try it and give a review.

Good late night typical northern style ph·ªü g√†. The soup was ok. I was "annoyed" by the insisting lottery ticket, chewing gums vendors and the street singers.

A popular after hours for Saigon clubbers bar workers.
The service was good. Staffs are very attentive and helpful. Food tastes good and the portion is quite big. Totally spent was 213,000d with coke.
Very good pho ga and this place is open late night or maybe it is 24/7. If you wanna late night food after drinking, this is a good one especially because there are so many bars in this area.

Great late night bite. I think it‚Äôs open 24 hours?
The best is definitely the chicken pho

A great place to experience the true atmosphere and cuisine of Ho Chi Minh City. Staff were wery friendly and welcoming.  I am not sure what I ordered but it was fresh and absolutely delicious. Yhe beer was warm but nothing a block of ice couldn't fix. Would definitely recommend this restaurant.

Great family meal
Tasty food
Value for money
Felt full and satisfied
Definitely worth a visit
Tasty pho and hits the spot. Would not rank on my top list for the city though.

One of the best spots I`ve been to when in Ho Chi Minh City - great food with decent price just by the street - friendly staff and very crowded that makes you feel right at home. The Hanoi and Men vodkas are the ones to try for the meal if you are european ;)
The beef noodle here is highly recommend. The open 24hours.

Beef pho lacks flavour - the soup broth is more from spices rather than from cooking beef bones for long periods (the way the broth should be cooked). It‚Äôs ok for a late night feed as it‚Äôs open 24/7 apparently which is helpful. Cheap at 65k and full of locals.

0x31752f3fb0b08a91:0x63e50be8d0cf2096.comment: prob my most fav Pho in Saigon. disclaimer - im from Hanoi so my tastebuds are more attuned to Hanoi-style Pho. if you love clean (and prob msg-infused) over sweet broth thats characteristically Southern, this is def your go to spot. unlike many restos which modify their self proclaimed Northern Pho to better suit Southern tastes and give me major letdowns bc of their false marketing, Pho Vi lives up to their branding. owners are true blue Hanoian so thats extra authenticity points for you. if you find this Pho lackluster, chances are that Southern Pho will be more to your liking.
nice pho north style. not very clean and tidy but acceptable. easy to access around district 1. price are affordable and show on menu board so there is no mark up. bank transfer or cash

Most of what i tried, Nice food! Reasonable price. The owner can't speak much English. But if you are interested with what I had, just order with my photos. The fried rice and noodles here suit my taste. I like about the chilli provided too.
Pho Tai, or Pho "Raw". A simple yet delicious soup and the first from my travels in Veitnam! Its a simple soup, priced at ‚Ç¨2, or 50k vdn, served in under 3 minutes, all in all very good!

Good value pho restaurant just outside the tourist district. 55K for a medium bowl of pho. What I especially liked - Tender slices of beef and plenty of greens available to add to the mix. No sliced lime or beanshoots which is bit odd, for me. Still it tasted great and I'm tempted to return.

Perfect tender beef and an amazingly tasty and refreshing soup, it was so good we went twice during our stay. When we told the owner how good the food was and that we revisited, he tried to stop us from paying! Also, the fried rice is cooked fresh at the front of the shop and looked great with lots of locals ordering it, unfortunately couldn‚Äôt go back a third time to try it. Cheap prices too.
Soup and condiments are on the spot. Friendly owner. Just a bit too humid inside the shop
I absolutely loved this place. Came twice during my 3 days in HCMC. The staff are super nice and the restaurant is super clean. Really tasty pho that I will miss. If you are around, give it a try.
This pho is the real deal. Nice staff and clean environment. Pricing and taste are fantastic. Seriously one of the best places in HCM and deserves a lot more recognition than it already has.
This pho was so good! Quick service. Cheap. The owner was incredibly kind. If I had known this place earlier I wouldve gone here more often.
Very tasty local restaurant. My recommendations are: Com rang dua bo (fried rice with beef strips), Pho xao mem (fried noodles with beef strips) and Pho tai lan (noodle soup with beef strips). Enjoy!
Good fried rice
Delicious Pho with a generous portion of meat, definitely recommend
Excellent pho. The best whilst we‚Äôre here
The best pho I had in HCMC

The Food store serve various traditional foods/ dishes favor of Hanoi such as : pho, com rang dua bo, pho xao, etc..
Recommend to try.
Really good pho and fried rice. Super recommend. Has been here twice in our two days visiting
Good!
The meat in the Pho Tai was tough. There‚Äôs good pho down the street at Pho Hung.
Decent.

0x31752f407d4319df:0x64e44d2db9f07730.comment:
A popular spot among locals.
The restaurant is open-air, so it can get a bit hot.
One of the highlights is that you can customize your noodles and toppings just the way you like.
It‚Äôs affordable, with quick service and a steady flow of customers, especially during lunchtime.
Personally, I love their wide, flat pho noodles ‚Äî so satisfying!
Their thap cam beef offals are the best I've had in Saigon. Frequented by locals it seems.  No A/C, but I look forward to visiting again.

The broth is the best in HCMC, rich and flavorful. The beef is tender yet pleasantly chewy, and the pho noodles are thicker and wider than usual. Be sure to add the spicy chili sauce, you‚Äôll be sweating as if you‚Äôve just come out of a sauna. Enjoy!

Ph·ªü B√≤ Vi√™n Th·∫≠p C·∫©m on Nguy·ªÖn Th√°i B√¨nh is where culinary nostalgia and urban chaos meet over a steaming bowl of beefy brilliance. For just 60,000 VND (about the price of a bottled water at the airport), you‚Äôre served a pho-nomenal reminder that authenticity still exists in a city slowly turning into a luxury mall with traffic.
Yes, it‚Äôs rough and ready ‚Äì the d√©cor hasn‚Äôt changed since 1972 and the floor may or may not be slippery with flavour ‚Äì but that‚Äôs the charm. The broth? Deep. The b√≤ vi√™n? Bouncy. The service? Efficient in the way only aunties who have run the same stall since the war can be.

And the clientele? Everyone from suited-up office folk to confused backpackers with Lonely Planet PDFs open on their phones. It's always busy, and rightfully so ‚Äì because unlike the sterile chain restaurants creeping across Saigon, this place has soul. And possibly a family of ghosts in the wall tiles.

Eat here while you still can. When the lovely elderly folks who run it hang up their aprons, it‚Äôs unlikely their Gen Z grandchildren will trade TikTok for tendon. Ph·ªü this good is on borrowed time.Get your bowl. Get your fix. Pay cash or QR code. No nonsense.
decent place to eat, if you're local it's worth a try but i wouldn't take the time out of my day to come here!

My best pho experience in ho chi minh city, the lady boss can speak a bit Cantonese and this made us visit twice to this restaurant. You can actually order different combination as you wish. But ÈõúÈå¶ is always my pick as this includes everything. I like they added on black peppers that elevate the taste. Beef ball is so chewy and ÁâõÊüèËëâ is very fresh. The also served ÁâõÂøÉ ÁâõËàå which are also tender. I would highly recommend to this pho restaurant.

Small mom and pop place with a fairly straightforward menu. There are 5 or 6 different noodle types you can order.  There are also 4 different meat choices. Limited drink selection but they have beer although it's not very cold. No vegetables plate to add herbs to your meal. Chili sauce was fairly decent. Pho is soooo good!
Fresh beef and soup tastes complicated but in a good way! I am about to cry!
Tasty food, good prices, good services, nice atmosphere. I had the egg noodles with half-cooked beef and a ice tea, all was delicious. Paid 63.000 VND

FAVOURITE beef broth place in the world. Cheap, humble hole in wall.

I went back a second time (11/12aug24), and instead of the Pho, I ordered the vermicelli, and it was even better.

White pepper beef broth with pho or vermicelli are both spectacular. I went for the beef flanks as they usually have some chewy and fatty bits, compared to the half cooked beef slices which are typically pure lean meat. 60k vnd per bowl. I saw locals pour the barbecue-chilli mixture into the broth and I can't lie - it made it better.

Iced tea (3k vnd) is refillable. The sweet auntie will pour if she has time, otherwise you may help yourself.

Solo travel, Asian edition

The soup is amazing. Will come back again.

Pho's beef is fresh, not hard to bite. Soup is fresh, not too sweet. Recommend to add the pickled radish for better taste.
Fried fritters are served on tables.  Egg benedict in broth is good.

Sorry to review the restaurant!

The broth is ordinary, the rice noodle is ordinary,  the bible tripe is ordinary. The beef ball (which should be the recommended one) is also nothing near a good one,

The taste is ok but they are quite over price, two beef pho bowls and the owner didn‚Äôt speak English so we asked for meat balls. Total charged 192000 dong. A bit regret for trying to find a local taste rather than fancy restaurant. We had great restaurants in the reasonable price, great service but this local one is kind of ripped off from tourist if you don‚Äôt speak their language !

Excellent bowl of Pho with a good amount of topping, fresh herbs and spice. I recommend ordering the combination as there‚Äôs a variety of cuts to try that are rarely found in the west but are delicious. Overall very tasty and reasonably priced bowl, particularly for being in the center of District 1.
Unlike another reviewer suggested, I was not overcharged as a foreigner.
Delicious and authentic. 60k for beef pho can‚Äôt go wrong

First time in Saigon and had this as my first ever Pho in Vietnam, and it was delicious!

This is a local, hole in a wall type of hawker food, and the owners only speak Vietnamese. Fret not, the menu has accurate english translations for you to select your type of noodles and the cuts of meats you want (my suggestion is go for the sliced beef and have your partner/ friend choose the one with the mixed one to get more variety).

Loved the soup, it's so hearty and makes your stomach warm. The dipping sauce consists of sweet sauce and chilli sauce with some garlic, learned that the lime should be squeezed both on the sauce and the noodles. Dip the meat into the sauce for extra flavour.

Had this again for dinner before my last day at Saigon, what a way to end a trip.

Would recommend everyone to go!

We were hyped to try this family-run venue which has been lauded as having the ‚Äúbest pho‚Äù in HCMC.

We ordered one regular half-cooked beef pho (the beef was fully cooked, though, and served in much thicker cuts than we were expecting) and a combination bowl that included tendon, tripe and beef balls also. On the table, you have a generous serving of limes, chillis and additional sauces to add. Taste-wise, it was authentic and delicious but *BEST* pho? Given the many other options available around the area, this claim is certainly debatable.

This shop has been open for 26 years and the clear soup is LEGIT. Paired with an iced winter melon drink this is the best thing you can have on a hot night in Saigon.

Beef balls are amazing. The menu is bilingual so you can point and order.

It was so good the broth was out of this world not a lot of tourists here and there isn‚Äôt a menu but you can just tell them what kind of pho you want it also comes Chinese donut to dunk in the soup üòõüòâ

0x31752f27dfcab11b:0x93ff4841cf032b50.comment:
Best northern-style pho in Saigon? This place kinda snatched that title for me‚Äîpricey? Yeah. Touristy? For sure. Worth it? Absolutely.

Broth‚Äôs def on the salty side, but the beef? Tender and juicy. The brisket? Dreamy with that perfect lean-to-fat ratio. And the crispy fried pho? Crunchy, chewy, fun‚Äîpls try it.

But let‚Äôs talk qu·∫©y‚Äîgolden, crunchy, everything you want from a dough stick. The other sides and desserts? Meh. Just focus on the pho + qu·∫©y combo and you‚Äôre good.

It is one of the best Pho restaurants in Ho Chi Minh City. The side dishes are delicious, but the noodles are especially great. The soup is very sophisticated and the ingredients are very tasty. You should definitely try it.
After going hungry out of Hai Nam chicken rice (I can not suggest this place) in the same street. I needed real good food to be motivated. Pho Sol always good !

this is the best resto we've been into in our trip in Ho Chi Minh! the Beef pho (as pictured) was tasty but tad a bit salty for me but it was good! the one i'll definitely recommend is their  Pho Cuon (fresh spring roll), there was some sorcery on it! tastes a bit bland with no sauce but once you dip in the sauce, it is so so so good! wanted to take it out and bring back to SG but too bad that the cafe was out of our way to airport but if not, i would've went there and tabao somemore!! üíö and also the lady serving us is very nice and very polite as well, kudos to her! ‚ò∫Ô∏è

My family has been here many times and many more to go. The food is great here. The broth is hearty and the noodles is fresh noodle. Never been disappointed once. Other dishes are also mouth watering.

I was very excited to try the Wagyu Beef Ph·ªü here after reading quite mixed reviews. My first impression of the place was not too good since it was very quiet in there with no music. But when the food arrived this didn't matter to me anymore. The bowl of ph·ªü was simply outstanding! I dipped the Wagyu Beef in the broth for just a few seconds and it was already perfectly cooked. The beef melted in my mouth and the taste was perfect. The beef balls were great too and the ph·ªü itself with more beef in it was close to the best I've ever had, for me it was a 10/10 and considering what you get, the price is definitely worth it.

Took a gamble and ordered the pho with wagyu and bone marrow and wow! If you are a person that likes intense flavours, this dish is worth it. The flavour of the fired roasted bone marrow was intoxicating. My partner ordered the regular pho and loved it.
Stopped in for a small dinner and had a wonderful time. The ambience was beautiful and the service was so great. The food we had was tasty and easy to eat. We also ordered juice which was refreshing.

Modern style pho with friendly staff in a modern decorated store with AC.
You shouldn't compare this to your typical pho place.
When I visited the store for lunch, the staff opened the door for me and guided me to a table. English communication was no issue at all.
The menu had some interesting options and I chose the wagyu beef pho.
Strong but definitely not overpowering flavors from the broth and garlic chips. I do recommend to not let the garlic chips sit too long in the broth. The beef is stir fried and has a nice flavor while being very tender. It does not need any dipping sauce as it would probably ruin the flavor.
The portion is smaller and pricier compared to your typical pho place. But the thing is you get a more relaxing/cozy environment to dine in and the quality of the ingredients are higher.

On our 3 week Saigon food safari. We came here to compare the northern style ph√¥ with the local version. It was an interesting comparison.

The Hanoi version uses stir fried beef that is then added to the clear-ish broth - it tastes of stir fry and is a bit oily, sesame I believe.  The broth is nice but not much depth.

We got the local version with rare beef, and it was very nice. It has richer broth, served in a stone bowl to keep it hot. It was also very nice. The rare beef was very nice.

I am used now to good ph√¥ having several layers of flavour and depth. This was just a bit thin for my personal taste. A bit more basil might have helped. Possibly also a bit too salty in my opinion.

Overall, still very nice. The staff were helpful, the venue has air-conditioning. A bit expensive, but not bad.

Truth be told, our local ph√¥ place in Brisbane has nothing to be ashamed of, that's for sure. If you are in Brisbane, get yourself down to My Ph√¥ in Inala. Superb ph√¥. Go the rare beef.

I've been to ph·ªü Sol in Q1 and Q4 many times. The ph·ªü is good, the ph·ªü x√†o and other similar dishes are quite nice although they can't get the chu·∫©n H√† N·ªôi flavour. I have let the staff off for poor service many times as I feel like maybe it's just an individual who has poor people-skills, but it is a recurring theme at this eatery. They often forget dishes. When I order in Vietnamese, the staff understand but always respond in English, and it's difficult to respond in English as most of the food is
Vietnamese and is easier to discuss in Vietnamese. It's patronising but I don't think they realise it. Also, whenever I pay, they always return the change to my wife and thank her rather than me. I'm sure they don't mean to be so rude, but it comes across this way.
This is a Pha chain. The signature Pho is delicious with lots of chives, I try the special beef noodle with raw beef slice , the beef is tender and fresh , soup is delicate. Recommended.
Best pho in saigon. I have tried pho viet nam but this one 1 level above. I even like pho from Melbourne @mekong. The grilled bone marrow is so good. Must try.
I just landed in Saigon and wanted Pho as my first meal. I found this place after walking around the neighborhood and wasn't disappointed! The staff was friendly and helpful.
Great food and atmosphere. Seems clean, has air-conditioning. We love the food here and have tried Pho and other dishes here. We will go back.

As a self-proclaimed ph·ªü enthusiast, I recently ventured to Ph·ªü SOL in District 4, Ho Chi Minh City. While the city boasts countless ph·ªü options, this spot left a lasting impression.

First things first, the aroma hit me the moment I stepped in. Rich, savory, and undeniably comforting, it instantly set my taste buds tingling. The restaurant itself has a clean and modern feel, with a touch of warmth thanks to the wooden tables and chairs.

Now, onto the star of the show - the ph·ªü. I opted for the ph·ªü t√°i lƒÉn (sliced beef rolled in herbs), a classic choice for me. The broth was the true star, simmered for who-knows-how-long to achieve a depth of flavor that was both satisfying and clean-tasting. The thin rice noodles were cooked perfectly, springy and al dente, holding the broth beautifully.

The sliced beef was the real revelation. Tender, melt-in-your-mouth perfection, it was clear they used high-quality cuts and cooked them with expertise. Each bite was a delightful combination of textures and flavors.

I also have to mention the t∆∞∆°ng ·ªõt (chili sauce) - homemade and bursting with fresh chilies, it added a touch of heat and a wonderful layer of complexity to the dish.

Overall, Ph·ªü SOL was a delightful experience. The combination of a flavorful broth, perfectly cooked noodles, and high-quality meat made for a truly satisfying meal. The friendly service and clean environment further added to the experience.

Would I recommend it? Absolutely! Whether you're a ph·ªü aficionado or simply looking for a delicious and comforting meal, Ph·ªü SOL is definitely worth checking out. Just be prepared to fall in love with their broth!
Strolling by this spot, I decided to give it a try. Glad I did! It's delicious, clean, and welcoming. While it's a bit on the pricey side, it's a perfect spot for lunch or an early dinner.

Great authentic Hanoi style pho - I tried the wine stew beef pho at my local friend‚Äôs recommendation and it exceeded expectations. The pho beef roll is delicious too. Just below 100k VND for a bowl of pho so while it‚Äôs not super cheap, the taste is authentic and rich and I‚Äôd visit again!

This place is a franchise of a very famous Pho place in Hanoi specialize in a unique style of Pho in which they stir-fry the beef before put it in the Pho bowl.

Flavor-wise, this place is definitely similar to the one I had in Hanoi, the broth and the beef is very flavorful, garlicky and has a smoky taste and aroma to it.

Service was great. Staff was very attentive and the order came pretty quick. The place is beautifully decorated and has A/C so it's a plus unlike the dark and dingy location in Hanoi. Price is on a high side but it is justifiable given the great pho and nice overall ambience.

Overall, highly recommended this place, if you craving Pho Thin from Hanoi, this is the spot to go, you will have the same if not better experience.
I had very tasty Pho üçú there ! Staff was very friendly too! I recommend it !

0x31752f113e8499b1:0x22774c9b031480f.comment: Delicious bowl of Pho. Ladies were attentive and friendly to all customers. No price visible anywhere including on the menu. We ordered 2 bowls of Pho with medium rare beef, flank, brisket and tendon, they were 100k each bowl. A bit pricey as we could easily get a good bowl of pho for 50k everywhere in Ho Chi Minh city but overall we enjoyed our experience at Pho Ngoc
Best pho in Saigon ! Every time we come to town this is a must stop for breakfast

Nestled in a quaint alley on Ho Hao Hon Street in District 1, Pho Ngoc offers an authentic Vietnamese dining experience that stands out in Ho Chi Minh City. From the moment you arrive, the warmth and hospitality of the owner and staff make you feel right at home.

The star of the menu is undoubtedly their pho. The broth is rich and flavorful, a testament to the time-honored preparation methods employed in the kitchen. It‚Äôs so delectable that I found myself savoring every last drop, finishing the entire bowl‚Äîa rarity in my culinary adventures.

Pho Ngoc is primarily open for breakfast, making it an ideal spot to start your day with a hearty meal. The setting is modest, embodying the essence of local street food culture, which only adds to its charm. Despite its simplicity, the quality of the food rivals that of more renowned establishments in the city.

Whether you‚Äôre a local or a traveler, a visit to Pho Ngoc promises not just a meal, but a memorable experience filled with genuine hospitality and some of the best pho Saigon has to offer.

This is what we call the BestÔºÅ
My friend used to eat at those famous pho restaurant for tourist and I told them they are far away from the best pho here in the City.
I brought only good friends here as I don‚Äôt want it becomes a tourist spot.
They serve different parts of the meet. I like to have the Pho Special Bowl with raw beef slide, well done brisket, well done flank, fatty flank, tendon, the crunchy flank, the soft bone.
You can order in addition the fat, the oil and the bones. (Today the owner treated me a bowl of bones haha).
Don‚Äôt forget they have three kind of vegetables here for the pho, the basil , the ng√≤ gai and the ng√≤ √¥m ( a must for a authentic pho)‚Ä¶
Come only in the morning as they sell out all the food daily to keep everything fresh.

Vietnamese beef noodle - ph·ªü b√≤ - this is pho with northern taste.
Actually, pho has the northern and southern taste. So you can research for more info.
This restaurant is delicious. The host is quite nice and friendly.
They only open from early morning to around 10 ~11 am (until out of stock)
The restaurant is located in an alley, they have 2 areas (on the alley, and in house.

The price is a bit high but appropriate because of quality and located in District 1 - center of city.
Pretty good pho but only open in the early morning until 1030am. The price is 70k for a bowl, so it is on a bit pricer side. The broth is very good and you get a lot of fresh veggies to go with.

Delicious ph·ªü with rich, authentic flavors, and the owners are incredibly friendly and welcoming. Pairing it with a glass of pennywort and mung bean juice makes it unbeatable. Highly recommend for a satisfying and cozy meal!
Pho in alley way, very good Pho with friendly service. Lady help us with sauces when we look a bit lost! Try the Cantella Juice, sweet with sugar cane taste and very refreshing

The pho was amazing, the broth was soooo flavourful!! I devoured it!! My boyfriend doesn't like pho so we order one for me but the ladies were worried for him and gave us an extra bowl of broth for him. I gave him some of the meat and noodles. He loved it and he's been converted!! The ladies couldn't speak English but were trying to care for us, it was sooooo cute!!!

One of the better bowl of pho I've had in Vietnam, the north included. The broth is flavourful and didn't have the typical Southern sweetness or heavy cinnamon flavour.

I ordered a "thap cam" which means mixed. You'll get a bit of everything, tendon, brisket, filet etc. The price was 70K which is ok the high side compared to other shops.

Still worth it if you like pho. They have an English menu as well and they seem to be used to travellers. They said they start selling from 5:30 am to around 10:30 am.
Tasty big bowl! Serving ladies are very nice and friendly! Operating mainly for breakfast from 5am to 1030am! Very crowded with locals

Excellent food and services. Been coming back everyday during my trip to HCM for their coffee and still missing it after the trip.

The pho tastes fantastic and very local. The staffs are very friendly and did I mention the coffee? Best! And price are very reasonable too. Would highly recommend this to anyone!

Located at the side of the road where table and chairs are setup along the alley. Crowded during breakfast time.  The owners and staff are very friendly and food are served very fast.   They served the southern pho which comes with lots of spring onions and onions. The soup has some special herbs that you can smell and taste which make it special.   The "Tai" meat tasted fresh and juicy.  I felt that the soup is alittle oily.  The ice coffee is the kicker.   Strong, thick and sweet.
I thought the pho was decent but not memorable. The bac xiu was a bit plain. Ok if you're within a few minutes walk.

Alleyway breakfast pho. Excellent broth, unlimited condiments, and a friendly neighbourhood rooster to keep me company and tell me the time every 10 seconds. What's there not to love about this place?

My only qualm is that the tendon should've been boiled longer as it was still hard.
Pho-licious! Hands down the best broth I have ever had. So rich and pure! The owner also showed me how best to eat it and recommended to add some fatty beef to make it more flavourful :)
One of the best pho‚Äôs of the trip. The owner is really sweet and even helped us make a little dipping sauce for the beef. Friendly service, quick food and great taste!
The quality is not worth the price. 55k for small amount of beef, also the broth does not meet the standard of Northen Pho. It lacks of flavour and quite sweet.

Get up early for the best Pho in the city. This place was the best start to the day having a fresh bowl of Pho with the locals of District 1. It closes at 10:30 so make sure you get down early to avoid disappointment. We had the recommended Beef Pho- the broth was so fresh and delicious- they give you a basket of herbs and chilli to add as you wish (which is traditional in Vietnam). The ladies who ran the place were super friendly and always smiling and laughing despite having been awake for many hours already. thank you for such a lovely experience in our first week in Vietnam.
One of a few Ph·ªü place I go to often. The people are friendly and serve you real quick. The portion to price ratio is alright for me.

0x31752f91cff4115b:0x5c397091907c72e2.comment: Such a lovely place ran by a small family. We ordered a bowl each and ended up ordering another large bowl to share. The broth was very tasty and we will definitely visit again.

Excellent chicken and beef PH·ªû, with separate broth tanks. Condiment tray was well stocked (we were there 8:00am).  Looks like a family owned business so everyone was very attentive and the place is sparklingly clean.

The best pho place. It‚Äôs so reasonably priced, tasty and fresh. so underrated.

I recommend the steak rare pho!

It was so good that we order a second bowl and have come back twice.
I order Chicken Pho and the chicken is soft, the place is clean with yummy Pho and clear price.

Ordered the special Dac Biet and a soda for 70k, simple menu can easily google translate
I just pointed at what I wanted on the menu on the wall to order
Meat was the most generous portion I ever seen in HCMC, not too little not too much
Cute dog wandering around

the best pho I had after one month in Vietnam. To be fair I‚Äôve mostly been in the north and I know pho in the south is more how I‚Äôm used to it, but still it was soooo perfect and nice portions for a very good price

Ordered Pho Ga over Grab. The broth is flavorful, not very fatty and tastes good, noodles are not too soft and the bean sprouts came boiled with he noodles. Overall nice though, would order again!
So tasty! Generous servings. Lovely staff, thank you.
Good and delicious Pho in the alley of district 3, must try!!
Best Pho I‚Äôve had ever! Amazing! üíô
My first PHO in Vietnam and best one
good

ph·ªü h·∫£i at 64 tr·∫ßn kh√°nh d∆∞ is that spot that just gets it right

the late night savior
they're open late, making this the ultimate move for when that pho craving hits after dark. no more sad midnight snacks when you can get the real deal.

the broth situation
we're talking about a clear, deeply savory broth that's been simmered for hours - it's rich without being heavy. keeping it real though, the broth leans a bit sweet for my taste, but the depth of flavor still hits different.

the protein perfection
they absolutely nail the texture game with their beef - whether you go with rare steak that melts in your mouth or the brisket that's fall-apart tender, every cut is consistently on point. the meat-to-noodle ratio is always fire.

the t√¢n ƒë·ªãnh vibes
tucked away in this historic neighborhood, the place has major local gem energy. no fancy decor, just focused pho craftsmanship and the comforting sounds of bowls being enjoyed. it's the real deal without trying too hard.

the final call
if you don't mind a slightly sweeter broth and want that perfect late-night pho fix without the tourist crowds, this place absolutely delivers.

0x31752e8b6e7f066f:0xf563c823ca47f4c7.comment:
May24-Ordered a Pho Bo. Chilli is good, beef ball is solid. Overall a very shiok meal. Total paid 70k with a big cup of iced sugar cane.
Oct24-Was wandering around Chinatown and I came back again. It must be fate. Got the same pho bo 55k. Taste as good as ever.

The pork meatballs are firm and strong on texture.  Like very hard packed.   Pho is decent.   I am still searching for the best pho in the world however in all the alleyways and all the streets out there

It is very local pho and hot pot restaurant. Their  restaurant is located near the China Town.
The pho is little bit different to the normal Vietnamese pho. It tastes like Chinese soup.
If you like Chinese food, it will be a good choice. However, if you don't like Chinese food, I think you don't like the smell of herb.
I like to enjoy Chinese style Pho and especially, I love Chilly sauce from this restaurant.
It makes it into Spicy Pho. Sometimes I miss the mala flavored soup and I visit here and put the couple of spoons of sauce into the pho and enjoy it. If you like Chinese food and spicy food, you will love it.

It is hotspot of beef Ph·ªü. The taste is normal.
Price is cheap. Service is fast.
Hotspot 120k
Noodle 10k
Rice noodle 10k
Very delicious! Good broth, perfect noodle texture, great chilli oil... üëç‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
One of the best pho in the neighbourhood if you are in the district. Good portion compared to other local restaurants and the soup base was full of flavour. Highly recommended üëå.
Good pho. The prices weren't very transparent tho, definitely ask for the price before you order. But the broth is totally worth a visit
Broth is not bad . Definitely not the Saigon style of pho
Excellent pho. Among the best we had in Vietnam.

The hot pot is basically a giant bowl of Ph·ªü, which is as wonderful as it sounds. The soup is clear, the meat is good with many different parts of beef. The place is truly local, a bit dirty, noisy... All good things a place like this should have! My rating's base on the consistency of the food. Sometimes the soup can be a bit watery and salty.
Still one of my most loved Pho in the city.

It's the best pho I ate during my trip in Vietnam, it can be choosed to serve as hot pot and order the rice noodles separately. Small size is large enough for two people. Although the soup is a bit salty but it's perfect when to eat with rice noodles. The slice beef, it is a good balance of fat and lean meat and you can get the best taste in your mouth. Maybe it's not a good choice for the healthy people, but I like it so much.

Great food but the quality seem to go down a bit since the beef balls aren't as crunchy and fresh as it is like few years back.
But still the best among others around.
Delicious Pho, decent serving. Restaurant is well placed in corner of the street. Peaceful from the bustling roads.
They have beef hotpot (l·∫©u b√≤) there as well. I recommend to bring some friends. However, the place is a bit dirty.
Ok
Most clean and good beef soup in this area. Price is ok
It is quite ok but it is not pho xuan mai anymore. It was transferred
Great beef Ph·ªü and beef steamboat, good price also
Good taste of beef noodle. Southern tast. I like it

0x31752f7ace63686d:0x230cc1fe9f1d321a.comment: I will just start the review with a WOW! The food here was amazing.  Even though i've tried alot of restaurants and Pho places, this one will always be my "go to". The food has a really good quality and amount for it's price and it taste really good. The place is clean and fresh. When i visited, it was not as busy and noisy, i had a really good time while eating and i recommend their Pho dac biet and a cup of smoothie. As a tourist this is very recommended for someone who is trying to taste authentic Vietnamese cuisine
Amazing pho! Clean environment to eat in :)

i love the pho here
the broth, the beef,.... make one of the best pho of my life that i've ever tried
Really good Pho Bo! Big bowl and very tasty. Only locals here!

There're plenty Pho restos in Saigon with the Saigon taste ( not Hanoian Taste)
but I find this Pho one of the best for quality control and authenticity.
Unlike in Hanoi where you could find almost similar quality in ... most Pho restos because of their secret formula of Pho has not been the secret to Hanoian no more. "You are not called Hanoian if you can not cook Pho".
Here in Saigon there's a little special touch to each of different Pho places you visit... one that will remain the secret for their family only.
If you count on the fingers how many best Saigonese Pho restaurants, this particular branch of Pho Hung on this very address could be in my top 5.
Come here at least once to know exactly how Saigonese Pho should be from a real Saigonese point of view.

Not much I can say about this place. Your average pho restaurant. Tastes pretty good. Meat is tender and beef balls are chewy with nice texture.

Price is fair for the quality of the food. It‚Äôs around 55 - 90k depending on what you‚Äôre getting in your pho.

The main reason I gave a 3 star is due to sanitary issues. Seeing a cockroach crawl across the table you eat on isn‚Äôt pleasant to say the least. The interior looks decently clean but it was an unexpected event for me.

I‚Äôve been here a lot so it may be due to the glass door being propped open. In any case, the food is worth coming here for but don‚Äôt expect this place to be perfectly clean.
If you want to try local Pho, traditional flavour. This place is not a good option.
Tasty broth but they just gave me so much grissle and fat and looked like everyone else had good beef quite disappointed
Was brought to eat here by a local friend who said this is one of the top 100 beef noodle soup in Vietnam.
Nice soup, delicious meat, ideal price, deserve a 5 star rating!

Their Pho is more expensive than your usual one. But nonetheless it‚Äôs a great pho which we all enjoyed eating and nice atmosphere.
Worth it once in a while.
My go-to for Pho. Unique taste with herbs, the broth is very refreshing to taste. I always come here when I feel tired.
Pho is best served when the broth is super hot and Pho Hung met this crutial criteria. The beef was fresh and the bowl was tasty. I would personally recommend this place. I rated 5 stars.

The motorbike keeper is rude, fierce, and evil. He even destroyed my motorbike just because he didn't feel good about his personal matters. I have stopped eating here after many years being a customer. I will never come back unless he is fired. What a monster in the modern society! Worst behavior ever!

Pho ... it was fantastic!!! #pho #yummy #yummyfood #tastinglife #tasty #willtryagain #delightful #beautiful

"Pho" here is very delicious, super friendly staff.  It was an awesome.  Many local friends love here. If you don't like to eat coriander you just say them
One of the best place for beef "pho". You can find "tai gau" here which you can not find anywhere. But the price is quite high. Not the good place for "eat everyday"
Great tasting Pho. It rivals our favorite spot in Little Saigon California. Wish this place was in Phan Rang

Best place and brand to eat Pho (rice beef noodle) in Ho Chi Minh city. Big and heathly meal with fresh vegetables and beef. V·∫ªu quick serve, friendly staffs, very delicious. Worth every penny of dollard.
P/s: Please keep in mind that Pho Hung is different with Pho Ong Hung.
Food Was Excellent, But A Little Bit Too Much !!!
Very delicious Pho specialty restaurant ÔºÅ

If you want some food reasonably priced this place is ok though
Classic Ph·ªü restaurant, speedy and delicious, good service... great for all occasions, breakfast lunch or dinner.. i highly recommend this restaurant üëçüçúüòã

super good short rib pho (#4!) no english menu but the staff are really friendly and helpful

This pho joint hands down has the best broth I've ever tasted when it comes to pho. They add a bit of spice which really adds flavour with the soup and noodles. There are tables both inside and outside and sufficient seating.

My only problem as I'm not a local was there were staff who were coughing and not bothering with covering their mouth. It's a bit off putting to see someone cough into things I may come into contact with.

That aside, I've come regularly as it's near the hotel I'm staying at and the pho is really good.

This pho place has the best broth I ever tasted in HCMC, we went to this place for dinner and enjoyed it so much.

Thanks to Google Translate for communication, because no one there speaks english. Overall, soooo good.
Very good üëçüèΩ

Best local pho!
If you want authentic deep flavors, you must try this place. Quick service.
My local friends say this is their favorite Pho restaurant in Ho Chi Minh city.

Hands down one of the best and tastiest Pho Noodles in Vietnam with a few Michelin Star awards.

The Vietnamese ice coffee's are really good and sooo refreshing and the food is excellent and has a bit of a home style vibe, the owner is delightful and the service was great and friendly.

The Beef and Brisket Pho Noodles with beef balls was precisely what I needed after a long week especially the Pho in particular has an excellent, clean and northern style broth.

We came in with no expectations and walked away with full bellies and an unforgettable experience.

I would highly recommend this amazing place to anyone and if you‚Äôre in Ho Chi Minh City you must visit this amazing place Ph·ªü L·ªá.

The staff is unprofessional. They don't response when customers ask them. I just asked for some extra boiled bean sprout, but I had to ask three different servers and wait almost 20 minutes.

The food is acceptable, nothing special.
The restaurant is supper hot. I hear some people say that the second floor has ac, so you can try to ask them for you to seat in the second floor.

I've been to three of the most well-known pho restaurants, including Pho Le, Pho Hoa, and Pho Quynh, and this place was the best for me. I went here around 9 a.m., and there was no waiting. The soup had a rich, meaty flavor and aroma, but it was not unpleasant. I'd go to this place every week if it were near my house.
I am puzzled over the negative review!! This is a perfect mixed beef pho!! You get all the flavor in!! It is crowded with local!! It ain‚Äôt touristy!! Maybe it is due to the 30 mins taxi ride!!
It‚Äôs ok‚Ä¶ the broth is on a sweat side which I don‚Äôt really like . So far the best Pho I ate were in Pho Viet Nam district 1 .
Thr best pho I've tried in Saigon! Broth was so flavorful and thrle pho has a lot of meat. The meatballs are very meaty and not soft.

It's well out of the way, but worth the detour if you're up for it. This was recommended to us by a local, and it didn't disappoint! Pho packed with flavor, some of the best I've had. Be aware though it's only beef pho on the menu, nothing else, if that's an issue.

Came here at 22:30 after an underwhelming dinner somewhere else and am so glad we did!

We ordered the special pho which has rare beef, beef balls, brisket and tendon, and the best tasting broth we‚Äôve had in a pho. Great portion and worth the price for 100,000 dong.

They also had a good selection of drinks and quick service. We were served straight away after we arrived.

Note that they will charge you for wet wipes so bear that in mind.

This is my #2 pho out of the 6 tried in 3 days (Pho Hoa Pasteur, Pho Le, Pho Minh, Pho Sol, Pho Vietnam & Pho Phu Vuong). The top 3 were all close in taste while #4 is different being flame-fried beef & garlic topped pho. At Pho Le what stood out for me was how tender, thick cut and moist the beef brisket was. The menu also feature a side broth with raw egg which I found an interesting option.

A Solid Pho Experience, But Not the Cheapest
I recently dined here and found it to be a pleasant experience. While the pho was tasty and satisfying, it offered a distinct flavor profile compared to what I'm accustomed to in North American Vietnamese restaurants. The menu is straightforward and easy to navigate, making it a great choice for those unfamiliar with Vietnamese food.
However, it's worth noting that the prices are on the higher side compared to other pho establishments in Ho Chi Minh City. Tho the most expensive mixed meat pho costs $4.

The pho bo here is one of the best in Vietnam and in HCMC; service is mediocre but the soup and meat slices are amazing!
After the District 3 branch was closed after covid, the only one that remains is the one at Nguyen Trai in District 5
Lunch is full of people but Dinner is super packed with many families coming to dine at 19:00 hours so avoid this time if you wanna dine here
I prefer to sit upstairs with the aircon
Love the beef balls and also beef fillet with some fatty slices
Highly recommended!
Overall rating is revised to 9.1/10
Consistently good .. visit on 7/4/2024
Together with Andrew bro

Another visit on 13/11/2024
The bowl is bigger now and price is 90.000
The taste is better than ever; a full dinner experiencr
Overall rating raised to 9.2/10

Very old type and style. The food is very good. It's the same pho, but it tastes better than others. The service is enthusiastic. Because it is in a busy area, they will help direct the parking for car and motobike.

A renowned restaurant that's been established for more than 70 years, Pho Le is a traditional pho restaurant takes focuses on Southern Style pho. The tables are clean and staff are friendly towards tourist. In relation to the food, the broth is heavy, sweet and full of various spices. The Pho Dac Biet contains one of the most generous amount of beef slices - with thick cuts and crunchy tendons. There are also a large plate of fresh herbs that come on the side as well. If you want to enjoy a traditional Southern Style pho, and want to step away from the relatively busier District 1 - I highly recommend you to visit and also try the egg with beef soup. üëçüòã

Visited Pho Le after a year and was so pleasantly surprised by how much friendlier the staff have become-it really made my day! This is still the best pho restaurant in Ho Chi Minh City. The food was absolutely delicious, and I would highly recommend everyone to give it a try!

The beef noodle soup here is slightly above average, with a straightforward menu that sees a high turnover due to its popularity, ensuring fresh ingredients. However, the customer service leaves much to be desired, with an indifferent, if not cold, demeanor from the staff (-1 point). Unfortunately, this seems to be a common trend in Vietnam, where restaurants prioritize efficiency over hospitality as they gain popularity. During our dinner, the staff's decision to mop the floor near our table was not the most welcoming or hygienic practice (-1 point). Overall, while I appreciated the experience once, I don't foresee returning, as there are better options available. 3/5 stars.

I had dinner here at 8pm on 8/10/25. Order various pho for my family of four, myself had a rare beef and brisket pho. The stock was bland to the point of watery, rare beef was OK, brisket was extremely undercooked and was very chewy. While we were very hungry, none of us could finish our bowl, it was the worst beef noodle I ever had for years, to the point that I am confident if this restaurant is in a Viet area in Sydney, it would be out of business in months. To make the experience worst, the waiters were talking loudly, using language like a bunch of holidays.
I am amazed at how Le made it into the Michelin guide, and seems to be quite popular with the local. Just to put things in perspective, I am a Viet Aussie in Sydney, where good Pho restaurants are in abundant.

Food @bredgyeats for more follow posts!

For its unwavering reputation for being one of Saigon‚Äôs must-try dishes, their beef noodle soup is a dish to taste at least a thousand times. For the 30 days and 200+ meals and snacks I had in Vietnam, I only ever ate Ph·ªü five times. Ph·ªü L·ªá was our first stop, calibrating the noodle scale to accurately assess its competitors. Here, there are no surprises ‚Äì an undeniably delicious broth rich in spices, beef bones, and a subtle sweetness that sings with the soft rice noodles. Having a variety of cuts from the cow is like a playful tease that makes you savour each nuance in texture and taste; contrasting the bountiful basket of herbs that‚Äôs all you can eat.
Extremely good pho and fast service. This place is famous and has been open for a long time. They give you a TON of meat so it‚Äôs worth the extra cost to go here! Highly recommend the brisket pho!

Located in district five, this place served excellent pho.

My only comments would be that the brisket was not tender and the rare beef is not thinly sliced so it was not tender and was overcooked. But this is solely personal preference.

The portion was huge, and was a good value for money.

Don‚Äôt be fooled by its spot near the chaotic road or ‚Äúlack of decor‚Äù, this Michelin bib restaurant serves its purpose of feeding delicious Pho beautifully!

The soup was rich with many layers and absolutely worth the trip. Definitely will be coming again.

0x31752ee2b321b15f:0xa6547be1fe0577e0.comment: Nice restaurant with air- conditioner. Pho is really authentic with northern flavor.

Though tiny, this little mom and pop place has really good , authentic pho. I can't comment on the beef pho because my fiance and I bot tried the chicken pho, which came highly recommended by several of the locals. The broth is delicious and the chicken meat is as expected, but their pho noodle is what makes it great. The noodles are fresh and not the dried noodle type you typically get at most places. Prices are decent for a large bowl at 60k each
Mushy noodles with a weak bone broth that relies on salt too much to do the heavy lifting. Old, stale fried bread was mixed in with the new as well. Expensive for pho.
In my opinion, the taste has been changed compared to the last time I visited this restaurant.
Amazing restaurant! Very authentic. Very good food.
Excellent northern taste Pho, resonable price, good service, love this.
The food isn't that good compare to many Pho store I have tried
Good local place with beef noodles and vegetable
Can't wait to try it again

7.5/10, Good baseline
Price:
- Overpriced (due to Michelin guide)
- Small is 60k, Medium is 70k. I got the Medium.

Notes:
- First Pho place since entering Saigon, keep that in mind.
- Thin noodles, Broth very heavily spiced.
- Meat is less than what I expected, but its good. Got all meat options but didn't seem like a lot.

It's Pho restaurant. This is one of the Michelin bib gourmand shops in HCMC. This shop advertise as Michelin shop but not so much. This is quite local shop. The Pho noodle was quite simple, but the noodle itself is a bit different from others, and specially the soup is so nice. It looks very normal Pho noodle, but it tastes better than the others. I got rolaw beef Pho noodle and cost me 70KVND. It may be normal price these days, so better to try here.

OMG!! Hands down the best beef pho I ate in Vietnam. We travelled from North to South sampling the beef and chicken pho plus an obscene amount of other dishes for 19 days.

This one delivered on all fronts, taste, umami, textures and freshness and generosity.
Just a shame we found this one the night before we flew home.
We would've returned again and again if we had more time, did consider trying to fit in a quick bowl before racing for the airport but was time poor üòÖ

Next time I'm back I'll be visiting again.

This is one of my favorite pho places! I also live very near it. I visit vietnam very often and this is still one of the best bowls of ph·ªü n·∫°m g·∫ßu. Their sat·∫ø is very good too. For most vietnamese people, I feel like their pho is a little expensive.

This spot has good tasting Pho broth. However, I don't think it deserves the Michelin certificate. I think there are better Pho restaurants than this in this city.
I like the meat balls. They are good sized balls. A lot of fresh herbs were given as well. Very busy when I came in the morning.
The parking staffs will assist you with parking. Great service!
Overall, great Pho and experience!

üò∞taste: disappointing because it was cold not piping hot as it used to be: lack spices; the ph·ªü noodles dont taste fresh as it used to be

My fav spot ever. The broth itself is amazingly sweet, beefy, and it's good till the last drop. FYI, this is a must-try place in saigon if you love Ph·ªü.
Service is fast, food is good, Southern style Pho, and very fatty broth, not a fan.
Pretty tasty Pho while the place is clean and spacious.
So great!!! Staff very quick , good customer service. Flavourful and good prices, especially no need to pay for parking

Don't know why this place is featured on Michelin guide. 90K for a special bowl which is very high. The shop was very dirty and there was no emphasis on hygiene. I'd say save your money and go to another place because it's really not worth it. Staff were pretty rude as well and tried to charge 5K for a wet tissue instead of 3K

The soup is too sweet; very typical of pho Nam. I think they added sugar to the soup. I added 4 pieces of lime just to neutralize the sweetness. I personally like pho Bac more, cleaner soup. I had the dac biet + hop ga + tra da to try all the meats. Meats are excellent and plentiful. 93k + 5k (parking). This place doesn't make my top 3 Michelin pho (Pho Viet Nam, Pho Le, Pho Chao); but it's not on the bottom 3 either so it's ok.
Flavorful and fragrant broth but a tad too sweet. A generous portion of fat in the broth.  Service is disorganized and floor is pretty dirty.

I am a regular customer here. Beef is tendor but sometimes it is tough. This is my favourite place for breakfast. It's quite busy. Prices are reasonable. Pho tastes well. It is not really clean and tidy but acceptable.

The pho was delicious, the quantities are good and the service was friendly and fast.
It is true that it is pricier than other phos and the place is not fancy, but it is worth coming
Too much sweet and salty, quite mediocre taste and nonetheless a very bad service. Could not understand why it is Michelin selected.

0x31752f7c1e139f01:0x1f6556a92991ba1d.comment:
Probably one of if not the best pho I've ever had. What stood out the most was the meat and portions complimented with the rich tasting broth. Compared to Pho Khoi which is basically next door, the soup here falls a bit short but has better meat; both are however top quality pho.

The place is at near the entrance after turning into an alley and is a bit small. The food however is well worth it.

As of right now, this is my go-to place for pho.

I tried Pho Dac Biet here. Broth was so rich and aromatic. Generous portion of meat and fresh green onion and bean sprouts- the tastes of herb and beef complement and enrich each other. It gives off lovely, down-to-earth vibes of a family-run bistro. Staff could communicate in basic English, and they were super friendly. I love how the streets of Saigon are dotted with so many affordable, delicious hidden gems.
Definitely one of the best soups I've had...
Delicious pho, quality ingredients and large sizes, plus the cook is a very nice and kind young guy
Delicious and reasonable price, nice staff
Excellent Pho, very quick and friendly service!
Delicious pho, great beef on the bone. The staff are very friendly too!

Artichoke pho was good but does not have a strong artichoke flavor. The flavor of the soup is not bold like others but still offer a ton of flavor in the soup. The rib was definitely delicious. The artichoke noodle was no different than normal noodles besides the off-pinkish color.

Great take on pho. A Da Lat special where you feature Artichokes and Hibiscus is their menu and pho. They have red noodles made from hibiscus flower. The broth is sweetened from the artichoke stem. The price is great. They have a huge beef Rib bone as well and it is cooked so perfectly soft, tender and moist. They also feature great drinks with their hibiscus tea. Great to see this family and restaurant showcase their home town of Da Lat. Super friendly staff and owners as well. Every was great, except the broth was just slightly sweet for my taste

-The food was fresh, though the tofu could have been better.
-The staff was helpful and service was great here.
-They have smaller and bigger portions at an affordable price.

CONs:
-The space is a little small and the sauce is a more on the sweet side.

Overall, I would come back if I have a craving for some b√∫n.

0x31752f0040203303:0xc9cfdcb4c6dabe5d.comment: Cute little store with very cheap food that‚Äôs so tasty. Spoke to the owner and they‚Äôre only a week old so don‚Äôt be dissuaded by the lack of reviews. It‚Äôs a very lovely clean store.

The food is so good. We had our Banhmi toasted. The place is ig worthy and you can borrow the hats and umbrella. Auntie is very accommodating , friendly and always smiling. Will definitely go here again.

Loved my bahn mi from here, it's just round the corner from where I stayed. The girl that served me was very polite, well mannered, and enthusiastic.
I had the beef bahn mi, the sauce was exceptionally good.
Its my first rst Bahn mi in Vietnam...and loved it. The service also very nice. Its a newly opened place and the owner herself serving the guests.

I went many times here and I love it! The bread is absolutely delicious, warm and the right amount of crispy. The filling is perfect, they don't put too much meat or pat√© like other places. The team is super lovely, I enjoy their banh mi and supporting them :)
Crispy bread! Nothing like the others ive tried and the lady is most hospitable, always smiling and accommodating:)

Tried this little banh mi spot in Saigon and was blown away! Rolls packed full of flavour, crunchy on the outside and soft inside. The green rice mayo and sweet taro mayo are sooo special I‚Äôve never seen these anywhere else and they work so well with the fillings.

The lovely owner makes each one with love you can taste it üëçüèª
Perfect bread. Best in the town. Highly recommend.
Really good Banh mi! The owner is really nice üíï
Best Banh Mi I‚Äôve tried on my Saigon trip so far, the spice level is perfect! The owners are also really kind
My first banh mi here did not disappoint and the lady was really lovely
Experience was very good. Ban Mi was very tasty and too much hygienic. All the sauces are made fresh.
Amazing little banh mi spot with its own little flare. They have mini options, which is nice as it lets you try multiple different flavours! Would highly recommend :)
Excellent restaurant with a friendly staff and tasty food !
Very kind and patient staff, the ingredients were fresh, the inside was clean, the staff was very hygienic, highly recommend over the street Banh Mi as this is an indoor location

One of the best banh mi I had in the entire stay in Vietnam! Newly opened the young lady (owner) is so lovely and so into food
I‚Äôve spent 10 minutes talking to her and she loves what she is doing and being with people
We need more of those shops to support
Will definitely come back
Yummy  vegetarian banh mi thank you!
Cute little restaurant! Really cheap and we got served really quickly also! I recommand you this place :)

Excellent, fresh and crispy Banh Mi. The shop has a very friendly owner called Chloe who has recently started a new business venture. The shop serves an array of Vietnamese sandwiches with different ingredients and sauces with specials and combos. Excellent service if you are on the go as the shop has a large selection of soft drinks and coffee to boot. Personally though, I recommend sitting in and experiencing the homely atmosphere of the restaurant as there is bar style seating by a window where you can watch the world go by. It's also possible to sit out on the street and read a book on balmy evening or a bright sunny morning. I highly recommend a visit if you are just visiting Saigon or a local in the area! üôÇ

My first proper banh mi in Vietnam. Very lovely atmosphere and tasty floss and green rice mayo which was recommended to me by the owner. She was super friendly and chatty. I would really recommend coming here. And super cheap

0x31752f08f74359b5:0x7b7840c735067b3f.comment: This place is situated just outside Bui vien walking street and is a very busy and popular shop. For such a small spot they do churn out a large some of food. I had the banh mi nem thit nuong, which was packed with meat with generous portions of pate and butter. I also ordered cap banh day, which is essentially steamed mochi as the carp portion of the sandwich and steamed pork. This thing was one of my favorite things to eat growing up in the states.

Found a hair in the salad unfortunately. Gave it to a staff member - not sure if they misunderstood but the same container was brought back to me, still with the hair in it. Sent it back again and was given a replacement container. The banh mi itself was a big serving size with generous fillings. Good flavours but the pate was a bit overpowering for my liking.

Is this expensive for a Banh Me? Yes

Is it absolutely massive? Yes

Can you feed a whole African village with one sandwich? Yes

On a serious note, I really do like this place. It offers a huge portion size and for delivery they separate the vegetables so you can choose which ones you add, of course I added everything for the best experience

Ordered their special bread in small size, but it was already filling and satisfying to the heart‚Äôs content! ü•ñ‚ú® Banh Mi is flavorful and hearty, service is great, and they even have a cozy space to enjoy your sandwich with refreshing fruit drinks. Definitely worth a visit!

Banh mi was full with toppings and richly slathered with pate and mayonnaise. It‚Äôs very rich and meaty. A bit too much meat for my taste. The portion was huge, so 2 of us had to share one. Package was nice and clean.

B√°nh m√¨ B√† Hu·ª≥nh (Madam Win) is quite a famous b√°nh m√¨ shop in Saigon, always busy with both delivery drivers and walk-in customers.

ü•ñ The baguette is crispy on the outside and soft inside, with generous fillings ‚Äî rich and flavorful meat, fresh cucumber, herbs, and pickled vegetables. It‚Äôs very filling, and the portion is so big that one person might not even be able to finish it!
ü•¨ My only small drawback is that the pickled vegetables are on the sweet side. Personally, I prefer them more sour as it helps cut through the richness.

üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ After dining in, we also ordered a couple more to take away for the family, and everyone was satisfied.

üì¶ I was pleasantly surprised by the takeaway packaging. Instead of just paper bags, they use proper boxes, and even separate the herbs and pickled vegetables individually ‚Äî very neat, clean, and thoughtful.

üí∞ Small size is 50,000 VND, big size is 75,000 VND. Considering the District 1 location, portion, and packaging, I think the price is reasonable.

Overall, it‚Äôs a very good b√°nh m√¨ experience. Definitely worth trying if you‚Äôre nearby! üçûüåøü•í

A big banh mi filled with good stuff. The bread is so crunchy and the fillings come with variety of deliciousness. One Banh mi can keep me full almost the whole day. Yummy üòã It‚Äôs my 2nd time here, will come back more.

This Banh Mi shop is an absolute hidden gem! Everything here is homemade ‚Äì from the crispy p√¢t√© to the fresh pickles ‚Äì and you can taste the love in every bite. The special bread is uniquely fluffy and crispy at the same time, better than any other Banh Mi place. If you‚Äôre looking for authentic street food with exceptional quality, this is a must-visit!

Ordered twice via grab from this shop for their banh mi and it‚Äôs absolutely amazing! My favorite is the house special which is packed with generous variety of ingredients. I love how they separate the vegetables, keeping everything fresh.
The pickles radish is especially delicious and all the ingredients blend perfectly with the bread. Speaking of the bread it‚Äôs perfectly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside!
We only ordered 1 banh mi each time and the portion was huge, easily enough for 2 pax.
Will definitely order again whenever I‚Äôm back, highly recommend!

The best Banh Mi in town! Only two selections and everything‚Äôs is made in advance so no wait! The bun is soft and crispy. The filling is so moorish and delicious - and they slather a good chunk of ghee in the centre to bind it all together. We ate right there in front of the kitchen in the rain amongst all the traffic chaos - great experience. Most seem to order on grab because of the location on a busy road.

I had the special b√°nh m√¨ here and it was absolutely amazing! The bread was perfectly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, and the fillings were so fresh, flavorful, and generous. Every bite had the perfect balance of savory meats, fresh herbs, and that delicious homemade sauce. The staff were friendly and welcoming, and the shop had a really local, authentic vibe. Easily one of the best b√°nh m√¨ experiences I‚Äôve had in Ho Chi Minh, highly recommend stopping by if you want a true taste of Vietnam!

The worst b√°nh m√¨ I‚Äôve had so far in Vietnam. Seriously terrible. I don‚Äôt know why it‚Äôs so popular.

I tried two sandwiches: the grilled pork and the special b√°nh m√¨.

The grilled pork wasn‚Äôt real grilled pork chop‚Äîit was more like hot dog meat. Nasty. I wanted actual grilled pork, not filler.

The special b√°nh m√¨ was full of cured meats that just tasted like preservatives. No good flavor‚Äîjust salty, fake, and unhealthy.

The bread was way too toasted, so hard it cut the roof of my mouth. It also didn‚Äôt seem freshly toasted‚Äîthe sandwich was room temperature and the meat inside was cold.

The mayo spread tasted weird and looked too yellow, which made me think it wasn‚Äôt fresh.

The price was also very high. Almost 100,000 VND for the special b√°nh m√¨.

Also the staff didn't care at all when I told them I didn't realize the grilled pork banh mi was not real meat. They basically said too bad, you paid for it.

We dined in and it was very comfortable. Our bahn mi were served with separate veggies so we can put as we like. The bread are very fresh, the meats were good, and the pate VERY VERY GREAT. I would definitely visit again. We also ordered their cafe sua da and it is very good.

Located at the corner of a busy road near Thai Binh Market, seems popular as you can see locals/ riders queuing to order and pick up. It is nicely packed in a box with the veggie and condiment in separated packs. The Banh Mi is quite big as it is fully packed with various type of meats, I like the mayo and pate which added extra favor to the sandwich. Will come back again.

Lining to queue can be daunting due to the crowd but stand on the right side for regular buyer as left side is for food delivery order.

Banh Mi is huge and can easily fit 2 normal eater, so 75k price for the special is decent price for the quality. Would recommend but depends on the queue

Got take out and the packaging was really nice. I ordered the best seller and it came with the veggies on the side. Was really nice but did feel a bit salty with all the butters and pate. Still was a great try though! It is also a little expensive for banh mi but not a huge deal to experience it once.

Great place if you hungry. Great B√°nh Mi.
Price very good. B√°nh Mi very full of good stuff. Come here!!!
Soo soo yummy. Only has pork so, no beef no chicken no cheese. The portion is huge.. and they are all nice staffs.. the coffee also good

Ordered mine trough Grab had the Dac Biet cut in half, mine was really Dry that‚Äòs why minus 1 star. Also Banh Mi is quite unbalanced for me it‚Äòs a bit too much meat plus the pork floss from this banh mi is sweet, also the pickled daikon & Carrot are also on the sweeter side i do need to tanginess [of vinegar from the pickles] to balance out the fat amount of meats, Pat√© & Mayo. Loved the Pat√© & Mayo tough! So all together if it wouldn‚Äòt be that dry & so sweet and meaty it would be a 5 Star Banh mi for me. Wouldn‚Äòt eat it again. The Banh Giay Gio und was typical Southern style,  the Cha chien [VN fried Sausage] was good but the bah giay was too sticky and small and not natural in texture like in Hanoi.. Would not recommend. I do recommend they‚Äòre coffee it‚Äòs really good but not much 2-3 sips and empty.

I had the xoi man. A little bit sickening to be honest, so much pate, it kind of looked like canned dog food. Glad I tried it so to see what the fuss was all about. I wouldn‚Äôt go back nor would I recommend it, unless you like heavy, meaty food. Kind of reminds me of banh mi huynh hoa. Price is very fair and reasonable.

0x31752f41359d407d:0xf23c276760f88a3c.comment: The food is actually decent but when we want to pay, the cashier insisted that we order additional coffee (which we didn‚Äôt). I and the cashier even went to upstairs to check the cup and it confirmed that we didn‚Äôt order the additional coffee but still they charged that. When we asked the receipt, they teared the receipt. So disappointed. It‚Äôs not about that ‚Äúthe additional coffee‚Äù, but the way they run the business is not ethical at all. We won‚Äôt come back. Not tourist friendly ‚òπÔ∏è
It is my second visit here. The bahn mi is really good. We had the grilled pork one and it tastes fresh ! We also highly recommend the matcha coconut, it‚Äôs really really amazing.

The banh mi here is absolutely delicious! The bread is perfectly crispy, and the filling is flavorful and satisfying. The staff are friendly, and helpful. The place is clean and comfortable. I will definitely come back again. Truly deserves 5 stars!‚Äù

Delicious banh mi! Fresh, yummy and good grilled pork. Value for money and so needed after a long day of walking in the heat! I like my banh mi with a little more filling but no complaints, was delicious and husband said it was the best one he‚Äôd had!
Easily 5 star Banhmi. They tasted delicious. So fresh and tasty and we'll priced. The owners are very friendly & warm. Definitely worth a visit.
Really friendly staff. Clean communication. Clean, fresh food. We tried the pork, chicken and egg banh mis. We loved the egg banh mi. Definitely will be back.
Our best find in HCMC was this little gem. Delicious Bahn Mi, cold beer, lovely staff and a great place to watch the world go by :)

Nice spot for coffee and banh mi. I stayed close so i came here few times for my coconut ice coffee (creamy and rich in flavour) the banh mi were freshly made and toasted.
I'd recommend the steak and cheese delicious.
Special bahn mi and pork and cheese bagn mi, we would definitely recommend. ü§§ We also had the iced salted coffee and coconut coffee ‚òïüëåThank you so much üôè

Boss banh mi place! My partner and I visited upon arriving into HCMC and wanting to avoid the absurdly overpriced other banh mi places. They were so good we ordered another two whilst eating our first ones! We got the grilled chicken each time, but we will definitely come back for more. The staff are very friendly here and the bottled drinks are nice and cold in the heat. Bonus point: they donate to charity with every banh mi sold, which is admirable. Highly recommend!

Randomly found this shop when passing by and man‚Ä¶their banh mi is delicious, baguette was crispy outside n fluffy inside, we ordered steak & cheese, grilled chicken and grilled pork, if u want a quick n tasty meal, definitely worth to pay a visit here

We arrive here quite late.. around 20:20pm.. the closing time was 20:30, but the girl was very happy and accomodating.. we order chicken and pork too, both of them were great! I recommended, plus they have a different promo :)
I‚Äôll come back!

The best banh mi I've ever had. First time in Vietnam and tried many all throughout out 10 night tour abd back home. We made this our first then last stop. The bread is crunchy and fresh, the filling is just right and a sauce that is so delicious. The orange juice is very refreshing.

After visiting Bahn Mi Me In where I had the beef one that was 189k Vietnamese Dong as that was the first Bahn Mi business that came up on search results and it was nearby, I was left with the impression that's the normal price. I noticed only tourists from USA, Canada, Europe and Japan there, but not any local Vietnamese people, as that is way out of price range for most locals. A friend of mine told me the standard price for Bahn Mi is 60k not 189k which is a ripoff and a half. So I did more exploring and found this place Bahn Mi by the bridge in District 4. Though it's not necessarily that nice looking from the outside, it is definately where the locals would go. So I opted to give this place a try, and OMG it far exceeded my expectations and then some! I first ordered the beef one which was significantly more expensive than the others being 59k at time of writing (yet a third of the price of the one from the overpriced Bahn Mi Me In), and believe me it was worth every penny. They use genuine beef steak, pan fry it and cut it into smaller pieces, then put it into the Vietnamese baguette, which had salad of its own. I took alot of pictures for everyone to see. The packaging was well done too, you can tell they are a relatively new business (4 years old at time of writing).  When I told the staff the food was incredible, he offered to have me meet the owner, who came down and greeted me, we exchanged dialog, I explained it's flavoured very well and I can't find any faults with it. Once I finished the beef bahn mi, curiosity got the better of me and then I ordered the chicken bahn mi which was 35k. That too was very delicious but second to the beef, as I feel bahn mi goes best with beef due to the toughness of baguette. I would implore anyone and everyone visiting Ho Chi Minh City and is looking for the best Bahn Mi to try this place, even if it means taking a taxi there, it really is worth it and a genuine asset to this brilliant city (and nation). No, I'm not exaggerating, it's a national treasure. I've added pics of both the beef and chicken bahn mi's
LOVED the banh mi here!!! It was the best we had in Vietnam. We ordered the grilled chicken
Went there for 3 times in a row, very delicious food & coffee, nicest staff and very reasonable prices :) would definitely recommend!!

The location eatery offers a wide variety of banh mi dishes and the bread is particularly good‚Äîhot, crunchy, and fresh‚Äîand the sauces and toppings are , distinctively, and delectably seasoned. The owner is really lovely and cares about both the quality and the customer experience, and the staff is passionate also. For travelers who enjoy bread as much as I do, this place is a ten out of ten experience, and I plan to come back soon to experience more diverse dishes on the menu.

Young vibrant girls who serve you well with smiles and laughter.  Food was deliciously good and fresh.  Went in to just have a look, ended up with not only great food but the Saigon Larger was even better.   Check it out when you are in HCMC next.
My favorite banh mi spot! Definitely worth a stop here. You can sit out front but you can a nice seat upstairs with a street view. Staff are super friendly as well!

Had a super special bahn mi - crispy & soft baguette, freshness oozing more and more with every bite, moderate on coriander, juicy meat, with the only caveat being some strong sour flavor i couldn‚Äôt identify (thus the minus 1-star). That part took some getting used to. Kind and accommodating service!

0x31752f36d20e6387:0xf86ddfcaf67c68a4.comment: Best banh mi in town as they have the crispy pork as filling. For scary cats like me who are less willing to try weird fillings, you can consider this place. Very affordable as well.

The owner is so nice! I stoped by in the morning around 7:30, chose one banh mi with beef and pate, very tasty.  I was in Da nang , Hoi A for several weeks, it is good to find the similar flavor in Saigon.
I‚Äôve eaten here several times, from b√°nh m√¨ to sticky rice and everything was delicious with reasonable prices

I bought 2 Banhmy: grilled pork bread and  mix all type of meat bread.

All were delicious, crispy, tasty and very cheap. 20k vnd ( 90 cents) for a bread that made me so full.

Oh wow! Just went past and craved a banh mi! I tried the chicken one and it was the best i had so far in hcmc! 20k is an amazing price and the taste was exceptionally good! If you dont like it spicy you should tell them but i love it spicy af so therefore it was ok but not overwhelmingly hot! Will definetely come back and try the other ones! Recommend 10 outta 10
Sorry but the baguette wasn't crispy and had a malt odor.  The sandwich fillings were fine but the bread was not delicious.
Ordered mixed bank mi - delicious & fresh not too soggy -light Vietnamese sandwich - very Cheap less than $1.50 AUD each üëç great to grab and eat on the go.

I recently had the pleasure of trying B√°nh M√¨ Tu·∫•n M·∫≠p on Pasteur Street. From the moment I took my first bite, I was hooked. The bread was incredibly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, providing the perfect texture contrast. The fillings were generous and flavorful, with a perfect balance of savory and sweet. I particularly enjoyed the Special Banh Mi. The overall experience was fantastic, and I'll definitely be returning for more.
One of the best of our trip, great service and delicious Bahn Mi üôå can also offer vego option of egg bahn mi without Pate.
absolutely stunning baguette for breakfast. really helpful guy selling and just beautiful food.

Ok lah very good.

Banh mi stall that looked sus. Was served by a security that was standing nearby. He said this is very good. Then the lady helped to make. We got a mixed banh mi at 40k. There were like different sus hams inside with Pate but it was super good?

Better than those ate in Singapore! Must try!

Really yummy banh mi, 4 stars is because we asked for less chilli and we got a high concentration of it in only one part of the banh mi. One of the best Banh Mi ever eaten, brilliance !!
