Cheap and good. Supporting the family business

0x31752fd84249edf7:0x845e9b755a03fce4.comment:
Tucked away inside a small alley across from Ben Thanh market you can find the most amazing Bahn mi around.
From the original classic, to a full lobster Bahn mi, there is surely something that you'll like.
I chose the pork with crispy skin Bahn mi, and I pretty much inhaled it in a few seconds it was so delicious. The bread is exceptionally fresh with a crisp outside and fluffy inside and the filling is generous.

A perfect spot away from the chaos, and friendly service to match the food. I can't wait to come back again.

Tucked behind a cute alley across from Ben Tranh is a banh mi shop that is beside a more famous food shop.   We went to this one and we are glad we did! This place has excellent fare.  What makes it good? Delicious fresh bread a perfect light crisp in outside and fresh lightly chewy inside. Fillings like beef skewers and chicken that are well marinated and juicy. The condiments are varied and house made and the veggie fillings inside are very fresh. If you're not a cilantro or hot pepper fan, those are on the side so you can add it if you are a fan! Your hands stay clean because they give you gloves for when all that ooey goodness spills out of your sandwich while you devour it.   Totally recommend.

These were probably the best Banh Mi we have ever had. We had the roast chicken and the roast crackling pork üê∑ üêî for around the 150-160k each. Can't fault them at all. Yes you can find cheaper at other shops, but they werent the same quality and size. We would definitely go back and if you go, you won't be disappointed üôè‚ù§Ô∏è If you need a beer to wash down the delicious Banh Mi, head to Pasteur St Craft Beer üç∫üòã afterwards.
Really nice Banh Mi, nice bread, nice ingredients and good service. We tried the Vietnamese pork sausage and grilled beef skewers banh mi, very good.

This was our first meal in Vietnam. The restaurant is tucked away in an alley, like many local spots. It‚Äôs a popular stop for tourists, so prices are slightly higher than typical local food. The banh mi was delicious, the coffee was good, service was excellent, and the environment was clean with charming d√©cor.

My honest review, when I came over to these restaurant and order their Banh mi, I have some regret when I notice that the restaurant beside is more "famous", as I think i should have go over to the other side, but since I am already here at the Banh mi restaurant, I just order their famous Banh mi, after finishing it, I ask them if I can order the food beside their stall, which is the famous stall. After trying, I told the staff, the food beside their stall is good, but your Banh mi is better, and I have no idea why so many people preferred the stall beside them??? If happen you come here, hope you can try both and judge for yourself. There is a saying by Bruce Lee, he fear not one who knows many but fear those who practice a key 10000 times. Lol. When you come here, you will know what I mean.

Regular and specialty Bahn Mi‚Äôs. Phenomenal Beef Rib Bahn Mi. I will have to come back for the lobster Bahn mi (Literally you need a 24 hour reservation and a deposit). Peter and the rest of the crew were fantastic.

Delicious, good quality Bahn Mi. They really know how to marinate their meat because it was so yum. Decent amount of meat and veggies. As mentioned in other reviews, it is tourist price but you can trust the quality. Would come again.

Wow. Amazing banh mi. I got the traditional and boy was it stuffed. I felt full after just half and I‚Äôm a big eater.

Coffee is also fantastic. Got a nice, strong kick to it, which is how Viet coffee should be.

It definitely exceed the expectations. The bread is crispy outside, soft inside.
Its definitely a tourist price ard 431,000 dong equals to sgd21. Service and afficiency is tip top.
Will definitely visit again if i want high quality standard. I bought 10 plain buns and now tat im back in sg and after 3 days the bun is still soft..üòã
We ordered the beef skewer bahn mi and the chicken platter, amazing! Im not usually a fan of pat√©, but their pat√© was so delicious, we ordered more! Highly recommended when in HCMC!

Beef Bahn Mi Roll here was the best roll I've had!
I had it take-away and they packaged it so neatly, with extra clear cloves for eating cleanly.
Flavours were perfect! Serving size was just right. Large enough to fit all fillings and super easy to eat.
They were busy so service was a little slow but that makes sense.
Little spot in a back street, but worth the journey.
It is a must visit!

Lovely Banh mi spot located off the Main Street in a cool and secluded area to grab lunch. The atmosphere, service, and food were all incredible! However, the least expensive Banh Mi on the menu was 64k VND. Very high class and fancy options but equally high price to match.
Very good food. Excellent service. Happy, chatty staff. A bit pricy, but worth it.

The most generous and fullest Bahn Mi - I ordered the classic bbq pork with added pork floss. They give you plastic gloves for a reason. The bun just overflows and can get messy in a very good way. Service is also very friendly and helpful. I accidentally tipped my hot tea which was totally my fault and they were so kind about it. Cleaned it up without making a fuss and brought back a new tea without charging or mentioning a thing.

B√°nh M√¨ M·∫π ·ªàn is a true gem in the heart of Ho Chi Minh City, serving up some of the best b√°nh m√¨ I‚Äôve ever tasted. The sandwiches are simply outstanding‚Äîfresh, vibrant, and bursting with flavor. The first visit left such a strong impression that I couldn‚Äôt resist coming back specifically for the pork b√°nh m√¨, and it was absolutely worth the return trip. The pork was perfectly marinated, juicy, and paired beautifully with the crisp pickled vegetables and fresh herbs, all tucked inside a warm, crunchy baguette.

The atmosphere is lively and authentic, making every bite feel like a genuine Saigon street food experience.¬†The staff are friendly and welcoming, and service is quick even during busy hours. Whether you‚Äôre a local or just passing through, B√°nh M√¨ M·∫π ·ªàn is a must-visit for anyone craving top-quality Vietnamese sandwiches. I can‚Äôt recommend it highly enough‚Äîdon‚Äôt miss out on the pork b√°nh m√¨!

Very good experience! The chicken was very good but the pork rib was awesome! It‚Äôs a cute little restaurant, so if you‚Äôre worried about street food, then this is a good option. It is slightly more expensive than the street vendors, but worth it for us!

The Banh Mi was a bit on the pricey side with over 200K for this one with Beef Skewers and a bit too much sauce which made the bun wet and salty, service was alright and the atmosphere was nice but I felt the Banh Mi  lost a bit of the authentic side of the Banh Mi‚Ä¶.

I recently discovered a charming little Banh Mi shop tucked away in an alley near Ben Thanh Market in Ho Chi Minh City. Over the years, I've tried countless Banh Mi, but their Stir-fried Prawn & Truffle Sauce Banh Mi is the best I've ever had.

While the prices are considered expensive by Vietnamese standards, I believe they are worth it. The staff is attentive and helpful, and the restaurant has a small, cozy atmosphere. However, it can get quite hot inside.

I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who loves Banh Mi and is visiting Ho Chi Minh City.
Must find if in Ho Chi Minh and fancy Banh Mi. Try the original first. Great value and washed down with a good beer. So good we had to take away another oneüëçWill definitely return.

0x31752f9a2b48b0f5:0x6a60bc45340de55c.comment: This place was recommended by the hostel we stayed in. For the price of 1kg banh, you can easily buy 2 regular ones in the city, so I think the weight will be the same. Very often, there's a queue in front of the place, so you need to wait. Price is 73k for 1 banh and they only sell 1 kind with some sort of pork spam inside with additional ingredients packed in 3 separate foil bags, so you can add them to the banh according to your preferences. There's a place to eat inside, just on the right side of the "window" where you do the purchase. Taste is so so, nothing special, I was able to eat 3/4 for the first time and it kept me staffed for a few hours but I'd not buy it again.

Absolutely the best Vietnamese b√°nh m√¨ in Ho Chi Minh! The menu is super simple‚Äîjust one type of b√°nh m√¨, no customizations, but the portion is huge, easily enough for two to share. The crust is perfectly crispy, slathered with rich pork liver p√¢t√©, layered with ham, pork jelly, and fresh veggies ü•¨ (served separately to add yourself). So flavorful and satisfying! Highly recommend!

The Banh mi is jumbo size. 3 people can eat one portion. There Is seperate queue for bill and order pickup. They have indoor seating also available. Usually there is a long queue here. Tastewise it's good but I had better banh mi from other shops..The quantity is really appreciable

I found this must-try Banh Mi shop all over social media, so I decided to give it a try. Luckily, it was just a short walk from my hotel.

I ordered their No.1 option for VND 75K (around SGD 3.50) and dined in at the shop right next to them. The first bite was absolutely delicious! ü•ñü§§

The portion was generous, definitely enough to share between two people.

Totally worth the hype!

Got the order as take-away and veggies packages always included, fresh pickles, onions, pate and the banhmi itself is always top-notch. The waiting line was long but efficient-organized line made it fast!!

As a local and been having Huynh Hoa since the banhmi was around 45.000 VND until now, I gotta say the price goes with the quality. The portion is huge, 2-3persons/portion so recommend to share it or big eater!!

First Bahn mi in Vietnam and WOW! The bread was perfection, super soft and crispy on the outside. The addition of pork floss is something I‚Äôve never seen back home in Sydney and I thought it hit the spot. It was huge and we shared it between two. Three stores side by side - one where they made it, one to order, and one with space to eat.

I was looking forward to this famous Banh Mi. The food taste was average. The bread and fillings were pre-made with plastic packaged veggies. It is too big to finish by one person. I felt the food has lost its soul, other than it is huge. Not as good as the ones we had in Da Nang.

(VERY) generous servings and I like how the veggies are on the side. We sat inside and there was a drink stand which was super convenient. First time trying sugar cane juice in Vietnam and was surprised as it tastes wayyyy better than the generic (and super grossly sweet) version in the US. Didn‚Äôt realize that this was a popular spot and that this was the banh mi place our Vietnamese friends recommended as we just passed by it and saw the long queue of customers and drivers waiting for their orders.

It's not my favorite. First, I like the idea that they just have one type of sandwich, but then I ate it and the three meats on it - some aren't for me. It's overpowering. The other thing is that they give everyone, individually wrapped, cucumbers, carrots, onions - also a glove to make it, and a wipe. There's a ton of wasted plastic for everyone of these made. It's pretty egregious to be honest.

Super solid huge Banh Mi, one was already so filling. The biggest one I've ever seen till now. For me, the meat was kinda lacking a bit of flavor. It felt like I was just eating a bunch of meat, but couldnt really distinguish what is what, but the P√¢t√© was super delicious.
Can def recommend to try out!

Positively surprised!
Was heading to another place when the long queue grabbed my attention. Stepped in closer and saw the price for one Banh Mi. It was more than double of what you get on the street.
A quick search online assured me that the quantity is going to be worth it.
And so it was. So big, cheesy, and meaty!!
Good thing I can eat big portions üòÖ.
I saw some sharing one and others eating whole one by themself. A lot of locals got one each.

You order, get in another queue to get it and then just sit next door to eat it with a drink of choice. Would definitely recommend!

We came by just before a black out occurred in the city!

The service was fast, queue to order and tell them how many pieces and pay. Go to the collection queue and enjoy your food there or bring it somewhere else to have it.

If you lazy there is another outlet / collection point for your Grab food orders and there were plenty of riders.

The Banh Mi is delicious and your won‚Äôt be disappointed as it comes packed separately with condiments too.

one per person is too much! recommend to cut half and share. love the meats and sauces, though i really didn‚Äôt know what i was eating. bread was warm light crispy, went well with the pork floss and hams. worth the queue. glad that there‚Äôs only one item on the menu.

If you're looking for a great Banh Mi spot, this one's a local favorite! People love to swing by for a bite or even order through Grab. I have to say, the classic ham has a pretty strong pork flavor, but it‚Äôs still super tasty when paired with all the fresh salad and delicious dressing. I enjoyed it.

The Banh Mi is very big which is sufficient for 2 persons. Overall, the ingredients is alot and there is only one choice of Banh Mi which is pork one. For the price paid (cost VND73,000), it‚Äôs worth it.

The queue is short and thus waiting time is ok.

No dine in is available but you can take away the Banh Mi and consumed it in the restaurant next to it. I suggest you order a drink (cost around VND20,000 to VND40,000) from the restaurant.

I would get why a lot of people would like this and why this is popular.

Very reasonably priced for the size and the amount of meat you get. It is huge !!! Huge with capital H. It couldn‚Äôt finish more than a bit more than half of it. Didn‚Äôt make me feel good afterwards üò¢

Flavors are good but they are not simple flavors. Verity of textures but I am not sure if they go well together. Their famous pate was worth the hype, it was very delicious.

They packed us some veggies, pickles, gloves and wet wipes.

There‚Äôs a line but moves quite quickly. You have to eat at the little juice shop next door (same owner). We had sugar cane juice which was delightful.

Unless you‚Äôre a big eater, like super big, I would recommend sharing. It is so much bigger than Sub Way‚Äôs 1 foot sandwich. Imagine it coming with 7 different fillings ü•π

The most indulgent Banh Mi I‚Äôve ever had. It oozes pate and mayo and feels super decadent but unfortunately the meat felt short, mostly cold cuts that felt like plastic and tasted cheap. Maybe they could consider raising the price for better quality fillings cause it was quite a shame. We were
also a bit out off by the fact that they give you all the filling ingredients like the herbs, cucumber, etc in separate plastic bags, which is quite wasteful. They should make it for you and save all that unnecessary plastic.
I would say it was worth trying but we wouldn‚Äôt go back due to to the meat.

This was a local recommendation and didn't disappoint. Huge serving, crunchy and soft bread roll, delicious pate and pork floss, with your own individually bagged salad, herbs and pickled veggies.

No input on toppings whatsoever it's simply 'how many', but they are not short of orders!
Even vacuum packed rolls, flying out the door on Grab (takeaway orders).
We ate next door at a small juice shop, peach ice teas and cute trays.

Small shreds of crunchy bread bits all over the floor because of how popular this place is. If you're not a big eater, then share one!
Absolutely delicious

ordered through grab. i was so happy with the size of the sandwich and that the greens and pickled veg were packed separately so as to keep their freshness. they also provide plastic gloves - a pleasant surprise. totally worth the price and delivery fee.

on the sandwich, it has everything im looking for in a banh mi - butter, mayo, pate, bologna, ham, pickled veg (radish), chili, and fresh veg. only thing missing is pickled carrot

will definitely order again but maybe split in half, it was much harder to finish by myself than i thought

If you are a Bahn mi fanatic, you definitely have to try this one here! It‚Äôs huge and cheap. The bread is soft and crunchy and the pate is the hero ingredient! There‚Äôs lots of it. They give you the garnishes on the side so you can have it your way. There‚Äôs a bit of queue at whole time but it‚Äôs pretty fast so don‚Äôt be scared of it. Next door has a few seats as well

0x31752f6b843c5e95:0xb274447a7fb5802e.comment:
While checking the google maps for the nearest banh mi place near our stay, this store caught my attention more.

We got to try Banh Mi Nem Nuong and Banh Mi Dac Biet for the price of 45,000vnd

The place has no seating so we ate it in the park along the way. It was tasty and nice to try both.
Highly recommended food and owner is so nice and beautiful. They doing charity every food they sold will donate 1000 dong to local charity human/ animal. Additional they also adopted 3 rabbits.

Tiny little shop that‚Äôs frequented mostly by locals. Just point and order! Customize your roll to your liking. They‚Äôre happy to oblige. Heck even get some extra pate to go in a takeaway container. Prices are really low, and it‚Äôs probably one of the best B√°nh M√¨ around.
Authentic and delicious. Generous with ingredients and great value.
Amazing fresh delicious Banh mi! And so so cheap you must try!
Really tasty banh mi, friendly staff. Recommended.

Omg, really underrated roadside stall banh mi. Was feeling hungry late at night and searched on Google map and found this to be nearest to me. Had a try and omg no regrets. Best near midnight snack ever for 50k dong. Will repeat nightly üòÑ

Surprisingly, the quality of Banh Mi of this stall is so nice and the price is almost half. Just 40k. The famous stall selling 73k...

One of my go-to places for b√°nh m√¨. The filing and price are just right. However, i would rather skip the shredded chicken for it is too sweet and go easy with the pate.
My favourite evening pit stop for tasty b√°nh mi. The nice lady working the trolly is helpful in getting you set with what you want. Great food at a great price.  What more could you ask for?

Original of Banh Mi Huynh Hoa.

Best Banh Mi! We shared their cheapest one at 40,000 VND, and it was excellent. They set up their cart at about 7 pm, and as soon as they rolled up, people were lining up, waiting for them to be ready. Mmmmmmm

0x31752fd242a96f7b:0x73eaee4cfc5b4843.comment: You know it'll be good when there are 5 grabs waiting for orders. Maybe a little heavy on the mayo but an amazingly delicious chicken banh mi. Would recommend!
i love their banh mi rolls! good portion, fresh ingredients, and the pork bits are just perfect. the baguette is always fresh, warm and crispy. we had this twice in a week cuz we love it so much
Ordered this on Grab and this was probably my favourite bahn mi of the trip. Generous amount of shredded chicken and great taste!

Standard banh mi. Not elite level so it gets a 4 stars - still great compared to America. We did pay 30-35k VND for one and the combo is a bit confusing (comes with coke or some kind of tea in a bag option).

Coke was 15,000 VND. We came here bc our place was around the corner and though we liked the smaller food stall across the street, this one is nearly as good.

Tasty Banh MI. Tried both the pork and chicken, and I can't decide which I liked more. Both were delicious. There was a little bit of a line at lunch time, but they were able to dish out sandwiches quickly and move the line along. You can tell it's a popular spot. Lots of food delivery services picking up sandwiches too.

FOOD & DRINKS
I obviously had to try the banh mi, which was decent. For a Vietnamese baguette with grilled meat, I always prefer the meat coming straight off the BBQ.

SERVICE
The guy who took orders was really nice and friendly. The banh mi was served quick.

ATMOSPHERE
What I think most tourists will like is that this food stall looks clean compared to other banh mi food stalls while not being much more expensive.

RATING
Its just that with some street banh mi, they pack so much more flavour when the meat is hot and fresh while not being more expensive.

I bought the combo(and it was around 18:30-40, not 20:00 when I wrote this post!) from this shop and THIS HAPPENED. It ruined my food and my clothes and my room!

Once I opened the coke, it EXPLODED so powerfully that my 25 sqm room is literally covered with coke stains. The explosion was so thorough that I could even find all the stains scattered everywhere. It will be swarmed with ants soon.

Most importantly, it almost ruined my laptop. Pity I couldn‚Äôt take the picture my laptop was all covered in coke. I was so urgent!

Trust me - I didn't shake the bottle on the way. My place is just 3 minutes away and I'm extra careful whenever I carry soda. Staffs there must have shaken and dumped the bottle all around - that's the only explanation. Otherwise it couldn't have ended up the biggest soda explosion I've ever seen.

Just DON‚ÄôT buy the combo menu here. No, just DON‚ÄôT buy anything. I could guess how they would handle other ingredients as well.

The pork was really tasty and tender, although there was a bit too much mayonnaise in my opinion
There was a wet tissue and a toothpick attached to the sandwich bag, which was very considerate

Was waiting 25 mins for an order, which was 1 bhan mi, I checked on my order and they said 15 mins! So I decided to cancel the order, which they had lost and had no idea what I ordered. So why did she say it would take 15 mins, of she doesn't even know the order?? Unprofessional

First time trying Banh mi
I really enjoyed it
Only downside is no seating

Really tasty Banh Mi (roast pork or shredded chicken) at a great price!
When you see people ordering them 6 at a time, you know it must be good!

I personally really like the sweet spread they use, it really makes the banh mi taste different, but I can understand people might not prefer it. Definitely give this one a go, one of the top banh mi in Saigon.
Clean, tasty, priced welll
Best banh mi i've had so far in saigon, tasty vegetables, juicy meat
Food and service are fine. I'll definitely get more B√°nh M√¨ here during my stay in HCM. Thanks a lot :-)

Refused to make me a ‚Äúchay‚Äù (vegetarian) bahn mi despite having chay in the place name‚Ä¶
Bread wasnt warm. chicken bahn mi was still ok. Staff spoke english.Take out only.
Not bad. Big for 34k grilled pork BM. Service fast. Take aways
Nice banh mi! Good price. Friendly staff

Best Bahn Mi I‚Äôve had so far.
Very popular but still having great service.
Very good, friendly.
Nice Banh my, there‚Äôs a lot of meat inside and it‚Äôs juicy

0x31752f04d394f1b3:0x664baa4679da8969.comment:
Located inside The Manufacture Countryside complex. It‚Äôs a block that have few restaurants inside. The concept is food truck food.

Banh mi taste is good. The price is good. You can ask the waitress in English.

It‚Äôs contained pork in few menus.

They also sell some kinds of local art craft. You can buy for gift.

Can you even say you‚Äôve been to Vietnam and not have had an iconic Banh Mi sandwich? This place is a gem and highly recommend if you are in District 1 in Saigon (HCMC). It is tucked away and not obvious from the street. Look for El Gaucho‚Äôs steakhouse, and it is next to it. Lots of filling options (though my default is pork), and the bread is amazing. They can make spicy or not. Wash it down with a Vietnamese ice coffee and you‚Äôll have a great lunch and experience a prime example of this iconic sandwich.

Great little food truck style Banh Mi place. Hidden away (you have to go through a walkway that is not easy to find). Maps took me to the other side, which is not accessible, go around the block to the other side to find the entrance.

The restaurant makes each bain mi sandwich to order, so the bread is crispy and the meat inside is savory and delicious.
Even if you take your bahn mi sandwich home, I'll keep coming back because the taste is as good as ever.

I ordered a Banh Mi 74 'signature' and it's absolutely delicious, crunchy outside and yummy inside with a combination of different classic Vietnamese banh mi ingredients. They have tables in front so you can sit down and enjoy your banh mi.

The only pity about this place is the decor and presentation say nothing about 'we sell delicious banh mi here'. You don't even see banh mi. I was curious where they make these yummy banh mi and found out the whole very nice restaurant standard kitchen  next door cooking studio, same owner.

This place was an absolutely amazing find! The staff was extremely friendly, and the food was out of this world. The bread was so perfect it could make any sandwich good. The freshness of everything and quality is like nothing I have ever found in the US. The tea is also unmatched. I may have to eat here everyday until I leave.
Hands down one of the best Banh Mi I ever had in my life. I ordered extra pork for my banh mi and worth every penny. Cute little place with amazing food and service. Drop by if you‚Äôre nearby.

Bahn Mi was a little dearer than we have been used to but it it tucked away near the five star hotels in Saigon and it presents exceptionally well. Teas and coffees were delicious and the Bahn mi was very very good. We enjoyed char su pork and char su chicken and there was a pizza option for those in the family who are over Bahn mi. Great service and a lovely place to sit through laneway surrounded by upmarket restaurants.

A small but modern Vietnamese sandwitch stall. Hygiene and sophisticated, a bit premium. Eat in tables availabe too.

The location is not facing the main street, you may need to walk into a sidewalk by 10meters to get there for their beautiful Banh Mi.

The place was so wonderful, service was great and the food was so tasty. It was worth the trek in the rain. The baguettes and pizza were freshly made and the salt coffee was to die for. I am usually a harsh critic and fussy eater, but this gem of a cafe in Ho Chi Minh City gets a 5 full stars. I'd give it 6 stars if possible.
The cooking class we had here was well organized. Friendly chef lady gave clear instructions and advice. The cooked food was tasty. I do recommend.

A fair review from your Asian friend
- overpriced.

Small portion with below average taste, but the place looks clean anyway.

It costed me 168k for all of those..

The food itself is quite good, fresh baguettes and tasty flavours.
However the menu is very deceptive, you only see the price without VAT, probably to show the place more attractive or cheap, but when you are about to pay you see the +8% added on the total, which doesn‚Äôt make it too budget friendly any more.
Nice Bahn Mi. Tried 3 different ones and they were all pretty good. Not the cheapest around but after a long day it was close and convenient. Would recommend

I bet this is one of the best places for Banh Mi in Saigon. The tofu Banh Mi is absolutely a gem so definitely give it a try! Atmosphere is also nice, the van is located inside an arcade giving you some peace off the street.

If you want to get a great Banh Mi, then why not go to BANH MI 74? ü•™

We wandered in here on a whim and so glad we did. There weren't many people around but the server was friendly, helpful and had great English to help us order.

We got a signature and a vegetarian one and my God, these sandwiches were good. Soft yet crunchy roll, delicious and warm fillings with fresh, crispy vegetables all in perfect proportions.

Not a huge serve but just the right amount to keep the wolves from the door and satisfy our hunger after a busy morning exploring. Kept us going until the next street side stop!

Stop in and eat here. Top spot and great value for money.
Amazing Banh Mi. Good selection and fresh juice. They have some good fans outside by the seating area which helped cool us down.
Came here twice during my visit to HCMC size it was near my hotel. Great bahn mis, iced teas, and shades area to eat. No complaints. The meats were so flavorful.
Very relax casual outdoor eating. Attentive waitress. Delicious and tasty Banh Mi. The coffee is also very tasty.

Very good banh mi. Bun is crispy and meat is juicy.
Will visit this shop again before flying home.

Our first dinner/supper after our landing on 18 Oct 2025.

This banh mi superb delicious üòã and good. Crispy bread and fresh veggies and mint üòã
Cold coffee also best. The lime üçã beverages go well with banh mi.

Kept going back for our dinners. Not sick eating vegan banh mi. Thank you friendly staff for recognise us. Your banh mi really nice.

The bubble tea I had was ok, but as dairy-free option isn‚Äôt widely available for bubble tea (I think), it‚Äôs great to find a vegan option here. I found the tapioca pearls to be a bit medium hard than chewy and soft.

Seating was mostly indoors. Suitable for 1-3 people in a group.
We have been here 3 times because it was that good. The staff is more than friendly and the food was great. It‚Äôs nice to eat vegan and the drinks are great. Best Banh Mi in town :)
Bahn Mi Xanh, Ho Chi Minh would have to be the best ever! This place is just a small shop front, clean, best tasting vegan and great service. This is a must visit!! 5 star all around
Not a fan of banh mi in general, nothing special about their vegan version. Ok for a quick meal and home delivery if needed.

It is not cheap but the Banh mi is very great! Acceptable. The Banh mi is very big and many toppings inside.
It is worth to buy.
Fantastic banh mi, we had the spicy tofu and premium one and they were both delicious. Thank you and we will come again!
Loved the food and i love that they accept credit cards.. very tourist friendly
Only vegetarian options. The spicy tofu b√°hn m√¨ was great, but it really is spicy. Nice ice tea as well.
Best vegan B√°hn Mi so far!! Definitely coming back.
The spicy tofu banh mi is very tasty, but I don't recommend it for Western tourists -- it gave me a bad case of diarrhea.

It's a good spot with fast service. I found the bread to fillings ratio to be off and the sauce didn't have funk like it should.

Overall it's good. The noise and cigarette smoke kill the vibe though
Delicious, clean, vegan and a good large bahn mi for 30-50k.
A tasty vegan alternative! The girl made the banh mi carefully and with love. Worth a try!
Yummy banh mi in a nice area. I liked the spicy tofu, went back a second time for mixed version and didn't like it so much. But a nice clean spot!
This place is very good, I stayed in the area for 9 days and I came here 3 days. You cannot miss out on this place if vegan in Vietnam!
Real good vegan food! üëå
Easily the best Vegetarian Banh Mi in Saigon! Locally source produce, vegetarian food, kind staff
One of the worst banh mi I have ever tried in Vietnam, I wonder how many bots just give it 5 stars

0x31752f001b5a825d:0xac5755fcc41e6202.comment: A very tiny takeaway store with the most unusual banh mi I have ever seen. The sizes are quite large - even the small sandwiches are a pretty hefty size. The young rice spread is sweet, savory, and very rich. It‚Äôs delicious. Service was fast and Theres a bit of space for motorbike parking available on the sidewalk.

"A unique b√°nh m√¨," they said. Sure, on paper it is. But if you were to blindfold me and ask me to tell a difference between this and any other cold-cut b√°nh m√¨, I wouldn't be able to tell.

I went early morning to grab one for breakfast so there was no wait. The prices seem to have gone up slightly for everything. The small is now 38K & the large is 59K. Honestly, the prices are not bad for how big the portion sizes are. The small is bigger than the average b√°nh m√¨ you'd find in most street stalls & is more than enough (or even a little too much) for the average Vietnamese' appetite.

Taste-wise, however, it was a bit of a letdown. Was it bad by any means? No. In fact, I found it quite solid... as any other solid cold-cut b√°nh m√¨ you'd find out there in HCMC (which are plenty). Its one advertised unique aspect, the c·ªëm butter, absolutely did not come through at all, not even a hint, when eaten together with everything else as a whole sandwich. The pate was the dominant flavor. When I tried the c·ªëm butter on its own, it tasted like the pork floss that was directly placed on top of it instead. Speaking of which, their pork floss was really good & apparently they have 2 kinds, a regular and a fried-shallots one which you have to specifically request since they don't tell you about it lol

very interesting gimmick for banh mi. portion is huge. definitely a must-try!

Went yesterday & was very impressed.

Great value, I will return as this is right by our office.
perfect

0x31752f416b348db5:0xf0a1ac863e3e378e.comment: Local diner near wet market. Staff can't speak English but are very friendly. Food was served fast and hot. Bahn mi filling may look too few but pressing the bread flat is the key (personal preference).

I loved their reasonably priced, no-nonsense, delicious and hearty bahn mi. The store offers a variety of vietnamese and chinese products including meats, pastries and various dishes. Its located just across the back area of Bitexco Building in District 1.

Walkable from the center. 30K for a big volume and nice taste.
They have other local dish such as Com Tam as well.

We stopped here to get out of the rain. And I'm so glad that we did. We both had a BBQ Banh Mi which is delicious. I had an orange and mango juice. Freshly squeezed. And Wendy had iced lemon.
Very good.

Seriously good food... the pork belly made me weep with joy...perfectly crunchy skin... the pate has great flavor and I've eaten here twice and I'm probably going to eat there again today... don't miss out

So disappointed that my favourite place - a go to place for banh mi had come to the end. I bought banh mi and snack for my late night super.
It was smelly due to the pickled veggie, the meat was not fresh anymore so I discarded it.
The shredded dried beef...tasteless and quite expensive for such a small portion.
No longer Nhu lan for me.

Today, I had a chance to try the famous Banh Mi Nhu Lan, and it did not disappoint! I ordered two types of sandwiches: the fresh baguette with braised pork and the fresh baguette with xiu mai (Vietnamese meatballs). Both were delicious and left a strong impression. The fresh baguette was soft and chewy, providing a perfect base for the flavorful fillings.

The braised pork was tender and well-seasoned, melting in my mouth with each bite. It paired beautifully with the fresh bread, making every bite rich and satisfying. The xiu mai, on the other hand, had a delightful savory taste with a hint of sweetness, just the way it should be. Each xiu mai meatball was juicy, tender, and full of flavor.

Prices here are reasonable for the quality; the fresh baguettes are 40,000 VND, while the regular baguettes are 30,000 VND. Both options offer great value for a delicious and filling meal.

Overall, Banh Mi Nhu Lan lives up to its reputation. With fresh ingredients, balanced flavors, and a fair price, this place is a must-visit for any Banh Mi lover. The variety and quality make it worth coming back to explore more flavors!
The dining area is quite clean. The ph·ªü soup is very fresh and light. The b√°nh m√¨ is delicious and the portion is large. Very local atmosphere.

Place like foodcourt, got few stall there. Food around 50k+-, juices 20k+-.
Recommend? Okok only, nothings special.

This place is famous for their Banh Mi, may not be the top choice by locals standard (everyone has their favourite) but surely among the best. One thing that stands out is this place is definitely local, price is local (VND30k) for 1 Banh Mi, customers are mostly local, no English menu is another sign. Now the taste review - YUMMY!!!!

Nothing fancy, but really good, Banh Mi. If you're in the area and are looking for a quick local bite, this place won't disappoint.

It won't be a life altering experience, but you won't be disappointed.

These staff are so rude and i definitely disagreee with there attitude. They annouced me Banh Mi Heo Quay is 30 when i'm transfer 30 they said price is 32. Probably it's not my fault more than that they said to me " Kh√¥ng c√≥ ti·ªÅn th√¨ kh·ªèi ƒÉn" Hell nah :))

Not very friendly to tourist ngl, I was looking at which box food to buy and the owner simply took it off my hands and put it back onto the shelf as if I was going to steal it. Store owner not willing to do extra for customer, a lot of things are off the shelf, no heating service. Some overpriced and left on the shelf so I‚Äôm not even sure how fresh it is.

We were walking around the city looking for somewhere to eat when we walked past this place. We noticed the deli counter with hanging meat, cheese and bread, then saw people eating inside. We found the menu then sat down to eat. We ordered no.18, rice, roast fried pork and vegetables,  it was quite tasty. As a family of 4 travelling around Vietnam eating in many different establishments, this was by far a good experience,  in what felt like a truly traditional/ foreign shop.Hardly anyone speak English, but we manage to request our meal.
Thank you
It only cost 50k for each meal
We all ate and had a drink, paid for the wet washer they give you, $15 aus
We received complimentary cold green veg soup, was different but ok

The place has lots of different varieties of food. The service is very fast, and the staff here is friendly, nice and very welcoming. The food tastes incredible! Everything is homemade and so delicious (in my opinion everybody has to try the coups and the duck)!!! I will definitely come back here a million times more.

great place to grab a quick bite or a late lunch! overall the food was pretty decent and came out quick. the seating is outdoors but covered. we really enjoyed the banh mi and the banh bao.  would come again!

I love this place. Heck, i would eat here every day
Food is good, fresh and tasty. Prices are rasonable for the portion sizes
The owners are on site making sure things go smoothly. They speak zero english but are extremely helpful
The only issue is that they have no restrooms

Ordered a bbq pork banh mi from the counter. Love the pate in the sandwich, great tasting. Good price ,30k, for a sandwich. Also had a pork bao. The second time I went, I received chicken banh mi instead of pork. Did not notice until I left and bit into it. It was good too.

One of the selling points of this restaurant(shop) is the variety of the food they offer to customers. There are many places in town where you can find better taste of banh mi, better Pho noodle, better chicken rice than the food of this restaurant. But you may not find any place where they offer most kind of local street food in one restaurant. For me, taste and quality of the food serving here is only acceptable with the reasonable price. It could be a perfect place for friends and family where everyone doesn't have to eat the same dish at one specific street food place. You can have banh mi while your friends can order noodle, spring roll, pho or rice.
Beside of the various kind of food they offer, you can buy processed food such as ham, sausage, liver pate, bacon, etc. Also you can find snacks or sweets as souvenir. Again the taste is only at the acceptable average level but reasonable price.
In case you come and visit the city as a group or family in short period, this shop could be a good destination to eat and shop many things so you don't have to go here and there.
Today, I had roasted pork on rice (Suon Bi Cha) and the taste is above the average at the price of 50K. The dish satisfied me !

Inexpensive, great portion, filled with freshness from the herbs and the pickled veggies just cut through all the meatyness.
The large meatball is just utterly juicy.
Service was quick and fast.

The staff member who took my order was respectful and product was delivered speedy. They made my Banh Mi without coriander. 25,000VND

The shop was quite clean inside and the outside that makes me feel safe!!
Thank you Bread 110!!

Just had my 4th banh mi from here this week. Amazing stuff. Even the chiles are more flavorful and less spicy than most places. 10x better than any of the banh mi ha noi shops

Everything perfect, from food to service.

We‚Äôre by no means banh mi experts, but after trying several spots in Ho Chi Minh City, Grandma Lu was hands down our favorite. So much so that we came back three times during our five-day stay!

The sandwiches are absolutely delicious‚Äîfresh, flavorful, and perfectly balanced. Our top picks were the Grandma, Pulled Chicken, and Tuna‚Äîeach one packed with bold flavors and the perfect crunch from the baguette.

The shop itself could use a little TLC when it comes to decor, but honestly, that just adds to its charm. At the end of the day, it‚Äôs all about the food, and Grandma Lu delivers in the best way possible. If you‚Äôre in HCMC and craving banh mi, this spot is a must-visit!

Love the banh mi here, crispy and freshly baked! Beef stew is also yummy, goes well with their plain banh mi üòã
Staff, Khoi is friendly and helpful.

We really enjoyed the Grandma Lu Bahn Mi. We went back for the second time. The persons in charge Mr Khoi and Mr Vinh have been very helpful and provided great service. Mr Khoi speaks good English and that was helpful. The Vietnamese coffee we ordered with special request for less sweetness was brilliant. No one should leave Vietnam without trying their original Vietnamese coffee in my humblest opinion.

We even ordered some Grandma Lu's Bahn Mi to go to treat the Sotetsu Grand Fresca Hotel front reception staff who recommended us Grandma Lu's Bahn Mi place.

Delicious banh mi! The rolls are the most crispy and fresh I have had in Vietnam.
Clean and comfortable atmosphere. Tried their beef stew and grandma banh mi..tastes amazing and a good choice for a budget meal. definitely will be back again when I visit HCM in the future

Would highly recommend.

Very chilled banh mi place.
B√°nh mi was crispy but too dry, the stuffing of chicken, eggs and sauce were good.

talk about a Banh Mi that warms you up!

iv had a few of the different Banh Mi offerings here now and everything is legit delicious!

one of the newest items is their Tuna Banh Mi! definitely in my top 3s!
their Shredded Chicken one is also super tasty and unique! or go for the classic Banh Mi Grandma Lu - so good!

don't forget to ask for their Green Bread - they use a locally produced Samphire that gives it the colour, healthy too!

I was concerned with parking, so I tried this through Grab. If you are walking distance from here, I don't believe you will be disappointed.

Unfortunate, but in general, I think b√°nh m√¨s are only okay. Some are better than others, and I usually just like egg ones.

However, the sandwiches I had here (1 Japanese tuna & 1 truffle mushroom egg) were both quite good. I haven't seen any other place sell a truffle egg one, and most don't sell tuna.

The quality of the tuna tasted like one I might find in Korea. The truffle egg was unique; it was nice and warm. The flavors for both were better suited for western/non-Vietnamese palates. They did not have the typical V stuffing or sauces. Both were heavy with mayo (normally, I'm not a fan, but it was good here).

Standard b√°nh m√¨ size.

These are 2-3x most b√°nh m√¨s, though. I'm used to getting egg ones from street carts for 12-18K or from restaurants for 20-40K. These were 59K/$2.30 each. *There was a small discount ƒë5,900 on Grab (when I ordered) & another ƒë10K off the total, but with the Grab fee, I still paid more for 2 b√°nh m√¨s than I normally would pay.

I still definitely recommend the truffle egg. Next time, I will try the pulled chicken.

TRULY you can't tell me otherwise that this clean, air-conditioned restaurant serves affordable and one of the best composition of ingredients of banh mi.

We came here every morning we stayed in HCM. Get the original Grandma Lu Banh mi at 49k vnd. It will blow your mind. They open at 6am. The French breadstick is also very nice 35k vnd, it is a slimmer baguette which is easier to bite into, and does not have vegetables.

Staff speak good English and are always kind to ask if you consume coriander or spice.

Only 1 minor comment is that they don't mix the vegetables with the meat, so everytine you bite into one side of the baguette, you only ever put either meat, or vegetable into your mouth. This is just me being picky.

Their egg coffee is great and the iced latte was decent.

Inside the restaurant is an entrance to a hotel, so don't be alarmed.
So yummy üòãüòãüòã I got the truffle mushroom banh mi yum-yum extra points cuz they were playing Seventeen (my favorite artist)

Was hungry and walking around the neighborhood looking for some food, and stumbled upon this place. Decided to give it a shot upon seeing the positive reviews.

Indeed the reviews were true! It's small cozy little cafe that serves some amazing Banh Mi and drinks for really reasonable prices, compared to the other stores around the vicinity.

I got a pulled chicken banh mi (Vnd 49k) and guav houjicha (Vnd 45k). Both tasted amazing!

If you're around the area and looking for some good banh mi, this is definitely one of the places!
The bread is baked in the oven so it is really crispy. It's the most delicious Banh Mi I've ever eaten. Really delicious & cozy place. I highly recommend! 5/5

Found this very unique westernised fusion cosy cafe selling the freshest Banh mi in Ho Chi Minh City. 'Grandma Lu' is the place you should not missed if u happened to be here! The Banh Mi is so different from those u find in the streets. Try it for yourself! It is so delicious and their unique Coffee blend is so robust. It is served over an 'iced' coffee ball, the best ice coffee I've tasted üòã! Lemon grass drink is very refreshing too!

Friendly atmosphere & food price is so affordable. Accommodation is available here if you are a solo traveller. Check it out soon... üòâ

Follow @bredgyeats for more food posts!

Where there's banh mi, there's savoury sticky rice, and there's little reason not to try both. The fluffy baguette trumps the sticky rice for its subtle sweetness and yeasty aroma it adds to each bite, sandwiching a wonderful balance of ingredients that palates from across the globe have grown to love. The rich savoriness of the meats melded with the mayo, pate, pickled carrots and daikon, cucumbers, and cilantro creates a harmonious experience that's seldom found in Toronto. Sharing many common ingredients like sliced cold cuts and a savoury, rich pate. The addictive glutinous texture serves as an excellent vehicle for the rest of the toppings, too, including a fragrant scallion oil, subtly sweet pork floss, along with crunchy peanuts. I find comfort in knowing great banh mi can be found no matter what district you're in, as this location hits the spot too. It's up to you whether you prefer a coarser, stronger pate and a touch easier on the mayo. The sticky rice even includes Chinese sausage and quail egg.

A banh mi shop with a good reputation around the area (Chinatown, District 5); it has been in business since 1968, and sells over 1000 breads daily. I quite like this banh mi, as it has a nice aroma from the meatballs (x√≠u m·∫°i) inside. Price is good (30K each) and taste is good.

0x31752eeef14d0d01:0x4e38da3a124ce2a1.comment: I came to check out this place as it appeared on some Youtube videos. The best banh mi I have ever had in Sai Gon. The pate is so buttery and tasty. The meat is fresh and well balanced with the vegetable. Price is only 35k for a large one.

One of the best banhmi you can get in Saigon with an affordable price. Friendly staff is also a huge plus. I‚Äôve been an admirer for more than 5 years and the quality has never gone down even a notch. The place is as much a local hidden gem as the term can get.
Best Banh Mi in town. The other sandwiches leave me very thirsty because of the loaded MSG but this one does not. My whole family likes them.
Really a very nice Banh Mi. I always make sure to drop by when I'm in the vicinity and get me one. Together with a ca phe sua da the perfect pick up between lunch and dinner.
Delicious

Bring me a Banh Mi, and the only thing left will be the crumbs that flaked off the crispy baguette. Kim Dung is on my dad's list of must-eats back in Vietnam, and that's cause they get nearly everything right. A yeasty, crusty baguette with a crackly crisp exterior and a fluffy interior cuddles the classic trio of Vietnamese cold cuts. A generous, meaty bite that's layered with pickled carrots and daikon that bring a refreshing tang and crunch. The cucumber and cilantro offer freshness, while the generous amount of p√¢t√© adds a deep umami and richness without an unpleasant aftertaste. A swipe of Vietnamese mayo spread ties it all together, just enough to enrich the bite without overwhelming it.

0x31752fbe84ee2a89:0x53ebbde5d9763c58.comment: I ordered the Banh Mi Thap Cam for 35k. It was really good. You get what you pay for. I‚Äôll return and try their other options. I still have a few more to try out but wouldn‚Äôt mind this being my go to spot in D10.

This is hands down the best banh mi I‚Äôve had in the whole of Vietnam. I‚Äôve tried many up and down the country now and I‚Äôve been disappointed every time comparing it to here. I believe if more people knew about this place, it would have people queuing from everywhere. Bread and filling quality never disappoints. In my experience lovely friendly staff too.

another Banh Mi spot not to miss out!
these guys make their own unique spin on the pate.. has a more rich and meatier texture and flavour.

situated in the hustle and bustle of district 10. residing amongst the locals, this spot would easily be missed if you didnt intentionally come out here!

add it to your Banh Mi to do list!

Coming here from a Max McFarlin's video. Bread 29k is full of pate and meat. The taste is unique because of the grilled pate. The bread could be kept warm for better user experience. Not the best "banh mi" but still special.

I‚Äôve been on a quest to find the best banh mi and this is one of my  personal favorites. The price is really good and it‚Äôs just balanced. With each bite, you‚Äôre getting the correct amount of bread to pate to meat to vegetable.  The only thing that I wish they did was toast the bread. If they did that, it‚Äôs game over and they‚Äôd have the best b√°nh m√¨

It's a bit far from the city centre. However, if you want to feel local mood, give a try!
They can't speak any other languages, but everyone try to help you. Even their customers showed us how much it should be!
Next to the shop, they put many little tables and chairs, so you can sit back and relax as well. They also sell drinks, If you order drinks, they give you free cold tea. And free refills as well.
The greatest sandwich in the world.

I had a great dining experience at Qu√°n Ngon ‚Äì B√∫n Ch·∫£ H√† N·ªôi. This place is a solid choice for anyone wanting to try authentic northern Vietnamese flavors, especially the famous B√∫n Ch·∫£.

Pros:
‚Ä¢	Authentic taste: The B√∫n Ch·∫£ here was flavorful and satisfying. The grilled pork had a nice smoky aroma, the broth was fresh and well-balanced, and the herbs and noodles were generous and fresh.
‚Ä¢	Local vibe: The restaurant has a simple, clean, and local-style atmosphere. It feels very genuine and relaxed, which adds to the experience.
‚Ä¢	Affordable prices: For the quality of food, the prices are very reasonable. It‚Äôs definitely good value for money.
‚Ä¢	Friendly service: The staff were friendly and tried their best to assist, even though their English was limited. Their helpful attitude made the experience pleasant.

Very good, in a high pace Street.
Kinda small but you can get the local vibe.
The food was very tasty, and the spring rolls were of a decent size and full of flavour...
All the staff attended our needs and were very helpful.
Fast and funny

Best vegetarian meal I had in Ho Chi Minh - I came back again just for it! The bun cha was deliciously fresh with a range of delightful flavours, and the spring rolls that came were crispy and packed! Thank you!!

This is the best Bun Cha in the world! Possibly my favourite meal I had all throughout Vietnam. Super fresh noodles with the most perfectly balanced broth and incredible meat balls. So good we came back twice.

Enjoyed a lovely meal here. The food was fresh and delicious, the service was attentive which made for an enjoyable experience. The vegetarian spring rolls were just so good. Well done on providing a a great place to eat.

Went for lunch on a weekday. It was busy, but I was seated quickly. The staff are helpful. It's a restaurant that caters to tourists, with tourist prices and strong aircon. The menu has pictures and English descriptions. I ordered the special set. It arrived quickly. The meat pieces were tasty. The spring roll was thick and crunchy, but not particularly flavorful. The noodles with the sauce were very good. The leftover sauce was great, I drank it all. Paid with a card.

I am speechless! The food is absolutely delicious, always fresh and tasty! This is my favorite restaurant in Saigon. Hands down, the best bun cha Ha Noi I have ever eaten.
I always end up eating here whenever Im visiting. Staff‚Äôs attitude is always great as wellüòä

Bun Cha set with extra meatballs and spring roll ordered on grab. Food came quickly, packed in individual boxes to ensure freshness. Grilled pork and meatballs were well seasoned, spring roll crispy and delicious. Wrapped with lettuce almost felt like a Korean meat wrap

On my last day in Vietnam, I really wanted to have Bun Cha Hanoi, so I decided to visit even though I was already a little full.

The staff were very kind and told us it was fine to share between two people.
When I asked for an extra plate, they even split the soup into two bowls for us without charge.
That thoughtful service was so heartwarming that I already felt happy before even tasting the food‚ÄºÔ∏é‚ÄºÔ∏é

And of course, the dishes were delicious.
It was the best spring roll I had in Vietnam, and honestly, I think I could have finished the Bun Cha Hanoi by myself even though I was already full.

When I paid with a large bill, the staff didn‚Äôt have enough small notes for the change.

They kindly tried to give me 2000 VND instead of 1000, but I refused and told them to keep the change.
Even in a tourist area, they didn‚Äôt try to take advantage, but put the customer first, which was really wonderful.

As a sweet gesture, they even gave me candy instead of the change :)
It was so cute, and I really liked it.

Wonderful staff and wonderful food.
There is no reason not to go.
We liked the bun cha, the meatballs were tasty and the ingredients fresh. The spring rolls were also good. Overall recommended

My Vietnamese friend think is good enough for his taste.my Indian friend also find it tasty . We enjoy the meal and the environment is chill and they speak English so no problem in communication. If you are around area and wanna try Vietnamese food just give it a try  .

Today, I visited Qu√°n Ngon - B√∫n Ch·∫£ H√† N·ªôi with friends. This humble eatery is tucked away in a side street near the entrance to Ph·ªë ƒêi B·ªô B√πi Vi·ªán. Despite its central location in a popular tourist hotspot, the prices are very reasonable. For a special menu, which included a spring roll, the cost was under 100,000 VND. I also ordered some extra meat.

The restaurant offers air-conditioned seating, making it a comfortable escape from the heat. The food was delicious‚Äîthe meat was perfectly grilled, and the broth was rich and flavorful. Overall, a great dining experience!

Good Vietnamese pork belly strips. The patties were just ok, less smoky than most places in Ha Noi. The soup is good especially by adding the calamansi lime + garlic + chopped üå∂ chili. We were pretty satisfied.

Complete or special set 100K + meat only 60K + Spring Roll 20K = 180K nett. As expected because it is in touristic area (9 Aug 2025)
Our first stop in Vietnam before a big trip! We loved the food and the service was amazing. Caters to tourists but still very authentic, with a lovely and helpful server.
this bun cha feels more similar to the ones i had in hanoi. freshly made, hot and delicious. absolutely no complains. situated near the bustling bui vien street.

I ordered the special Bun Cha set, and it was hands down the best Bun Cha I‚Äôve ever had! The pork was perfectly grilled with a smoky, tender flavor, the broth was rich and balanced, and the herbs were incredibly fresh. Everything tasted authentic and full of love. Highly recommend for anyone craving a true Vietnamese food experience!

-offered a 'small gift' to incentivise leaving this review-

Very good Bun Cha and fried spring rolls cost 100k dong. The waiter helped to teach how to properly eat it as we are tourists. I'd eat here again.
My first meal in Vietnam and it was so delicious, lots of flavour and big portion. I couldn‚Äôt finish it all. Highly recommended trying this place.

Absolutely worth the visit! This b√∫n ch·∫£ spot serves some of the best grilled pork and noodle dishes. The meat is perfectly charred and tender, soaked in a flavourful dipping broth that balances sweet, sour, and savoury notes beautifully.

The noodles are fresh, the herbs are abundant, and everything comes together for a classic and satisfying Vietnamese meal. The portions are generous.

The place is no-frills and always busy, but the service is quick and friendly. If you're looking for authentic b√∫n ch·∫£,  this is a must-try.

0x31752f73c4de5b2f:0x77a2344273a08a45.comment: Lovely restaurant for lunch. The food is amazing and the portion is reasonable for the price, especially in district 1. The broth is light but got some good fishy taste. The staffs are nice and fast, the place is a bit small with few tables so more suitable for couples. 8.5/10, highly recommend the crunchy fishcake.

We loved everything at The Buns ‚Äì Bun Cha Cha. The food was fresh and flavorful, but the sat√™ sauce was the real highlight. It had the perfect balance of spice and taste, so good that we even bought 2 kilos to take home. The staff were friendly and the place has a cozy vibe. Definitely worth a visit.

I had a fishcake noodle soup, milk coffee, and caramel pudding. Everything tastes ok. I liked the soup. Coffee tasted like 120% sugar even though I requested less sugar, but that's the way it is in Saigon, so everything's still good! Seems like locals who work nearby tend to frequent this place during lunch. Good to try if you're nearby.

Found this place after visiting the history museum. A lovely place, with relaxing vibe.

This place only serve Central Style Bun Ca (rice vermicelli with fish cake). Rich broth, fresh and spongey fish cake + crunchy fish cake slides, made the bowl feel like a dancing party of taste and texture.

I love the shacha sauce that is slightly sweet, sour, and spicy, paired real well with the already rich broth.

The additional cabbage side dish complements quite well with the bowl of noodle, making the dish whole and nutritious.

I like vibe, it's giving a failed coffee shop turned Noodle place, and they succeed in making that attractive, tasteful bowl of noodle. They didn't focus on the design, more so the food just so you know.

Price is very district 1 (mid-high), but the look of the place, and the portion will justify why.
I highly recommend it for its delicious food and nice service. However, the space is small. Need to avoid rush hours, such as lunchtime

The Buns is a small restaurant located in a back alley in District 1. The restaurant is decorated in a simple, yet stylish way, with wooden tables and chairs, and a few faux foliage plants.

I ordered B√∫n Ch·∫£ C√° (Fishcake Noodle Soup), which cost VND 52.000. The dish was inspired by b√∫n ch·∫£ c√° Quy Nh∆°n. The broth is stewed from the head and bones of the fish, giving it a natural sweetness. The crispy fishcake enhances the enjoyment of the b√∫n dish. A special feature of the restaurant is that they use shredded cabbage as a vegetable side dish, which is very strange but delicious.

The price is reasonable and the portion is just right. The service is a bit slow, but the staff are friendly and supportive.

If you are in the heart of Saigon and looking for a new Vietnamese fishcake noodle soup experience, be sure to check out The Buns.

This is a nice, cozy place, located in district 1. Their vermicelli is made to middle Vietnam standards, yet still managed to keep the savory taste of southern cuisine.

The special bowl I ordered cost roughly 75k, while the regular bowls are around 50k, which is relatively reasonable, comparing to the prices in D1.

I love the savory taste, the choice of toppings, which is a combination of fried fishcake, steamed crabcake, some braised pork leg.

Overall, this is a good spot for people who wants to grab a quick bite. The only cons is the place is a little bit small for larger groups.
Very friendly staffs and delicious food. I would recommend to go. Prices are reasonable, very good price quality.
Delicious meal. I ordered the special one ‚Äòcause I wanted to try as much as possible. Staff is nice, welcoming and helpful. Will be back next time we are in Ho Chi Minh city again.
Tucked away in a quiet street like a hidden gem. The prawn cakes are delicious and had us coming back for more. Staff can speak basic English so thats a plus.

0x31752f776216d891:0x69d47584d9fed9ae.comment: It's Bun Bo Hue Noodle shop, which was selected as "selected" by Michelin. The shop is located on the very small street and you can park your motorbike at next wider street. The shop is very small comparing to the popularity, so you may have a seat with someone. It's quite normal in Vietnam. Anyway the Bun noodle looks very simple and normal, but the soup and meat were really nice. Simply it tastes very good. The price was 45KVND. The value for the price was also really good here.

Very authentic experience, shop was mostly filled with locals. But no issues with ordering because they had a semi English menu ready. Broth was tasty, be sure to add some lime and chilli! The noodles came with a bowl of lard (i think?) and I mimicked the locals by pairing one piece with a big mouth of noodles. Yum!

10/10 ‚Äî hands down the BEST place for B√∫n B√≤ Hu·∫ø. I like to think of myself as a bit of an expert when it comes to this dish, and I had to order a second bowl just to confirm how good it really was. It definitely lives up to its Michelin star from 2024. The space is tight, so expect some heat ‚Äîbut trust me, the food more than makes up for it.

The restaurant is tucked away in a small alley, but just follow Google Maps and you‚Äôll find it. Lots of locals eat here, the prices are super cheap, and the food is flavorful. The meat is tender and juicy, and the owner can speak English, which makes ordering easy.
Street food worth to visit. Delicious Bun Bo Hue especially when u add lime and chili oil (be mindful as chili oil so spicy üòÑ)

Really good local vietnamese food in HCMC - tried #1 and #6. It's hidden in one of the alleys in the back market street. Come early, lunch crowd comes in starting ~1150 !

Lost in the alleyways of Saigon we found this unique restaurant hidden away from the busy streets. Our drive there was as exciting as the experience inside. The place offered not only a very special Vietnamese dish but also a homely feeling to us. The food was amazing, but the service is 5 out of 5. The people were incredibly kind and friendly. Definitely captures the authentic taste and vibe of an everyday food stall in Saigon. Filled with locals. Despite being well-known and always fully seated during dining hours, we were greeted and served warmly.

This is one of the best Bun Bo I have tried in Vietnam. The taste of the food here is already a 5 star, but they are very nice and serve you with a smile, which is not so common at local stores like this. The meat here is really tender and delicious, but the price is only 40K for a bowl of bun bo.
The great food spots in VN are usually in the alleys, and it includes this one! The broth is light and flavorful, simply delicious. Good food, reasonable prices, friendly service. We'll be back!

I don't know why this place is not famous yet. A hidden shop and we found it by accident on google maps and decided to just give it a try. Oh my goodness, the Bun Bo Hue is mind blowing!!!! The broth is so deep and tasty. The whole bowl of noodle is just another level. Add some chili and some lime to it and you will be smiling when you leave the restaurant.

* edited: adding to this comment because yesterday after our meal, we were raving about the superb meal that we've decidedly to come back again the next day. That shows how good the bowl of noodles was. 2 thumbs up!

Nostaglic place cos it is very local Vietnamese noodle outlet selling Bun Bo Hue which a noodle soup with pork trotter and meat. .mostly patronise by locals and operator.are very friendly and accomodating. it is located in district 3 in the back alley about a 15 mins walk from Cabana Saigon Hotel.

A Taste of Childhood: Rediscovering B√∫n Ri√™u in Saigon
Stepping into this small b√∫n ri√™u restaurant in Saigon was like stepping back in time ‚Äì in the best possible way. Despite its modest size, the establishment is remarkably well-organized and impeccably clean, creating a comfortable and inviting atmosphere. The staff were incredibly attentive, making sure every diner felt welcome and cared for.
But the real magic happened with the first spoonful of b√∫n ri√™u. For the first time in over 20 years, I experienced the exact taste of the b√∫n ri√™u I remembered from my childhood. It was a wave of nostalgia, a perfect symphony of flavors that transported me back to simpler times. The broth was rich and complex, the crab delicate, and all the accompanying ingredients perfectly fresh.
I'm so grateful to this wonderful restaurant for bringing back such a cherished memory. I genuinely wish them all the best and hope they continue to serve their incredible b√∫n ri√™u for many years to come. If you're searching for an authentic, soulful bowl of b√∫n ri√™u in Saigon, look no further.

One of my favorite restaurants in District 3, Ho Chi Minh City.

The location of the restaurant is opposite the Japanese consulate, on the front of Tran Quoc Thao street, so it is easy to find. Free parking, enthusiastic security.

The restaurant sells northern dishes, I suggest you try the Bun Rieu, Banh Da Cua, and Nom. Although it is a Northern dish, it is seasoned to suit the taste of the Southern people, the seasoning is rich, not too sweet with all kinds of crab and snail meat. What I love the most is the noodle dishes served with a plate of very fresh vegetables.

The space is casual, the tables and chairs are low. If you go in a large group, you need to book a table in advance to avoid the situation of running out of tables, especially during peak hours. The space is open but still has air conditioning, so the atmosphere is cool and airy.

Thank you for reading my review,
Have a nice day

We tried their signature B√∫n Thang C√¥ Ba, B√∫n M·ªçc, and B√∫n Ch·∫£ Gi√≤ Nem ‚Äî each dish was flavorful, fresh, and beautifully presented. The portions are generous, and the prices are very reasonable for the quality you get.

If you‚Äôre looking for authentic, delicious Vietnamese noodle dishes in District 3, this is definitely a must-try spot!

Stumbled across this place looking for a place to have lunch ‚Äî tucked away in an alleyway, don‚Äôt be fooled by it‚Äôs location! I had the Bun Thang Chi Ba and it was phenomenal :-). Bun thang is traditionally a northern Vietnamese soup with vermicelli. Even though my mum is from the South, she used to make it all the time so I was really craving it.

The best part about this soup is that it has the scrambled eggs. The broth is clear and flavorful, the shredded chicken, and pork.

I even got an extra side of scrambled eggs.

It hit the spot. They also sell cha gio and nem which sold out when I went but I‚Äôll come earlier next time to get it. I asked the guy normally what time they sell out and he said around 12pm.

The only slight let down is that it doesn‚Äôt seat too many people so I imagine it would be super packed in the morning.

We went to get a breakfast and it was so lovely. Soup was clean, tasty and generous portion.
Good price and friendly service as well.
I have saved this place on the map for next visit when i come back to Saigon.

We had bun Thanh and bun moc with 2 bottle of herbal tea for breakfast. It was delicious and delightful.
Recommend people who want to have not too heavy breakfast. And for people who is not good with cilantro and coriander, you can request them not to put in.
The service can speak English as well and it was really kind and thoughtful of him to explain to us everything.
Great clean little spot for breakfast or lunch. The Bun Thang was legit tasty and the broth was super clean and fresh with a great balance of salty and slightly sweet. Would 100% recommend

Decent place that serves beefball noodle soups (Bun bo vien). Honestly speaking, one of the best place in town for beefballs, since they are made with a special recipe invented by the owner. Cheap price is another plus.

Verdict: definitely worth a visit!

Pro tip: my favorite dishes (for a person): a beefball noodle, a beefball-only, and a glass of sugarcane juice! Yummy!

I absolutely loved the Phu Quoc style glass noodles with fish and pork. Everything was fresh, warm and so good. Will keep coming back for sure.

They sell b√∫n qu·∫≠y, a rice noodles dish in broth, with various toppings. I ordered the bowl with fish paste and shrimp paste. The shrimp paste was ok but the fish paste was very delicious. It was springy, luscious, and flavorful. The broth was very light, not greasy, and came out pipping hot for you to dip your vegetables in. You have to use the red sauce that they bring out with your bowl since it provides the extra sweet and sour kick that really makes this simple dish special. You can put some of it in the broth, dip your toppings in it, pour it on your noodles, etc. I recommend trying out the suggestions on how to enjoy this dish to the fullest on posters along the walls.

BEWARE!!!!

Got food poisoning after eating at this restaurant on my first night in hcm. Soup was cold and meat tasted fake like what the other reviews mentioned.

Not only that, we were charged for 3 bowls when we only ordered 2. Each bowl was also not cheap for vietnam standards.

In terms of taste - it was nothing spectacular and was very plain. Definitely not worth the food poisoning, please think twice before visiting.

Prices are a bit high but the food is tasty and the regular bowls are quite large. There‚Äôs a lot of meat in a standard bowl and the coffee is pretty good. My only problem was that the music was very loud for 7am in the morning. Service was reasonably fast and there‚Äôs space for motorbike parking available on the sidewalk.

I went here near opening hours ,got the whole place to myself and must say the vibes are immaculate. The sound of birds chirping, bikes running by, people strolling in the morning. IT WAS AMAZING!

I ordered the special bun bo bowl.
The broth flavor profile is the opposite of pho, it was very very fragrant, like an explosion of flavor in your mouth, but in a positive way :)
Most of the toppings are well seasoned, only 1 type of meatball is overly sweetened which i didn't finish
The sliced beef is a tad on the drier side

Overall this is a good place to experience the
various flavors of vietnam cuisine have to offer

Ps: BEWARE of the fried chili paste. A good dollop + chilli slices was put in and immense regret afterwards. I could not maintain eye contact with the customer and server walking by because how ugly i looked trying to finish the meal :)))))

The signature bun bo was really good! I enjoyed the different varieties of meatloaf that they offer. The egg noodle variety was also very good, both are fantastic options if youre looking for a quick meal.
a bit on the pricier side but nonetheless it was good and the portion was big. just wanted the meat to be a bit more tender but overall i enjoyed it.

Welp, there were some issues‚Ä¶
Food: bun bo hue tasted good with delicious toppings, but the broth was cold. The other b√°nh, on the other hand, were very good!
Service: okay at least, but the employees have very little communications between each other.
Atmosphere: not too noisy as I thought, which is on the good side.
The best Bun Bo Hue I‚Äôve ever tried, and I‚Äôve been to Hue! Rich, meaty, and herby. Must try.

Went in on a Friday night at 7:40pm (not busy - 2 tables occupied) Asked if they had bun thit nuong. Lady got the Girl who spoke English and said yes that it will take 12 minutes. Told me to sit. Got a tea. Waited 20+ minutes. Never received food. 2 tables came in after me and received their food minutes later. Drank entire tea. Lady came around and gave me extra tea. Still no food. Looked like they simply forgot. 25ish total minutes later I received it. Not sure what took forever, put the noodles in the fridge to get cold? Anyways, the food tasted good, and the lady who filled my tea came up to me to show me how to properly mix the bowl and eat it (I didn‚Äôt ask - she‚Äôs just friendly). Even brought over extra toppings without asking.
Overall, tasty food, nice setting, just my experience went a little different.
65,000vnd/$2.67

B√∫n B√≤ Hu·∫ø Nam Giao stands out as one of the best Hu·∫ø restaurants I‚Äôve visited so far. The b√∫n b√≤ is exceptionally flavorful, with the broth perfectly seasoned to achieve an authentic taste. The vegetables are fresh, enhancing the overall quality of the dish. Despite the restaurant's modest d√©cor, the excellent food justifies a 5-star rating.

Be aware of them scamming you: they bring you a wet tissue and charge you for it at the end!!!!! And there are no other t
issues on the table!!!! When you eat on the street you even get tissues for free and better quality for half the price. Iwas left disappointed. The noodles are quite expensive for what they are; the meat is not meaty but you get instead some sort of poor cuts and cartilage. I ate better for half the price at other places. And be aware of the scam. They also put a dish with banana leaves on the table that I haven‚Äôt ordered- now I know why: they expected me to touch it unknowingly so they can charge me!!!! Spread the word and boycott these thiefs

the food is quite overpriced here, prob due to it being in a touristy area. 2x the standard prices but the taste is just okay. quite disappointed in their noodles soups. a bit too sweet for my taste. the banh beo and banh bot loc are better imo.

I happened to pass by this restaurant and decided to have lunch here after browsing their seemingly interesting menu. It was my first time trying these dishes. Perhaps it was just my personal liking, I didn't quite enjoy the food.  The Hue style beef noodle soup was slightly too sweet and sour for me. As for the steamed rice cakes with assorted toppings, the cakes were still a little sticky to the bite and tasted too oily.
I like this one, but seems not too much meat for the Bun Bo as expected. I got my banh beo good.

Food was decent for the price.
It's not hard to provide free tissues ,  even footpath stalls or take away stalls have them for free.
Instead, they  place wet tissues on the table for you, without saying anything or any indication on the menu and then charge 3,000 each when you leave.

Tried their special Bun Bo, it was interesting, kept hearing that Pho and Bun Bo are the best,  now that I tried it, I can say that it‚Äôs definitely different, still prefer the Pho but definitely good to try this as well if you haven‚Äôt already.
The place is very local, so you get to experience the true feeling and the traditional food
Very nice bowl of Bun Bo Hue in saigon. Broth was flavourful and not oily. Lots of different cuts of meat. Highly recommend.

The food seemed nice until my dad found a dead rat inside the soup while eating. We all stopped immediately and asked the owner if having the rat in the soup was normal, as I heard some people do eat rat. He nervously said "yes," not wanting nearby guests to overhear. Therefore, I don't believe it was intended to be there, and he denied responsibility.

If the rat is really supposed to be in the soup, be aware of it if you choose to eat there.

Hue style Beef noodle soup (Special)
If you looking for good noodle soup with spice, this is the place for you. The green chilies look harmless but it really spice up your taste buds. Because I‚Äôm travelling here, the service staff will ask you if you want the vegetable raw or cook, definitely they will control my diet, so I don‚Äôt over order even I actually can eat more (prevent wasting food) üòÇ.

I think this restaurant serves the best Bun Bo Hue in HCMC. The soup has the best flavor, and the meats and noodles are made fresh daily. I always go here for breakfast every time I'm in HCMC üëçüèª
Nice and clean restaurant with delicious Bun Bo Hue in Ho Chi Minh City. Stop by and have a try. The price is reasonable.

0x31752f78d3e916d7:0xfad9616d75ef7c2c.comment:
Follow @bredgyeats for more food pics!

Served bubbling hot in a stone bowl, this deeply beefy broth with an aromatic lemongrass undertone that clings beautifully to the chewy rice noodles, served with the tender beef ribs that easily fell off the bone, with a robust beefiness, along with the bouncy beef balls. However, the toppings don't stop, the crab meatballs have a subtle seafood sweetness, plus the slices of brisket, rare beef and snappy tendons. Its neutral beef flavour is heightened with your choice of condiments, from a classic fish sauce, chili salt, or fermented fish sauce to elevate your bite. They'll bring a serving of Vietnamese yogurt unprompted, renowned for its silky smooth and light mouthfeel, with a more pronounced tang and sweetness than what I know in the West. Just remember, you'll have to pay for it.
Absolutely delicious, I had the 4 treasures bowl üòã so yummy. The broth is the best I have in my life. And I'm French, we know what savoury means....
Excellent bowl! So happy they had M·∫Øm Ru·ªëc for dipping. Fast service, very delicious.

Second visit to this place, had Bo Kho previously which was okay. This time we ordered Bun Bo Tho Da, definitely the star of the shop, broth was flavourful, beef cuts fresh and plenty for the price, served piping hot in a heated stone bowl. The condiments here are worth a mention too, the sate and pickled onions complements the bun well. Awesome lunch:)

I was really excited to try this place. I had pho in a stone bowl but never bbh in a stone before. I ordered the special and opted no pork bone. Soup was scorching hot as expected. There were a lot innards which I didn‚Äôt eat and had to throw it out. I did give it a try but it tasted ‚Äòdirty‚Äô. Maybe it was a bad day for them or I wasn‚Äôt feeling it. I was expecting a lot and felt it was just average. Random spots that sells bbh tasted better in my opinion. Still good but not great.
